text: Our first time here and we were not disappointed. The food was amazing and the staff was friendly and helpful. We ordered the Yojie's cut and Kobe beef with sukiyaki broth. The broth was sweet and delicious and the beef was so tender. We weren't sure about dipping the beef in raw egg after you cook it in the broth but it was surprisingly good. It balanced out the sweetness from the broth. Afterwards you can put your veggies and noodles in the broth to make some soup. :) cant wait to come back.
The service is very good and informative, however this is the first shabu restaurant that I've been to that charges for the swish sauce!!!

Before anyone decides to read this review here is a disclaimer you need to read...I have never eaten here before...Jo Koy was the guest on the podcast of Tiger Belly and I immediately knew this restaurant was going to be 5 stars...Go Mammoth Meat! $10,000 a slice!

My husband and I got addicted to Shabu Shabu and Sukiyaki while being stationed in Japan... And this place is the perfect spot to cure our withdrawals!! Not only is the food absolutely amazing but the staff is incredible as well. After meeting the bright, kind, and impressive co-owner Jo Koy we are fans for life. So glad it's in Vegas because this place is awesome in every way.

This place is so much fun. The staff are all extremely great. So helpful and have great personalities. 
The quality of the meat is unrivaled. I have had the Kobe, salmon, and Berkshire pork and they are tasty enough to eat raw on their own. 
I opt for spicy miso broth, but the others are just as tasty. Don't skip dessert! Green tea white chocolate is like a delicious soft caramel. Love this place. Worth the drive from the strip. 
Tip: take an uber. It was $16 vs $43 in a cab.

Sooo happy Yojie is in Vegas! I love hot pot and haven't been satisfied with any of the hot pot places in Vegas so far ;(  Yojie's meat is very tasty and their sauces are great!  I love the sukiyaki broth!  I will keep coming to this place and no longer crave the hot pot places in Hawaii so much lol!

A must try place in Vegas. I ordered combo with pork and yojie beef. It was the best shabu shabu experience ever (given I had plenty in the past). Thinly sliced meat to ensure it can be cooked easily, yet maintaining the tenderness. Broth is rich but not heavy. Unlimited refill of rice (brown or white). Great mix of sauce for the meat. A bowl of mixed veggies and udon was included. Bottom line is, both pork and beef are very tender, good portion, and great combination of food. To top it off, staff was very friendly, passionate and helpful. I would highly recommend this place even if u are just visiting vegas for fun!

As I considered this review I wanted to be as fair as possible, I went based on a comedian I follow who hyped up his restaurant and as an avid shabu shabu customer the first place I wanted to hit once I arrived to Las Vegas was this joint! Well let just say everything was subpar! My veggies were old and rotting, the meat I ordered (yojié's cut) looked old with brown spots and what was suppose to be upgraded meat (prime rib) that my wife ordered was more fat than meat! Our server spent more time talking with her friends who were right next to us the servicing us! She even commented on how expensive the Kobé beef and wagyu was at this place and they should try it some where else! I mean really! (We had actually considered ordering it to try it, thanks for sharing that!), don't get me wrong not everything was bad, the sukiyaki with the dripping egg  was awesome (never tried it b4), and the place looked amazing! Yet I always told myself I wouldn't write a negative review unless it was totally merited and this place unfortunately did deserve this review. Sorry yojié
Nice helpful staff.   Great prices for what you get.   No current liquor license.   Atmosphere was pretty good.

If you have never had an asian fondue experience, you can walk through these doors confident and adventurous. The servers here are very well informed and love telling new customers everything there is to know about this amazingly delicious fondue experience. Our server's name was Carl, and he was awesome at showing us the ropes.

The atmosphere is grand for a small space. There is a lovely modern look inside an intimate bar-style area, and you even get the choice of picking a high or low top chair!!! As a shortie, I chose the latter.

I have yet to try their meat options, but will be doing so very soon. this trip, I ordered the veggie medley with the spicy miso broth. I loved the variety of hearty vegetables I got, and it made a wonderful To-go soup after my fondue experience!! If you like things added with an extra kick, they have an awesome punch to add to your fondues and sauces. ;)

All in all, this place is great. The servers are friendly and excited to work here, and the atmosphere is comfortable. I love that I found a late night spot to eat something healthy. Next on my check list when I come back, green tea white chocolate fondue, salmon fondue, and hopefully some yummy cocktails (when they get their liquor license).

Been here a couple of times and will definitely be back.  I like the vibe of this place and service is pretty good.  I always go with the sukiyaki and a combination of meats.  The last time I went, they were out of the pasteurized egg and pork belly, which was a little disappointing but it happens.  Won't stop me from coming back but hopefully it will be available next time.

TOP NOTCH CUSTOMER SERVICE! The food was amazing! What better place to go to when you just want to chill out with your girlfriend at a restaurant with amazing food watching Godzilla on tv than Yojié?! Love this place!

We got the Wagyu at ~$25 an ounce... ouch! But man was it good. Also got the pork. Overall I think it's a little pricey but still fun. We stopped about a week ago and they didn't have their liquor license yet but said they should in the next couple of weeks. We'll be back. The serving "bar" is really long so if you have more than 3-4 people you might be too spread out to talk to the person on the end

Tried this place out for the first time yesterday and now I'm obsessed! I love shabu shabu but most places don't have flavor. The menu here is so vast and the food is so flavorful! It comes with different dipping sauces that our server Carl explained so well to us. I ordered the spicy miso and the broth was so good, I didn't always need to dip it in the other sauces. Aside from the amazing food, the vibe there is awesome! The workers make you feel so welcome and the owner Anton even came out to help serve and speak to guest which is really rare at other restaurants. I will definitely become a regular here :)

Don't miss dessert- amazing green tea white chocolate fondue & our entrees were great too! Can't wait until they get their liquor license. :-)

The music was too loud for comfortable conversation and didn't fit the restaurant.

I ordered the Geisha salmon sashimi. I had 2 dipping sauces that the waitress recommended. Everything was fresh and tasty. My husband ordered the Samurai Kobe beef. That was amazing and he didn't really like the idea of dipping the meat in the raw egg, but I tried it and it was good. Service was really good and I didn't realize at the time that you can order a combination Geisha size and get another Geisha meat item for just $6 more! Will definitely order that next time and will have to try the white choc green tea fondue dessert.

We came in for lunch with the wife and were blown away. This place isnt just a restaurant, it's an experience! The food was amazing and the staff (Ana and Carl) was attentive and super cool. We will gladly come here again!++

So, let's say compared to other shabu shabu restaurants that I have been to with my family. This got to be one of the nicest and cleanest one we've been to in vegas. The service was top notch and the food was amazing. Especially the yojie cut. It literally melted in your mouth (not in a naughty way, people). The waitress was very knowledgeable and very courteous and polite. Whenever we had questions, she was there and spot on. And got to admit, meeting one of the owners himself, Mr. Jo Koy was just made our day. Just because he is one of the best filipino comedians lol jk. But besides that, just the fact he came out and seeing him interact with the customers made our stay more enjoyable. Thumbs up.

Had a great time here. Staff were inviting and informative and the food was great as well. The fact that they survived a year without a liquor license says a lot about the food, staff and environment. That said, they now have alcohol, so even better.

Really used to enjoy this place until about a month ago when they reduced the quality of the beef by about two grades. A bad move when you consider that they just jacked their prices.

I let them know my dissatisfaction but decided to give them another chance tonight and found that it has gotten worse.

We had this server with purple hair who was clueless.

Found out that they had run out of both cuts of meat that my wife and I wanted.

On top of that, they really short-changed me by giving me only 1/4 of a small mushroom and a few strands of glass noodles to put in the broth.

We called a more senior server over and she got me fixed up but I don't like to have to keep complaining to get what I paid for.

We gave them a second chance but now I think of that old adage:
"Fool me one time, shame on you.  Fool me two times, shame on me"

I have a sense that they are not surviving well (mismanaged) and probably won't be around much longer.

So sad, it used to be pretty good, albeit overpriced.

Food is great. I love yojie cut, pork, pork belly. I've tried different soup: spicy miso, sukiyaki, and tonkutsu. Sukiyaki is good, more like sweet side after egg dipping. I like spicy so i go for spicy miso most of the times. Ponzu sauce is perfect with everything. I put more chili oil in there though. I also like swisher sauce so I switched it once a while. Goma sauce is good with veggie but I can live without it.
Service is excellent. Servers always smile and friendly. When they are packed, the service is a little slow but it's understandable. 
The decoration and atmosphere is nice and clean. (I love purple and white so they win lol) 
The price is good compare to the portion. One order of meat fills me. It is just perfect. But my bf is a big guy so he usually orders combo. I ordered combo once, I couldn't finish it, and the leftover wasn't that good. I prefer one order of meat and end with Green tea white chocolate plate. I have food orgasm every time I come here.

I created a Yelp account for the sole purpose of reviewing this restaurant (and an alteration shop in the Boca Park area, see next review). 

I have never had shabu shabu before, so I didn't know what to expect coming in for a late lunch during Memorial Day weekend. The restaurant was brand spankin' new and had very modern/contemporary decor. 

Customer service was excellent! The staff was attentive and very helpful with the ordering process. Food was great, and fairly priced. I ordered the Geisha prime rib entree with the spicymiso broth. I also had the Japanese iced coffee, which was a bit small but 'twas delicious nonetheless. Funnyman and partner of the restaurant, Jo Koy, was there that day to support the staff. He interacted with customers and made sure that everyone had an enjoyable experience.

Overall it was a great first shabu shabu experience. I'll definitely be coming back here again.

This place couldn't be anymore delicious! I will forever be a customer! The sukiyaki broth is my all time favorite with the pasteurized egg. If you go for lunch it's less crowded and the prices are a bit cheaper for the same cuts as the dinner menu.

The best shabu shabu in town.

The experience began with a very clean restaurant and amazingly kind staff, we were seated almost immediately. To our surprise the amazing Jo Koy was at the restaraunt to help greet us. Along with being an amazingly funny comedian, he was also a gracious and entertaining host. The rest of the staff was extraordinarily nice, and any questions or requests we had were answered with a smile

The food was outstanding. My friends and I had the sukiyaki and the spicy miso. The sukiyaki was a lightly sweated, robust teriyaki flavor which fit perfectly with the raw pasturized egg served on the side. The spicy miso was very robust miso soup style taste, however, the sauce was the star of the show. The sauces were a sesame sauce, and the goma sauce. Along with the miso broth, to even out the flavor, it was amazing. The vegetables were fresh and varied,  and tied the meal together.

We finished off the meal with the white chocolate green tea fondue. This was a standard fondue desert, it was absolutely delicious.

The price per plate is about 15 to 25 dollars, this is without alcohol, and for the price, it was amazing.

Thank you Yojie for a wonderful time.

Went here again just a day later! And it is still the best! 
Diana was our server this time and she is just as amazing as Ricky! She was super helpful, quick and efficient! Everyone here is just super friendly! It got pretty busy and she was the only one working but she still manage time to check up on us and asset us. 
This time I got the combo which i notice is a whole lot better deal! In the combo you get a 5pz (geshia) of the yojie cut and the choice of either: pork belly, salmon, chicken or pork. Just for a couple of bucks more than the regular yojie cut. So more bang for your buck!! 
And always got the green tea white chocolate matcha! ^.^

Was so good and a cute-small japanese hot-pot spot! The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because we were there and sitting by the seats by the front door and people kept coming in and out and the freezing cold air kept interrupting our meal and made us cold and uncomfortable. I would go back but not accept a seat that is near the front. They also didn't serve any alcoholic beverages which was interesting because they had it on their menu :/
Very good, I enjoyed everything I tried, and the green tea white chocolate fondue was amazing! I can't wait to go back

I am sad to have left Vegas just because of this place. In the days prior to my departure, I ate here twice after my last review. Service was on point. Refills were kept. Fantastic. Based on my receipt, marieanne, you are awesome. She remembered the essentials to my order, coke and no vegetables. I heart you, you deserve boba. Vegas or SoCal boba on me. I will definitely be making a trip back here next time i am in Vegas. I still crave the waygu!

Great place to eat at! The food comes out quick and its fresh! A very fun experience to enjoy your food. I do not recommend coming in with a large party because the set up is like a bar. All the workers are great with awesome customer service! I would come back here again!

Best shabu in town! I really enjoy the atmosphere and the service is great. I had a great experience here and really liked the food. Their veggies and kobe were top notch! I couldn't remember my servers name (I think it was Jerry?), but he was great. I would definitely recommend to try this place out!

Oh my lord! My boyfriend and I were so excited for Yojié to open! This place is AWESOME. They greet you at the door and the service from there on out is amazing. They explain the menu to you and then show you how everything works. The food is DELICIOUS. We ordered all the house specialties and everything was worth it! I can't wait to come back again!
The service was amazing and so was the food! I had the sukiyaki broth with yojie beef and were a great mix. I would definitely recommend this place!

First timer here! Clean and cute restaurant.  Meats, sauces, and cooking soup was delicious! Mika and Anna were awesome! Very polite and courteous :) I got the sukiyaki with the samurai (16 pieces) yojie's cut - highly recommend. The sukiyaki sauce came with a "pasteurized egg" for a dipping sauce. I thought it was weird at first but it was very tasty. The samurai size and all the sides that came with it were really filling.

I came here a few days ago and I wasn't impressed. There was nothing special about the atmosphere nor the food. I sat in the back of the restaurant and it was poorly lit since they depended on the natural sunlight to come in. I ordered the Yojie cut with sukiyaki broth. I was charged $2 extra for this soup which was misleading because I thought the egg was what tagged on the additional dollars and I didn't want the egg. Since I live on the opposite side of town, I would rather go to a shabu shabu restaurant in Chinatown, which is much closer to me, and I get the same food. The pots of broth are just sitting on the shelf, and to me that sounds like an opportunity for bacteria to grow throughout the day since it's not refrigerated. The service wasn't that great either. I think the waitress I had was new since she seemed inexperienced. I also saw her taking selfies behind the register which is very unprofessional.

Awesome customer service. Staff is very friendly, accommodating, and bubbly. Our server, Carl, was nice enough to to give us a crash course on the "how to" with shabu shabu since it was our first time. Will definitely recommend this place to family and friends.

Omg this place is sooo good atmosphere is over the top amazing the servers are so friendly they treat you as if your one of there good friends and food are soooooo mind blowingly good. Sokiyaki sauce is so good with pork belly. Really fun amazing experience and delicious food. Price are not bad as well so amazing definatly gona keep on coming back!!

1st time to try Shabu Shabu Japanese Fondue! The atmosphere has good vibes. Staff very friendly and helpful! The menu has good selection of items. Food was very tasty. I like the swish swish action. Desserts was Yummay! Had the Green Tea White Chocolate Fondue Platter - must have! Overall Good!
Michael our server was great!  The food and service was excellent.  Would come back again.

In one week in vegas we stopped by 3 times. We just couldn't resist the great quality of the meat. One of the best I ever tasted in a long time !
I would definitely recommend you their sukiyaki kobe beef !
Also great service ! Hope to come back for my next trip in vegas !

If I could, I would give this place a 3 1/2 stars. We ordered the prime rib shabu shabu. 

Hospitality and Facility - 5 stars
Food Quality - 5 stars
Bang for the Buck - 3 stars
Flavor - 3 1/2 stars

This is in comparisons to a similar place that's on Sahara and another location (which we prefer) on Spring Mountain.

Pros, the staff was very friendly. The owner was walking around and talking with the crowd. The waitress was attentive and made sure we were enjoying our dining experience. The restaurant was very clean but that is to be expected for being in business for two weeks and is closer than the other place we go to. The decor was modern and they have induction cooktops (really loved this fact, didn't get that hot in the restaurant and little safer if you have kids). Depending on the entree ordered, you can choose up to four different "meat" serving sizes. 

Cons, pricier than the other place we go to. Just like other places, seating is limited. Tried making reservations but got an answering machine with generic message. 

But at the end of the day the ponzu and goma sauces is what makes the food and we prefer the sauces from the other place we go to. 

For the convenience and atmosphere I would come back. For the price and flavor I would rather drive to the one we usually go to on Spring Mountain.

We ate here twice and the food is decent but nothing spectacular.  Pricing is comparable to similar hot pot places but there is a $6 sharing cost.  Our first visit was pleasant and enjoyable and our server was attentitve and organized.  But the second visit, on the following day, was a big downer.  If the days were switched, there would not be a repeat visit. 

We sat down in the midst of uncleared dishes and left-over food all around us and it remains that way throughout our dining.  Very unsightly and dampens our appetite for sure and I counted no less than three workers all looking at the dirty dishes.  Where is the manager to pitch in ?  We have to remind our server for everything from sauces to utensils while we watched a boiling pot.  The rice on both days were cold and hard.  When the rice has this big clumps, it can only mean one thing - it has seen its days!   This place looks promising at first but we don't plan to be back for awhile.

When I read that this restaurant was affiliated with Jo Koy, I was excited to try this place. I'm a huge fan of Jo Koy.  However, I was disappointed in the sauce. We ordered the sukiyaki and the broth was overwhelmingly sweet. I understand everyone has a different flavor palette and for my boyfriend and I, we just couldn't tolerate the broth. I diluted it many times with water and I still couldn't pass the sweetness. If you like a broth that's very sweet then the sukiyaki is the way to go. The portions are definitely decent. The ambiance was interesting. The music was a bit loud and I felt like I was at a nightclub even though it was daylight but I think that ambiance would be good for anyone wanting a quick bite to eat before heading out to paint the town red.

This was my first time eating 'hot pot' style. We decided to share and it was just enough food. I would probably add some extra meat next time. 

We chose Yojie's cut (angus beef) and pork belly from the combo plate. Sharing is only an additional $4.99 and you get your own rice (white or brown), sauce, and personal pot. We had shabu shabu pot and spicy miso pot. I preferred the miso - it gave the meat a little kick. Shabu was boiling water.

They don't have a liquor license yet so we couldn't order any beer/sake.

They explain the process if you are new to this style of eating. Very friendly and helpful.

I gotta say prior to today I only used Yelp only for searching restaurants. This is probably one of my only comments I'll ever make.
Yojie is an amazing restaurant not only for the great food but great service. I lived in Japan for 3 years and can vouch this is fantastic shabu-shabu. When you go into Yojie you're not just eating an amazing clean meal but having an experience with a great staff and fun environment. Jo Koy and his staff are hands down the best in Vegas. Yojie is a must for either a date night or family meal.

Best shabu shabu in LV (and maybe anywhere) hands down!

If you're looking for the same style of shabu shabu that you would find in California (e.g. Shabuway, California Shabu Shabu, among others), you will find it at Yojié. According to their website they have 4 California locations and this one location in LV. 

The ordering process is simple, and similar to other shabu shabu places. First, choose your size and type of protein. I recommend going with the samurai (7 oz) portion if you are hungry. We've normally gone with the Yojie's cut beef, which has been well marbled and a great cut. Then, choose your broth. I recommend the spicy miso! Really flavorful and delicious.

One thing that sets Yojié apart is that they offer chocolate fondue for dessert. The green tea white chocolate fondue is absolutely to die for, and will keep me coming back!

After hearing great reviews of this restaurant, we finally gave it a shot on a Friday night.  We enjoyed the fresh food; and the female servers were attentive and down-to-earth. I loved the clean and modern decor of the restaurant, which offered cozy seating arrangement. We can't wait to try the dessert chocolate fondue on our next visit. Here comes the constructive criticism:  the ribeye cut in the Geisha size pot was too expensive for 5 oz. of meat. The Yojie cut of beef offered more value for your buck, which was leaner and tasted just as good. My husband said that it was annoying that the restaurant opened for a year, but continues to list liquor on the menu, albeit they have not secured a liquor license yet.

I don't think any review I leave will do this place justice. Not only is the food delicious, but the customer service is simply amazing! I had no prior knowledge of what a shabu shabu restaurant is, so I didn't know what quite to expect. My friends & I were definitely in great hands though. The employees were knowledgeable, willing to teach, and were very attentive. Not only that, but their whole vibe was great! You could tell the employees were enjoying their time working which made the experience wonderful & worth sharing. I can't wait to go back. It's a little pricey, but worth every penny! So you, reading this review, stop now & just go, go, GO!

Once again, I've come here and was not disappointed! From the accommodating and friendly staff to the timely manner the food came out, everything was wonderful.

I always come back to the prime rib with the Sukiyaki dip and it always hits the craving. The beef is tender and the Sukiyaki is the perfect combination of sweetness and saltiness that accentuates the natural flavors of the beef. Boiling the udon noodles in the Sukiyaki is wonderful as well, as the noodles soaks up the flavors of the broth. 

This time around, I tried the Green Tea White Chocolate fondue with fruits and pastries. The white chocolate is a bit sweet, but the tartness of the strawberries and the subtle sweetness of the bananas are a good contrast to the chocolate. It is also accompanied by homemade marshmallows that are perfectly fluffy and surprisingly not too sweet. Everyone should try their fondue at least once!

This place is great ! Some of the best Japanese food I've had in a while . Defiantly gonna be back and not just for the food but their service ! Azaleiha and Vhalery were the ones who took care of my friends and I . Keep up the good work and thanks again ladies !
I'm giving this place 1 star because of the waitress that works at this place , she had very bad behavior , so she's a waitress " supposed to treat people nice "
So delicious. If you've never been, they explain the process and get you started. We got the Kobe and Waygu beef - splurge! We will definitely be back.

Yesterday, we tried this restaurant since it has good reviews on yelp.... for me, first impression is really important. Like, is the restaurant clean and are the people accommodating, etc.... when we first came into the door, the tables were dirty... and i would understand that they haven't cleaned it due to high volume of customers. But there were like 4 customers eating at that time. We stood there without anyone asking us to be seated (and theres a sign that says wait to be seated). So we let that go and finally,  the girl who guided us to our table. She asked us if it was our first time there and we said yes... we were assuming that she would tell us about their menu but she didnt.... it took forever for our orders and the people who were working there were very loud that made us uncomfortable. The food was not bad but was not that great either. We said we will not come back to that restaurant again...
Pretty good place. So far the best Shaba Shaba place this far in Las Vegas. It's a comfortable atmosphere. Decent portion meats. It's a hit for our kids.

This was my first time trying shabu shabu. I loved it. Service here is excellent starting with a friendly greeting as soon as you walk in the door. The servers are very informative on how it all works and super attentive throughout the meal. 

The food was fresh and delicious. Full of great flavors and the meat was fresh. We ordered the pork belly, yojie cut and kobe beef with spicy miso and tonkotsu broths. Portions were hearty. 

Also tried the green tea white chocolate for dessert, but wish I had just gotten regular milk chocolate. Glad I tried something different as it sounded intriguing, but was just ok. 

Dinner and dessert for two came in at under $100, not bad. We felt stuffed at the end

Overall, it was an awesome dinner and we will definitely be back again. Great experience and tasty food!

This place is seriously amazing. Fun and something different and to top it all off healthy food. Jo, the owner, was friendly, hilarious and fun to talk to. The staff were all friendly and accommodating. Really great service and atmosphere. Haniza Ariana (girl with the purple hair) Is fun and great to talk to. We had the chicken sukiyaki which also comes with pasteurized egg dipping sauce. Now it may sound strange but it's so delicious. All the veggies were good. We the. Decided to indulge with some desert. The green tea white chocolate fondue is seriously to die for. Everything was superb. Definitely coming back soon. Our new favorite spot. 

Thanks again Jo.
I don't know how I missed the fact that the owner is in fact a famous comedian that I saw frequently on Chelsea Handler show. So sorry Jo.

Never had Chinese hot pot or even Melting Pot before but this is a great find! Small amount of seating so it never feels overly crowded which I enjoy. Menu is simple and servers are all extremely knowledgable and are willing to explain if needed. Spicy Miso is my favorite with the Yojie Cut, yum! Don't forget to try their awesome Green Tea white chocolate fondue! So so amazing! Worth trying you'll end up loving it!

This is a Shabu Shabu restaurant where you get to cook your own meal.  Choice of broth: Spicey Miso, Tonkotsu (pork broth) or water.  Order the type and kind of meat which is cut paper thin and get vegetables  and udon and tofu to cook in the broth.  They also give you a choice of dips such as sesame, ponzu or a soy sauce.  

This is served with a bowl of rice and you can ask for more and they gladly accommodate you at no additional charge.  It was very good except I wish they would give more udon noodles, tofu and Nappa Cabbage.  We had to order additional noodles and Vegetables as in down home cooking the vegetables is as much the star of the meal as the meat.
Delicious food and amazing service. Our waitress was such a sweetheart and very helpful. I can not wait to come back here! A++++++!

Being fans of Jo Koy, we decided to check out his restaurant Yojie. 

The restaurant had a modern decor to it with interesting asian art on the walls. The shabu area is setup like a bar so you are eating at a counter instead of a table. It kind of makes it hard to talk to people if you have a party of 3 or more. One thing I loved about the restaurant is that each seat area had a usb adapter where you can charge your phone while you eat. I am glad they though of that. I think every restaurant should have that. 

The food was good and the portions was just right. It was enough to fill us up. Prices are similar to other shabu-shabu places. 

The service was great. The servers were very attentive and friendly.

A small but cozy place, modern design. We went for Yakisoba broth/ samurai Kobe beef and Tonkotsu/ salmon . Both of the broths were good, carried rich and deep flavor. The portion was decent. $42 for 7 oz of Kobe beef wasn't bad. I would knock 1 star of because the salmon wasn't fresh. It was obviously frozen salmon that had dull/ dark color but the awesome waitress was so nice, totally made it up with her possible, fast friendly service. There were only 2 server but they were fast and helpful.

LOVE the 80's music.. sooo Jo Koy...  I had the Spicy miso broth was great... the chili was KILLER!! but I love spicy !! Price for the amount of meat could be better... than shabu in LA ..plates were bigger with more meat for around same price... but overall good for the cold weather...

My first shabu shabu experience was at the Yojie Artesia location while visiting Cali cousins and it was AMAAAAZING. I had such a wonderful dining experience and when I heard they were opening a Las Vegas location, I freaked out from excitement!

The overall experience was the same-- a U-shaped bar if you're trying shabu shabu or sukiyaki and some non-bar tables for other food items. The menu looked slightly different. There were some new items (Wagyu, Pork Belly, Swisher sauce, etc) that I didn't see at the Artesia location and also, the prices were higher. Then again, Vegas is always expensive so I wasn't entirely shocked.

I always opt for Samurai Yojie's Cut Shabu Shabu. 7 oz. of delicious meat, although I think I could still kill the Sumo (10 oz.) if I'm a hungry hippo. It comes with the sliced meat, brown or white rice, assorted fresh vegetables, broth, tofu, noodles & 2 sauces (Goma is life!). Swish swish and cook that meat, dip them in your sauces & devour them along with your veggies as you wish. Service is excellent so make sure to ask to customize your overall meal with various seasonings if you love it spicy.

Even with all the food, my friend & I had room for dessert & we ordered the Green Tea White Chocolate with Strawberries and Banana. I almost licked the bowl clean; it was that good. My palate was as happy as my belly. It was a good ending to a yummy meal.

Yojie is a little pricey but the excellent customer service, friendly ambiance, delicious food are worth it. This place is all in all just good vibes! And you never know, you might be able to meet the co-owner, the ever hilarious comedian Jo Koy while dining there. ;)

Do not go here if you are not prepared to start obsessing about the different soup bases and combinations. They only offer a few selections and choices, and each is essentially perfect. The Tonkatsu Base in my opinion is heaven in a bowl. Combined with the fresh veggies, and amazing salmon, pork belly, Kobe Beef, or Wagyu Beef (your choice) produce a meal in which you will remember for time to come. It is the type of place that ruins your old standby spot to Shabu Shabu, no more Yoji has taken it to the next level.

Combined with the amazing staff and those beautiful smiles you can't go here just once. You immediately start to wonder if you ordered the correct combination of sauces and meats, or could added too little or too much sesame. Can you achieve the perfect soup base to which your life will change forever? These are epic goals that you get to experiment with in this amazing little spot.
 
Only downside? It is cold in there this time of year. You will start to wonder if you are exhibiting the symptoms of hypothermia, and then in just the nick of time, one of the beautiful Geishas of Yoji, drop off a cart of magical food and turn on the lifesaving tiny heat source. The burner will eventually boil your soup base, producing a steaming caldron that lets you know, you are going to make it. Then you start the process of filling your slightly frozen body with the heavenly bliss of hot soup and the experience is divine. 

Highly recommend this place and in fact, I want to go there right now.

Great place to take a date for an amazing experience!! Each seat has its own stove and cook your food. The broth, is quiet tasty and the sauces are fantastic. The dessert with the white chocolate green tea is amazing. Staff is friendly and nice!

I owe Yojié an updated review now that I've become a regular!  

As promised, I went back again and Carl greeted me at the door, "hey! Welcome back!  I promise I won't seat you at the end and I'll take good care of you the WHOLE time. I'll make sure your tea is hot!"  It's a little awkward to be recognized for my critical review, but his desire to change my mind about Yojié was very impressive!  Game on!  

Carl kept his word and refilled my tea with piping hot water throughout my meal.  He was attentive to our needs and took care of me from start to finish. 

We've become regulars, visiting about 2-4 times per month.  Although Yojié is much more pricey than other shabu shabu places in town, their quality in meat & service is much better, so it's worth it if you can afford to treat yourself every now and then.  

Recently I went in and Carl was NOT working. Trust me, this is a very rare occurrence.  He's ALWAYS there.  I was a little hesitant being that the last time he went on a break while I was there, I left feeling like it wasn't that great of an experience.  We decided to stay anyway and we are glad we did!  I can't remember the sweet girls name, but she was great.  She was attentive and helpful, no complaints.  Phew!   

Like any new place in town, it always takes a minute to perfect things...and Yojié has.  It's impressive to me that the server cared enough to read the review that was written, remember me, and accommodate my annoying little complaints.  Lol.  I also think he's become the manager since our first visit, so he's doing a great job in making sure the staff are up to par in their service as well. 

5 stars, Yojié.  Bravo!

I love love love coming here. When I first came to Yojie' I didn't know too much about shabu shabu, but the staff here did a fantastic job catering to my party and explaining everything step by step. If you're hesitant about trying shabu shabu because you don't know what to do, don't worry. The staff at Yojie' has your back. 

Food: 5/5
I really like the Kobe' Beef and dipping it with either the spicy miso or tonkotsu option. But the recommended plate which is the Yojie's Cut is also really good as well! All of the plates come with vegetables, rice, and noodles. The dip here is so satisfying, I always want to come back for more.

The dessert is just as delicious as the entrees! I usually get the fruits and pastries ($7.99) with milk chocolate. The plate it comes out on is decorated so beautifully you almost don't want to eat it. 

Staff: 5/5
A-M-A-Z-I-N-G. Their staff is beyond friendly and helpful! They literally explain everything to you down to the T. They let you know how long to cook the items for, what items are highly recommended, etc. Also, they're quick to tend to your needs. I have never had my water glass empty here. 

Environment: 5/5
The restaurant has a very modern take on it. From the decorations to the set up of the tables. The set up is two rows, one on the left and one of the right and a small section connected to it  all with individual chairs and a stove in front of the chair. There is a middle section for the staff to walk in. I also really enjoy the music they play here, it is very appealing!
Good shabu shabu in vegas. Carl is a cool dude.

Quality was ok but quantity was a joke, especially for the price. I've been to many Shabu restaurants before and this by far is skim on the meat. We've had grass fed beef with thicker cuts and cheaper prices. Here I couldn't even grab a piece without it breaking apart.

Love this place! I've been here several times with my partner and they have never let us down. I suggest the Kobe beef Shabu shabu style. It comes with lots of veggies, rice and some amazing dipping sauces. Sometimes they have the hilarious tv show MXC playing. Very happy they have their liquor license now

Good menu choices, love it that they have salmon on the menu. Very knowledgeable and friendly staff to assist with people who are not too familiar with Shabu Shabu. Worth to try if you are in the Summerlin area.
Finally a legit Shabu Shabu spot in town. The vibe and food here is very legit. I fux with this spot. All day N word!

Took the little brother here since he wanted to try Shabu Shabu. LOL. I didn't have a clue what he was talking about when he asked, but hey... The kid wanted to go there, so we went. 
We were greeted and seated right away by a friendly face. I liked how it was clean, modernly designed and not crowded. The waitress gave us a few minutes to look over the menu. She could tell we were new, so when taking our orders, she gave us a few recommendations that we might like. Quite knowledgeable about their menu. 
The nice part is when she walked us through how to eat the dishes properly, instead of letting us act all crazy and just put everything in the hot pot. LOL. I bet that would've been hilarious, but man... I certainly would've felt dumb. 
It was cool of her to check up on the brother, making sure he had enough broth in the pot for the entire meal. She'd also turn the little stove area down notches once in awhile to keep the stuff from boiling. At the end of the meal, she put our stuff together to bring home, which was pretty much the fixings of udon. 
I had the Samurai portion of the Prime Rib with Spicy Miso, Brown Rice, Ponzu and the Swisher Sauces. The brother had Pork Combo Plate (also comes with Yojie Cut Angus Beef) with Sukiyaki, Pasteurized Egg and White Rice. I like me some Prime Rib, but I wish I had ordered what my brother got. The pork just went so well with the broth, then dipping it into the egg. For dessert, we both had the Ramune Float. Yummy citrus sweetness. Apparently the brother will be copying that dessert for home. 
All in all, if the brother gave me a happy face and said he liked the place for food and customer service, we'll be going back whenever we're in the area.

First time here, I ordered Yojie's Cut in Geisha 5oz plate.  The test is pretty good, but I am such a hot pot shabu person, I am hoping their veggie side can be bigger.  So far is good and loving it.  

Btw, they got real cute girls working here, and they are super friendly and nice.  It really have a good vibe, great job on hiring and train their employees.  They make you feel like they love their job, and want to be here.
Excellent food and service! One of the best restaurants I have been too.  Staff is very friendly and prompt.

This place was awesome.  I have been looking for a good Shabu Shabu place and I think I found it.  I will definitely go back again when I visit.  The price was reasonable for the amount of food you get.  The ponzu sauce was yummy and the vegetables were perfect for the Shabu Shabu.  My friend and I were able to sit down and talk without being rushed out the door.  We didn't get to experience the desert fondue but it sure did look good.  Maybe next time.  The location was easy to get too and we felt safe.

Eh... the service is okay. The word Japanese could probably be taken out of the name. I was super excited to come here because good Shabu Shabu is hard to come by in the states. Well my search continues :/. I ordered the salmon and it came out sloppily cut and thin like lox. Yes LOX. The second I put it in the pot it fell apart and nearly disappeared. I ordered a Kombu base. The kombu had zero flavor, ZERO. The fact that they offered ponzu, raw egg, and goma sauce was nice, but the goma sauce was soooo thIn, it was practically water. They really should offer a small plate to transfer food from pot to sauce/mouth otherwise your sauce gets extremely watered down and messy. 

No utensils, water bath to clean out the pot. 
Arnold palmers made with green tea were good.
Gave the girl a huge tip and we stayed behind for 30 minutes after ate to catch up with friends and she just seemed annoyed and rude.

Sukiyaki is nothing like their sukiyaki.... it was more like an extra sweet teriyaki flavor. Probably won't return here or recommend.
Loved this experience!  Great food and atmosphere!! For certain, a return trip in the making!

I love the idea of shabu shabu, it's a great interactive experience. Very convenient especially during winter time.

SERVICE
The workers welcome you when you walk in. If it's your first time they explain how shabu shabu (Japanese fondue) work and the process of it. They are very knowledgable of the menu, and answer all the questions you may have. Awesome customer service and friendly all around.

FOOD
I got the YojieCut Geisha with white rice, spicy miso broth, and ponzu & goma sauce. The broth is delicious, it's actually spicy compared to most places. The meat quality is wonderful, the price not so much but it's worth it. Dipping the meat in goma sauce brings a wonderful nutty flavor while the ponzu enhances the meat flavor (in my opinion). The rice is refillable and your meal comes with a vegetable bowl (cabbage, carrots, mushroom, onion, broccoli, and seaweed) and noodles (udon and rice noodles). The Ramune float is a great desert because it's refreshing and not too sweet or heavy after your meal. The strawberries and banana fondue with green tea white chocolate is delicious too. 

CONCLUSION
I will be back soon, love the food and atmosphere (very modern and chic).

*Warning: Long Review*

Let me start by saying that both my boyfriend and i REALLY enjoyed our experience at Yojie! 

Neither one of us had ever been to a Japanese fondue spot before, but I insisted on this place for his birthday a couple of weeks ago. I was curious to try it, and, i must admit, we both like Jo Koy, so the fact that he is  the owner helped persuade him.  

It was a Wednesday evening, so we weren't surprised it was a slow night for them. We had the awesome ambience and 90's r&b music all to ourselves. Perfect for our date... When we got there, we were immediately greeted by our server, Michael. When we told him it was my bf's birthday, he brought out a cute little wooden block that says "Happy Birthday" on it...

We explained it was our first time there, so Michael was VERY accommodating and explained how Japanese fondue works.  He even let us record him for social media purposes! He's very sweet, and helpful and a total cutie pie. I also appreciated that he and his other coworkers were very attentive and joked with us a lot along the way. I appreciate good customer service, and they provided it. 

The food is excellent. We went with a combination platter that Michael recommended with the beef and pork and paired it with the egg sauce, Shabu shabu.  The combination platter was big enough to feed both of us and it was only $24.99 ! I don't know how they stay in business, maybe with people that eat more than us. 

What ABSOLUTELY made our night, though, was the fact that Jo Koy and his wife came in for a late night dinner! My boyfriend couldn't stop cheering the entire time.  seriously, if you don't know who this guy is, you should! That way, if he happens to walk in on your visit there, you can fangirl like we did and ask him for selfies and snapchat videos! Which he will gladly comply to btw, he's cool like that. He even treated us to a complimentary dessert for the occasion. It was a green tea- white chocolate fondue with delicious fruit, brownies, marshmallows, etc. I was in love!  

Hope your experience is as awesome as ours was. Say Marcela sent you! It won't mean anything to them, but it'll make me feel special :P

Place is very hip. Went here to try out JoKoy's resto. Glad we did. You pick your meat then pick a broth (sukiyaki, spicy miso, tonkotsu or shabu-shabu). We all picked kobe beef which was sliced thinly. The quality of meat is great. I just didn't like to wait for the food to cook. You have to have a lot of time to eat here.

This  as a very nice restaurant. A bit on the small side but it comes off as cozy and intimate. It was a fun night out with my family and also would be great for date night and small groups. 

It's funny, you pay to cook your own food tableside but it makes for a great experience. I plan to go back.

Pretty disappointed in this place which ive been dying to try. Dont get me wrong, the meat is delicious just a little lackluster. A whole plate looks like a lot but when you cook it each slice becomes a small bite so if you do come here get the largest size if youre super hungry. Dont get the $2 egg, doesn't add anything to the flavor. Would have given 4 stars, but dessert was horrible. $8 for average chocolate and "pastries and fruit" which ended up being super small slices of banana and strawberry and frozen pound cake. Server kept asking us personal questions while we were just trying just to eat. Also the stoves are a bit far from the edge of the table and you had to stand up to mix.

Yum! This is our second time back this week...haha. 

We came in for lunch today. We got the prime rib and Yojie's cut (both with the sukiyaki broth). The meals come with your choice of brown or white rice and veggies.

It's light, premium, and fun to eat. 

The seating is interesting. There's a row of high tops and a row of low tops. It's fine for two to a few people but the first time we came in, it was with a group of nine...so it wasn't very social. It's also cold inside but once you start cooking, you'll warm up!

Overall, we will be back! The staff is very friendly and attentive.

We came here with another couple after a movie at Village Square theater. The restaurant is just across the parking lot, so we didn't even have to move the car. The restaurant is fairly small and dominated by a horseshoe shaped counter, with the servers in the center. All seating is at the counter. Each place setting has a "burner" where the bowl heating the liquid to cook your food is placed. This was our first experience with shabu-shabu dining. Carl, our main server, came over immediately and explained the dining experience we were about to have. My wife and I opted to share the combo plate with Angus beef and salmon ($5 surcharge for sharing but they give you lots of extras - so very worth it). Our friends shared the chicken and Angus beef combo. That way we each got to sample the beef, chicken and salmon - a highly recommended strategy for other first timers. I chose to cook in spicy miso while my wife chose alkaline water/seaweed broth. In addition to the meats, they serve a large portion of fresh veggies (cabbage, carrots, broccoli, and more), tofu and noodles, also to be cooked at the table. After you cook your food, you can dip it in one of 3 dipping sauces - Goma (a sesame base), Ponzu (citrus soy), or Swisher (sweet and savory). The meal includes a good sized bowl of either brown or white rice. The salmon was sashimi grade so it could be eaten without cooking. I had some of mine that way. Very fresh tasting and flavorful. The beef was sliced incredibly thin so it cooked really fast. Also delicious. As was the chicken.
Anton, the owner, came over during the meal to make sure everything was going well. He is very personable and answered any of our remaining questions. 
Excellent food, service and ambiance. Who knew cooking your own dinner in a restaurant could be that much fun.
The only negative is that there is only counter seating, so it is difficult to be social when you are a party of 4 or more. Also, the restaurant is fairly new so they don't have a liquor license yet, so no beer or wine with the meal. I am sure they will have it when we come back. And we certainly will come back!

This place is a great choice for dinner. I've never experienced shabu shabu before but I'm very happy I went here for my first time and as my birthday dinner. I love how clean and classy the interior is. Cleanliness and overall atmosphere of a restaurant is very important to me. The servers do an excellent job explaining the whole shabu shabu process thoroughly. I recommend getting their sukiyaki w/ Yojie's cut. I ordered the Geisha size (which is a medium) and the portion amount is enough to feel full but not bloated. The pasteurized egg that comes with it is sooo good to dip in with the meats. The sukiyaki broth is great too too - it has both a sweet and savory flavor to it. Save room for the green tea white chocolate fondue w/ fruits at the end.

Wonderful! I my husband and I each ordered the Salmon Combo (comes with Angus beef and Salmon). I'm a little more adventurous in trying new foods and this was exceptionally good. The Ponzu sauce and the sweeter sauce are definitely worth getting. The beef was thin but so soft and juicy. Was wonderful with ponzu, and the salmon quickly dipped for a seared salmon texture and dipped in the sweet sauce was like dessert. 

Ordered their green tea. Very good. Not too over powering.

And the fruit and pastry platter with the Green Tea White Chocolate sauce. Also very good. 

While it's not something my husband would eat any time soon, I might be adding this place to my list of Monday lunches. Even the baby liked the Udon noodles.

This was my first time going to Yojie. I hear there are locations in California as well but I have never tried them. Make sure you take a jacket! It is seriously chilly in there. Since it was my first time, they put a little block in front of us that said "first timers" or something like that. The girl that helped us was super adorable with huge eyes. She was so sweet in explaining everything and how it worked. I tried the cherry blossom team because I read on Yelp that it was super duper scrumptious - it was good indeedy! It comes in this really cool container and you put it on top of your cup and press down - and it comes squirting out like pee haha I got the shabu shabu style with the most popular yojie cut of meat. At first when I had gotten it, I didn't think it was that much food and thought that I would have to order more. I was wrong! It was so filling that I didn't have any room for dessert. The boyfriend and my other friend got the kobe style meat cut with tonkatsu broth. I highly recommend the tonkatsu broth. It was so yummy that I kept stealing his broth. My shabu shabu broth was too plain for me. In the end though, she adds some sauce to the bowl and adds the water from your dish and makes udon noodles. It was really good. 

The only thing is that they don't have a liquor license yet so there is no alcohol! I didn't dock off a star for this because it isn't their fault. I definitely plan on coming here more often since its close to the crib!!!
omg it was so delish! me and bae ordered the yojie cut and it was absolutely off the chain!  def will bring one of my other girls here tomorrow!! ask for Denise !

Guys,  listen.  This place is legit!  Casual, intimate atmosphere that I really enjoyed.  Bar height or dining height seating but all at the cooking bar.  No standard tables.  

The service is great.  Everyone was very attentive.  We ordered a sake that I ended up not liking.  The server could tell and switched it out, no questions asked.  

And, of course,  the food is bomb!!!  The Kobe beef was great but I honestly prefer the Yojie cut.  It is less expensive than the Kobe and melts in your mouth!
Sukiyaki: Japanese hotpot with Prime Rib, Kurobuta pork and boiling Tonkotsu broth! Added an egg to the stock for that extra umami! Also try their green tea fondue for dessert!

We had a great time on a double date here. It was our second time here and it was just as delicious and fun. Each person gets their own hot pot cooker with a plate of shaved meat and a bowl of vegetables and noodles.  You swish the meat and veggies in the broth for 30 seconds, dip in the sauce of your choice and eat with rice. Having an activity go with your meal is great when you may not have much to chat about with your dinner mates. I had the yojie's cut steak in the geisha size. Its just right for one person. The meats, veggies, noodles and rice were delicious. They just got their liquor license and have sake cocktails. The matcha green tea fondue was yummy also.

At first we decided to eat here only because my company and I were taking our chances to maybe see the famous comedian, Jo Koy. We did NOT see Jo Koy but definitely coming back for more of their food. Service was great. Everyone were cheerful and very helpful. Their art wall were all from a local artist, J Muniz which is all cartoon- like character that's wearing a rabbit suit. And the food....mmm! The food!I had the prime rib with the seaweed soup but surely will try a different kind of soup. The beef is tender and the vegetables were all fresh and not frozen. It was an excellent experience. It just hit the right spot. I'm sure to come back here for the food now and if I get to see Jo Koy, he will be just a plus to my visit! lol
Great food great device nice staff it small so there might be a little wait try going for lunch usually a little easier to sit. Worth the wait. Get the green tea fondue for dessert.
Amazing! The food and service is fantastic. The whole experience is worth it and Carl the server was very knowledgeable!

This place just opened like a week or two ago and the owner is Jo koy ! That's pretty awesome haha but the customer service here is EXCELLENT from the minute I walked in to the minute I walked out the workers were nothing but nice and explained to me how hot pot works and everything and I absolutely enjoyed the experience . I got the shabu shabu with the salmon and pork and it was actually really really delicious with the Broth and I don't remember which dipping sauce I had but it went perfect with the salmon and pork :p oh and to add their green tea with some fructose in it is SOOO delicious it is a must try ! I tried it and i fell in love omg and to also add you can get desserts at the end and you can get fruits and pastries or just fruits with the green tea white chocolate dipping fondue - like and it looked really pretty and tasted pretty delicious . I thought this whole restaurant was decorated perfectly and the customer service was amazing ! And the food was pretty good I would have to give this place a 5 star and I definitely would recommend it to a friend , well done

I love the atmosphere and food at Yojie! It was a completely new experience for me and my favorite thing was our green tea fondue for dessert. My only complaint is that since the restaurant is small, the wait can be long, but the small size results in great service once you sit down. Plus, everyone gets their own hot plate burner so it's not like they can make it much bigger than it is!

I would recommend this to any Vegas local and it's worth the trip from the Strip if you are a tourist.

I've been craving this and there aren't many hot pot places in Vegas. I wish there was a closer location to me since I'm closer to Silverado Ranch area so this is almost a 30 minute drive.

The first thing I noticed was how they have induction burners at every seat and the set up is kind of like bar seating. I really liked that. It's a lot nicer than carrying out a burner and only having one burner per table like another place I've been to.

There's three broths to choose from: shabu-shabu, sukiyaki, and spicy miso. I've only had the spicy miso and it comes with 2 dipping sauces, I picked the ponzu (citrus soy sauce) and gomu (sesame sauce). They're all very flavorful and they do offer green onion, garlic, radish, a Japanese chili powder, soy sauce, and the spicy drops. The spicy miso isn't too spicy so I added a bit more spice.

I ordered the combo plate in the lunch geisha size. And it comes with 5oz Yojie's cut angus steak, 5oz salmon sashimi, a bowl of white or brown rice, and a bowl of veggies that has some udon noodles. It's a pretty good size portion even if you just order the Geisha size of a single item, it's about 5 thin sliced pieces of meat. Last time I couldn't finish everything and was able to cook it in the broth and take it home, I guess I was really hungry and finished everything today. I'm not sure what the differences are between the lunch and the dinner sizes. Maybe the dinner has more veggies and noodles?

Overall I really like this place. The food is very flavorful and fresh and they have a good variety on the menu. There's never been a wait when I've come for lunch. It can be a bit tricky to find since it's in a big plaza but it's right next to Joy Yee's.

I REALLY REALLY REALLY REALLY wished the service here could be better! Because the food is absolutely delicious. 

But coming here every time is always an internal debate for me because it takes soooo long to get seated, to get your order taken, to receive food and eventually to receive a check and pay. It seems like they only staff one service during peak hours and doesn't adequately train their staff the importance of sense of urgency, which in turn turning the service into a vicious cycle of eternal waiting.

Last time when my friend and I went there, it took them one hour-60 minutes!! To bring out the dessert we ordered. It was a fruit fondue- about four strawberries, half a banana and 5-6 pieces of cubes of pre-made cake. It escaped us HOW could cutting of such minimal food take an entire hour?! And we asked for the progress 3 times during that hour and every time we told the server that we might just cancel the dessert, she assured us that it would come out within 2 minutes. The promise was never kept. 

All in all, good food. But too frustrating to dine in, unless you have at least 2 hours to spare for sitting in a restaurant, searching for your waiter.

I'm from California so I definitely miss the Shabu from there. Love that they opened a yojie here! I was a regular there and now going to be a regular here! Sad they didn't have the hot drops but they still had a spicy sauce. For those who don't usually Shabu save your noodles until the end and ask for the soup base so you can have your udon soup after. Yum!!
I'm also not a dessert person but you have to try their green tea white chocolate fondue!!

I would have given it 5 star but it's pricey.   

Great addition to restaurant scene in Vegas. 
A Japanese shabu shabu.  Place is very modern. I waited a month before trying the place.  My son got the yojie cut, wife got the Kobe and I got the Wagyu.   Warning Wagyu is market price$$$$ but it was awesome.  Kobe didn't disappoint. Very tasty. If you want to go eat more then yojie cut is good.  I had the spicy miso- great season.  We ended up with the dark chocolate fondue- my son demolished it. I highly recommend this place.  Did I say Jo Koy is a part owner and helped us - very friendly and funny guy!!!! Great place.

Looks very clean and calm environment.
Employees are nice but the sukiyaki stew was really sweet. 
It is great idea to not share with partner and you have your own pot. Great price for combos. They explained to you how to order if it's your first time to visit. But first time to visit yojie doesn't mean first time to try sukiyaki. You don't have to explain to me how to eat sukiyaki lol i'm East Asian. I think I know better about sukiyaki than him. it was really awkward he stand front of you and teaching you how to eat sukiyaki and what is sukiyaki.

Fantastic experience! Our servers made our visit extremely enjoyable. The cuts are great, the attention to detail is great, the attitude is great, the atmosphere is great! Can definitely see a bright future for this branch! Count me addicted! Love how they make your leftovers into an udon soup for you to take home
Friggin' delicious!  My GF and I both love this place.  Must eat there more!  I usually go for the tonkotsu.

My favorite Shabu Shabu spot! I would eat this everyday if I could. I always get the Yojié cut and spicy miso as my broth. It comes with a bowl of vegetables and udon noodles, a side of rice, and 2 sauces of your choice. 

The service never disappoints! Wish I got our server's name because I've had him the last couple of visits and he's awesome. The location is pretty far from where I live, but the drive is always worth it because the food is so yummy!!
We love their food but a suggestion is to not leave a space between every group in order to maximize seating. We were turned away (hour wait) even though there were enough empty seats

Best Shabu Shabu ever. The meat just melts in your mouth. Nice atmosphere with modern decor. Always a wait. Nice, friendly staff.  The vegetable portion is a bit small compared to other Shabu restaurants I've been too. Dessert fondue is a great finish to any meal.

Awesome restaurant! Me and my girlfriend have been to the AYCE shabu grill here in town before and thought that was good, but man is this place levels above. 

Service- As soon as you enter they greet you, servers are very informative on the menu and they teach you how to cook/eat the food if you have never been before. The servers always stay on top of your needs and they always come to check back frequently. (My water was always filled which I always think that's a good way to measure service. Because they kept coming back to make sure we were okay.)

Food- My girlfriend got the Yojie meat plate and I got the Prime rib cuts, absolutely fantastic. The meats were of such high quality you could tell just by looking at it. The sauces were otherworldly good. And the rice were free refills! That's always a plus for me. They had two choices white or brown rice, which I thought was a nice touch. And at the end of the meal if you have left over vegetables they make an awesome soup to help put you over the top.

Restaurant- Kindve small, they sit you next to other parties, but it is definitely a beautiful restaurant. They have small personal hot plates for every seat, so you don't have to share with others in your party. And dead phones are never a worry here! (I always deal with that) They have wall plugs so you can charge your phone under every seat which I thought was awesome.

Overall an amazing experience and can't wait to go back!

3.7865 stars 

I honestly wasn't a fan here. Maybe that's why I never tried the DTLA location. The portions of everything were so tiny I had to eat off left overs from my friend's portion. Best part about eating this place was meeting Philip T! 

This shabu place is set up as a bar and I didn't like it. Maybe also I like family style hot pot? I guess this is the hip new modern shabu shabu. 

The customer service was great and attentive but a little smothering. I understand that it's a soft opening but being asked how's the food every 10 minutes does get too much. I really did like how the waitress went through the whole entire menu with us since we're first timers at Yojie. 

I ordered the sukiyaki with pasteurized egg with the Yojie cut geisha size. The broth was honestly way too sweet for my taste. They even diluted it water. I really did like the egg with all the condiments mixed in with it!  I wish I order the spicy miso like Jen Z. ! Her broth was much more savory and rich than mine. I had to switch with her after her meal. The portions of everything was very small. I pretty much ate everything of mine and finished off all of Jen Z's veggies and noodles to feel full. The quality of the meats were superb and fresh! 

I'm really glad I got to finally try out this place maybe I'll check out the LA location for the family style shabu shabu.

I've had shabu shabu before but this one is a new and fun experience! I order the Kodomo (small) yojie's cut (angus) with spicy miso broth and it was delicious and a lot healthier than what I've been eating lately. 

Lots of vegetables to cook in my broth: cabbage, mushrooms, carrots, onions , seaweed, and spinach. 

Noodles to cook in my broth: udon and this thin translucent type. 

The meat and sauces were delicious. The staff were very helpful in getting us set up, each with our own grills. 

Very clean, modern, AIR CONDITIONED, well-ventilated restaurant. 

Come give it a try!

This place has been bookmarked forever and I'm glad I finally went. It is hotpot/fondue style restsurant. Each person gets their own pot in front of them. The place is pretty small so if you have a large group, you may have to wait. With any hotpot place, you choose the meat and sides that you want. The meat was fresh and the portion was decent. They have 4 broths to pick from. I got the spicy miso which was bomb! It wasn't too spicy. Each plate ordered comes with veggies, noodles, and a choice of white or brown rice. You also get 2 choices of dipping sauce. Three people in our group were 1st timers and the staff was super friendly, helpful, and quick. We all had a great experience, and will be back in the future soon. They have nice art work hanging on the walls. Too bad we didn't get to see JoKoy haha. They serve liquor which is a plus and they also have dessert!

This is a Very Unique Dining Experience... 

First You Sign in... Unusual to be sure. 

Next you are seated at a long bar, where each person has their own small cooktop, situated close to the serving side of the bar. 

The choices are the types of meat & the sauces which you cook them in... Shabu Shabu

We met wonderful Chef O... He tuned up my Sukiyaki & it was fabulous. My husband tried the spicy miso broth so I cooked some in it.  It was Ok.  I would not order it as the slightly richer & sweeter Sukiyaki broth is such a delightful flavor. 

We loved the assortment of vegetables & would request additional shiitake mushrooms when we return as the Sukiyaki broth is richer with more of these type of mushrooms.  Writing about this makes me want to go again soon... Do you know how good it is! 

We tried the desert fondue & it was great! 

Also the bubblegum tasting Japanese soda with a small scoop of ice cream. Like a root beer float, Japanese style. It was refreshing... Ok 

The highlight here is the nice clean set up. The great service from Chef O... The incredibly delicious Sukiyaki.  There is an amazing Sushi restaurant in this same mall. Hanabi. I would like to start at Hanabi... Have some Sushi and go to this restaurant for Sukiyaki. They should have a Japanese progressive dinner event! Both places are Excellent.

What a nice and relaxing experience. The environment was modern and has a unique touch. It's only bar seating. Everyone was nice and was super eager to explain the hotpot concept. As small as the whole place is, it was still definitely spacious when eating. Doesn't feel crowded at all. The menu is very easy to read and the presentation of the food is clean and simple. 3 different broths to choose from. We did the spicy miso and tonkotsu which we're both very flavorful. Bowl of veggies was a good variety. U can choose from brown or white rice. They also serve you different condiments and extra toppings to make the meat super flavorful. The swisher and goma sauces are bomb. The yellowish one is the sweet and savory option and it was our favorite. We chose the yojie cut for our meat and it was fresh. Only bad thing I could say about our experience was we ordered too much. There's 3 sizes and we got the large for each of us instead of the regular. Large came with 15 prices and the regular comes with 10-12. So I guess depends how hungry you are. Pricing isn't bad either. Oh and only downside is I wish they gave more noodles! I loved the udon noodles. Iced green tea is bomb, not sweet. Oh and must I say they play THE jams while you are eating. All the slow jams and 90s music you know, so it makes eating much more fun! Haha

The Skinny: although the quality of product is okay, meager portions for the price. The flavor of the broth/sauce is alright. (3) service: ambience is modern, service was okay but easily overwhelmed (3), value: for all its nickel and dime tactics,  the value just isn't there. If you must try this place,  come for lunch. They charge extra for dinner without adding any value(3).

FYI - Yojie is located close to Tropical Smoothie cafe and Viva Mercado's. 

Walking into the restaurant,  there were 2 guests in eating lunch at around 11:30 am. You are required to sign in even though there is no wait. It was weird because it took a few minutes for anyone to notice we came in. 

Regardless we were seated promptly and the menu was explained to us. They have quite a few options of meat but the pricing is based on the size of your protein portion. For most things on the the menu,  sizes were only 5oz (geisha) and 7oz (samurai). Only the Yojie cut had 4 sizing options (3 oz, 5 oz, 7oz, 10oz). This comes with white/brown rice and a bowl of vegetables/noodles.

Kombu broth (water/seaweed) is standard but they charge extra for sukiyaki, spicy miso, or tonkotsu broth ($2/$2/$3 respectively). Sukiyaki comes with an egg while the other broths come with 2 out of 3 dipping sauces which are ponzu, goma (sesame), and their sweet and savory (apparently a ginger teriyaki sauce). Extra sauce,  rice, veggies cost extra. 

We ordered the Yojie cut (Sumo sized, $20.99 lunch) and a kurobuta pork(Samurai sized, $17.99) with spicy miso and tonkotsu broth. 

The Yojie cut had medium marbling. I was unimpressed that they left a really huge chunk of fat at the end of the pieces of meat (I understand they can't control the huge chunk of fat in the middle). If you are paying by weight, the meat needs to be properly trimmed. The kurobuta pork tasted good but was really fatty as well. 

The spicy miso broth and tonkotsu broth (made with alkaline water!... Sorry for the bit of sarcasm) were both okay but it doesn't compare to any half decent ramen joint in terms of flavor even after all the cooking is done. Not worth the premium. 

Tried the goma and ponzu and was not impressed.The goma (sesame sauce) was a bit too earthy (can't think of another word for this) for my tastes. The ponzu lacked the true citrus flavor and acidity of yuzu which made it rather pedestrian. 

The side of rice and vegetables were really disappointing in portion size. The vegetable bowl looks pretty but there really isn't alot in there. In total: half a slice of onion, 2 small Napa cabbage leaves cut into 4,  4 spinach leaves, half of a small carrot,  1 shitake mushroom,  1 mouth sized amount of enoki, 2 small pieces of broccoli, 2 bite size pieces of tofu,  4 udon noodles and 5 pieces of rice noodles. Oh, and a small bite of pickled daikon and seaweed thrown in there. 

They also only give about a half bowl of rice. 

Service was very attentive at the beginning when there were only 2 people other than us in the joint. However once there were 6 people in the restaurant,  service became spotty with water refills. And this is when there were at least 2 servers for the restaurant! 

Ambience is modern, hipster and ventilation is good but makes it difficult to hear with the music in the background. 

Our total for this lunch for 2 was $48 with tax with no drinks or dessert. The food is okay in my books and I have definitely had better. Considering portion sizing, taste, and level of service,  the prices are exorbitant. Given the premium they charge for dinner (for no reason!),  it becomes even more insane. Pass on this place (3 starred review).

Second time here. Portions of meats are good and prices to add more is solid value. Went for lunch(favorable pricing) this time with my son. He had a Japanese soda( the one with the marble in the neck of the bottle ). We had the yojie cut angus and pork belly sukiyaki style. Presentation is on point with the color and marbling of the meats looking just as good as they taste. Definitely recommend sukiyaki style with the raw egg to dip your food in (adds richness).  For dessert we had ice cream. Server recommended a purple ube (yam ice cream). Actually pretty good. Vibrant purple color with interesting flavor. I'm sure we will be back slot especially when winter hits.

Very chill atmosphere. First time here and I ordered the combo with salmon and beef. Everything was excellent! You get plenty of food and the staff was very helpful in guiding me through the cooking process. The green tea fondue with strawberries was very tasty too. I will definitely be back when I'm in town again.

My cousin was in town and mentioned Jo Koys restaurant so clearly I got curious. Aside from being my favorite comedians place, they really did earn a 5 star. 

Its a traditional shabu restaurant with all the seating being in a U shape so everyone is facing inward. So there really isn't a lot of seats but we arrived at just the right time because as soon as we were seated a line started to form and their wait began. When you walk in they all greet you with something, not sure what it was that they said but they did it for every customer so it was really cool to see all the attention each person got from the start. 

Our server was incredibly friendly, she explained the way the menu works and helped with some suggestions. I got the spicy broth with a combination of the beef and chicken. I loved the broth! I got to say I drank it all after I ate all the meat. My son and I shared he wanted more, lol. The food is brought out quick and off we go to eating deliciousness!! The food overall was one of the best shabu I've had. They let you pick 2 sauces, I had the ponzu and another sweet one (forgot the name). The ponzu was my sons favorite while I enjoyed the sweet one a bit more. 

To end our evening we tried the green tea chocolate fondue with strawberries and bananas. Omg! Get it! You must!
Pretty good food and fun place for a different type of experience. The service was too notch however a little on the pricey side.
First time and it was so good!!! Thank you Val! Her service was on point &I always checked on us if we needed anything. A must try on the green tea white chocolate fondue!

YOJIË IN LAS VEGAS!!! wishes do come true!  Anytime I went to Los Angeles I absolutely had to had to had to make a stop at this restaurant.  Before this restaurant I couldn't bare to eat at any shabu spot in the entire city of Las Vegas, they are all terrible.  

This restaurant is quite a distance from my home but I am happy to make the drive to satisfy my shabu craving!  THIS RESTAURANT IS THE ABSOLUTE BEST!  so much so, that despite the wait for my food that I sometimes experience here they still receive five stars from me!

My typical  (little lady appetite) order:
Yojiës cut
Geisha
Half sukiyaki
Half tonkotsu

How I eat it?
Extra garlic and raddish in the sukiyaki
Cook meat in sukiyaki
Cook udon and veggies in tonkotsu 

Even when I am full, I want to continue eating.  HEAVEN. I appreciate the individual burners. The tea pots that dispense from underneath are cool.   Still waiting for some alcoholic beverage options.

What a delicious experience. Everything served here has such beautiful and delicate presentation. All of the food is fresh and full of amazing flavors.

The service is really on top of their game here and make sure that all the guests are well taken care of. They have a great array of food for Vegitarian Hot Pot at a very good price. 

The green tea is also served extremely fresh and the dessert is to die for!

Great food, amazing service, and an artful experience. The vibe in yojié is very cool with the art and the modern set up. the employees are very attentive as well. The food is incredible! So many different options, and so far none have disappointed. The owner is a very kind gentleman as well. I would recommend this place to anyone looking to try something new!

Came here on a Saturday night! Surprisingly there was no wait to take a seat! Yay! Our servers name was Vhalery, such a sweet young lady. She explained the entire menu to us, which this food is shabu shabu and sukiyaki. Vhalery recommended kurobuta pork with spicy miso dip! OMG so delicious. While we were waiting for our food to come out, our party engaged in some conversation with some staff. Marjorie and Anna, also sweet servers. Such a friendly staff, clean restaurant and great food!

I went here last week on a Sunday afternoon. The place was easy to find and there's plenty of parking in the area. 

When I first walked in, I really liked their modern decor. The place was very clean. White countertops offering hightop and lower bar seating. It's not super huge so it's not a place for large group settings. They were playing sort of edm/trap/house music. Not obnoxiously loud or anything, I mean it was still day light when I went. It was pretty quiet, only a party of four dining when we walked in. So I'm glad there wasn't a wait.

So to start I am not a shabu shabu expert so the server gave us the run down. There were only two servers working when we were eating there and both were really nice and friendly.
