They have a selection of meats to choose from angus beef, pork, and even vegetarian options. After choosing the meat you chose your soup base or sauce. The server said the most popular was the sukiyaki which is a sweeter flavor and it comes with pasteurized egg for dipping (I was weirded out at first). I got the pork kurobuta lunch portion with the spicy miso. Mine came in a choice of sauces, I got the goma and the swisher. My boyfriend got the sukiyaki (he's such a follower lol) with the combo which includes the yojie cut of angus beef and your choice of another meat, he got pork belly. All the entrees come with a bowl of mixed veggies and udon. You also get a bowl of rice, which I think was free refills. 

The spicy miso is where it's at! It went so well with pork and then I dipped in the swisher sauce. I tried the sukiyaki as well which was pretty tasty with the beef and the egg was ok it's just still weird to me. For me in a soup lover and sukiyaki is just so sweet I can't slurp that for too long. Even my boyfriend was so jealous because the spicy miso was better than his sukiyaki. I made a soup with my veggies and udon. It was perfect for this cold weather. Between the pork belly and kurobuta, I prefer the kurobuta.  The angus beef was ok to me it wasn't anything to wow about. 

It can be a little pricey for the amount of meat you get especially if you don't do a combo option but for me I ate all my veggies and udon so I felt full. A good thing to do is if you're dining with another person is to get one combo and then one regular portion, then split it.

Been meaning to write up a review for this joint.  Being a fan of Adam Carolla, I was turned onto the comedy stylings of Jo Koy through the ACS podcast.  Jo is a super funny dude and apparently knows how to launch and run a top notch restaurant as well.  The food was fantastic and Jo was actually in the house when we were there.  Really solid dude.  Took a pic with my family and ran out to his car to bring me a free DVD of his comedy.  Thankful to him and his wonderful restaurant and staff.  We'll definitely be back and I will continue to follow Jo's career.

Amazing food and staff!!! Everything was delicious and the customer service was excellent! Great experience and the decor is super nice and modern. Definitely get the pork it was delicious! Also love that they have purse hooks under the table and they even have USB port under the table to plug in phone chargers. I left my charger at home but the owner provided one to us which was amazing!!! Will definitely return so delicious and leaves u super full!!

My second time here and I'm still impressed. They are so friendly and the food is great. LOVE the spicy miso broth. Ponzu and Goma are the best sauces for this broth. As a female I find that the Geisha portions are perfect for dinner. You get the vegetables, noodles and rice so that fills you up as well (plus you can save room for dessert). Prices are reasonable if you stay away from the Kobe and Wagyu ($79 sometimes). Kurobuta Pork is excellent. For 4 of us the meal was $100 so I don't that that's too bad. I like the interactive cooking, I just wish the tables were designed to be a little more interactive with your party. (It's ok if there's 2-3 of you but any more and it's tough to include everyone in the conversation). Healthy eating!

This place is amazing. From start to finish hands down great quality food, great customer services, and a very clean environment. The restaurant setup is different and might be hard for a group events but I like it. I have been to a few of the locations in Cali. It's unbelievable how the quality grows with the business. Food... I always go with the beef and salmon mixed with the spicy miso. If I had to choose 1 it would be the Kobe beef for sure. Make sure to get your sauces mixed and save room for dessert. I highly suggest the fruit and pastry fondue green tea with white chocolate. I will be back soon.

my favorite shabu shabu place. wish there was more variety, but I enjoyed everything here. they give you options to customize your order, but don't offer any additional side dishes. the presentation is adorable, and the service is fantasic. My boyfriend is from SF and this is definitely at the top of my bucket list to take him out to eat when he comes.

This was our first time to eat at Yogie's and it was a most delightful experience. Denise, our server, was exceptional. I had the beef and pork in shabu shabu with ponzu and the other sweet dipping sauce. I enjoyed dipping in the citrusy soy sauce of the ponzu. My husband had the kobe beef in spicy miso broth with ponzu and sesame dipping sauce. At the end, Denise added udon broth in the remaining broth with the vegetables and noodles that I'm taking home to enjoy at lunch tomorrow. I just wish we had room for dessert. Definitely next time. Thanks awesome Denise.

My friend Anton from Yojie LV has been telling me to come by his restaurant forever. After finally going I must say, WOW! Flavor explosion  there were 4 of us we ordered the Kobe Beef and the prime rib, we were able to mix our dipping sauces which was perfect. They brought out a raw egg for dipping after cooking our meats and I must say  it was amazing , the buttery flavor of dipping in the egg was phenomenal. I was almost bummed when I didn't see anyone drinking until I looked to the right and saw someone drinking a frosty cold one! We also had some flavored Saki ! Desert was awesome gourmet doughnuts  , fresh bananas & strawberries   to dip in a gourmet green tea chocolate  dipping sauce. 
The whole feng shui and vibe of this place is dope I give it both thumbs up   I would have taken pictures but the food was so good I forgot.

I was ecstatic to hear that a new shabu shabu place opened up near my work. Fun fact- The co-owner is comedian Jo Koy. This sleek and modern restaurant seats around 30 people? The employees here are friendly and will explain everything if you have never been here or if you are a shabu shabu noob. Service was very attentive. You can tell they just opened and wanted to make sure they were explaining everything and being very helpful. There are cute Asian girls working here too. ;)

So this is how you order. First you pick one of four different serving sizes - 3 oz (kodomo), 5 oz (geisha), 8 oz (samurai), or 12 oz (sumo). I thought the descriptions for the servings sizes were cute. Next, you pick your choice of meat (Angus cut, prime ribeye, Kobe beef), chicken, pork, salmon, combo, or vegetarian. Then you pick your broth- shabu shabu, sukiyaki, or spicy miso. It comes with white or brown rice, veggies (cabbage, broccoli, shiitake, carrots), udon, glass noodles, and dipping sauces.

I opted for Yojie's cut with sukiyaki with egg dip which is $2 additional. I went with the geisha size. The eggs are pasteurized at 140 degrees if you're worried about salmonella. The Angus meat had good marbling compared to the other shabu shabu places that I have been to in Vegas. You can add additional sides or more meat for you sumos.

I will be back and will try the shabu shabu and go for sumo size because I'm a meat fatty and 5 oz wasn't enough. Lastly, I have to mention the hot plates were far or maybe I'm short so I made a mess (sorry!) so be wary of that for you short people.
Yummy!  Jo Koy's restaurant is so good!  And we ran into his Mom for lunch!  We would definitely come back.

I was craving shabu shabu/hotpot and wanted to check this place out since one of my friends suggested it. Once I stepped in, I noticed the style of eating was a bit different then I imagined since I've only ever been to one other shabu shabu place in Seattle and it was family style, so the individual pots was a little surprising. I ordered the regular sized tonkatsu broth with the Yojié style cut. It was pretty filling as it came with vegetables, rice, and 2 different dipping sauces. The broth itself was okay. I felt like it was a little watered down or just very very light in flavor. The meat cuts were really yummy, especially with the Swisher sauce. I would try it again if my friends wanted to come here, but I wouldn't personally suggest to come here as there are better places out there to go to in my opinion.
Friendly staff & delicious food! No reservations, so come early! Sukiyaki w/ yojie beef highly recommended :D

This place is not all you can eat but the meat is really high quality. For most a large order of meat is plenty plus your order comes with rice, veggies and noodles. The decor is very modern in a small Bistro size place. If you like spicy ask for the spicy sauce which is a private label that they will also sell you to take home.

We find ourselves in this part of town quite a bit, (I used to work at a place further down West Sahara, and one of the dispensaries I go to is on the same street), and though we'd been to several stores and restaurants in the area, Yojie is one we'd never been to.  And I was SO glad we went!

Although I had heard the term "shabu-shabu" before, (not to be confused with the excellent INXS album "Shabooh Shoobah",) I had no idea what it was, and being in the mood for something 'different', we ventured in.  Nice, clean place with a great design, and counters on either side of the restaurant.

If I recall correctly, the name of the wait person who helped us was Amanda, (and I only remember because one of my good friends from Dallas is also named Amanda), and she was great to talk to, as well as more than a little helpful in assisting us with navigating the intricacies of "shabu shabu" cooking and dining. Up until this point, fondue to me was a chafing dish filled with melty cheese or chocolate mixtures, that you dipped various things into.  Same principal here, except now it's savory and sometimes sweet hot sauces and broths that you douse paper-thin sliced meats and assorted veggies into. 

We found the whole process strange, but fun. Bear had a little trouble with the chopsticks at first, but they don't leave you hanging if you can't seem to "get it."  It's been a while since our first visit, and with my birthday coming up, I'm thinking, "Why not?"

Highly recommended for both the adventurous and the health-conscious foodies.

I'm sure the food is good, but we had to walk out because they simply ignored us for 10mins upon walking in. Just chitchating there without offering us anything while we were sitting down in front of them w/o menus and there was only one other party in the restaurant. Better luck next time hopefully.
I love this place not only im big fan of jokoy, his restaurant is awesome. Awesome food, and awesome peeps. I had the prime rib shabu shabu... Definitely going back...

Atmosphere was beautiful. Also great customer service. Can't remember her name she was Asian and petite I think her name sounded like auzzy sorry can't remember. She was very on point and very helpful with the menu.excellent customer service. And the food was . It was the bomb!!!

Owner is super down to earth and always educating his staff. Try the cherry blossom tea. Endless bowls of rice. If you get confused about the menu the staff will explain everything and don't forget to try the egg.

Anton was extremely polite and helpful on my first visit to Yojie with my girlfriend. We gave in and had the Wagyu! Wow. Amazing texture and marbling. I couldn't believe the tenderness and taste of the meat. I've never experienced anything like it before. We had a blast. Service was great. Restaurant was clean and the decor is modern and hip. I'll be back in no time. Thank you! (sorry for the late review)

This is not exactly like a traditional Shabu Shabu restaurant. You order a personal pot of broth and get your own meat and veggies. I've only ever had this served family style before. That being said, you can still share meat and veggies but everyone gets their own broth. Speaking of the broth, they're all delicious. My wife had the spicy miso and I had the sukiyaki. The miso was pretty spicy, but not ever powering. The sukiyaki was something brand new to me. It's loaded with flavor, very sweet, but tempered well by the raw egg you dip all your meat and veggies in after cooking in the broth. I will definitely be going here again. The service was fast and friendly and very informative.

My boyfriend and I just moved to Las Vegas, we used to go to the Yojie in Artesia, CA at least once a week. Such a bummer this location doesn't have Yakiniku. But, this location has became our favorite, the service was amazing the waitress that helped us was also from LA. So happy they opened a Yojie out here, we will probably going there once a week just like before He got the spicy miso and I got the sukiyaki both with Yojie cut. Best restaurant ever and so worth the price!

I ordered the combo plate today which included rice (white or brown), a bowl of veggies, two sauces of your choice (ponzu, goma or swisher sauce), and your choice of salmon, chicken, pork or pork belly paired with their Yojie cut Angus Beef. Perfect choice because I was starving! I couldn't decide which dip I wanted though so I splurged a little and  ordered half of the sukiyaki and half tonkatsu. To be honest, the tonkatsu was just okay. You can definitely taste the broth but it wasn't all that flavorful in my opinion. The sukiyaki on the other hand was sweet and tasty. If the sweetness is a little too much for you, they advice you to add a little more water just to dilute it. This will be my go to when I come back! 

This place is not really group friendly. I understand the concept of it being a bar because of the individual cooker but in cases where there's a large group like I was with today, you're only able to converse with those sitting next to you. Also, it kinda keeps you from sharing food with everyone in your group which could be a good or bad thing. 

Servers are helpful especially when you're a first timer. 

I'm still hoping to see and take a picture with owner,  Jo Koy. Hasn't happened yet but maybe if I come more often. I'm bound to run into him, right? Haha

Honestly, I don't want to explain why this place is so good.  You MUST try it.  I only am saying this because I have seen the owner do some things that made me have instant gratification of him being a part of the f&b industry.  From the food to the ambiance, it's all top notch.

Fun experience with the family. Love the individual stove. The staff was attentive without being over bearing. My 8 year old has challenges with reach but did well enough to cook her meal with only 2 tiny  incident. Only down side is that they don't have their liquor license yet.

RECOMMEND!! 
I must be honest, this is one of the best hotpot restaurants I have been to in a while. I used to work at a hotpot restaurant, but Yojié in particular is very affordable and I love how it comes with a bowl of vegetables. Lots of vegetables. The lunch special ranges from about $11-20 which is a great deal! When I went the first time with my friend, the service was amazing. But I must say that the second time I went with my mom, the service was horrible. My waitress barely checked up on us, but when she did, she didn't ask if we needed anything else, or if we were okay. She just picked up some of our plates and went back to go talk to her friend that was sitting by the register. Although the service that time sucked, the food was delicious!! This may be my go to hotpot restaurant

My husband and I eat here and almost every time, we've had great service and the food is amazing.

Unfortunately, this last time, it was a 3 star experience and the reason being is because my husband asked the purple haired waitress for something and said,

"No, I don't want to."

Then laughed.

I know she meant it as a joke, but ...it seemed like there was some truth to it? Like you didn't want to work today? Or...?

Anyways, the save came from the chef (I'm assuming, since she wore a hat and black coat). She was the reason our experience was saved. She was nice and talked with us and bagged my husband's food. I like her.

Me and my girlfriend had come in for a late dinner around 9. We've had yojie before but this time i had to give a review because everything was on point! Our server attended to us right away and gave us a minute to look over the menu (Mind that we haven't been here for a year or so). They recently got their alcohol license, but from what our server said they're only serving beer at the moment until they take their class to serve sake. Upon ordering my girlfriend got the yojie cut in the smallest portion. I got myself the combo plate which consisted of the yojie cut and your choice of Chicken, salmon, pork, and pork belly. I chose the pork belly. Their offered vegetables such as broccoli, lettuce, half of a white mushroom, shitake mushrooms, carrots, onions, while also offering tofu, seaweed, udon and glass noodles. After they offer either white or brown rice. Then you choose your pot. They offer the original shabu-shabu broth that has a very light miso flavor, the sukiyaki broth, spicy miso, and pork broth. Me and my girlfriend both got the sukiyaki! With the sukiyaki they offer a pasteurized egg as a dipping sauce. It goes REALLY well with the broth and meat. I always pace myself because I eat a lot of rice with my whole meal. 

After our dinner we got the green tea white chocolate fondue desert plate with fruits and strawberries. My girlfriends FAVORITE.

Yojie never disappoints. That is all.

I came here twice for dinner and thoroughly enjoyed the place. It's a tiny place with modern decor. The first time I came here, the TVs were showing horse racing and the second time was showing another sport. The music choice here is a bit odd as they play a mixture of 90s and 2000s music and it doesn't feel like it fits/matches the aura of the place.

The first time I came here, I ordered the spicy miso broth and the vegetable medley (I asked for the mushrooms replaced with something else) with ponzu and goma sauces and a side of brown rice. I also ordered the cherry blossom tea because it was something very new and unique-sounding so I had to try it. The cherry blossom tea tasted like green tea. I was confused, thinking maybe they gave me plain green tea but as I drank more, I could taste a hint of something else. However, whatever it was, became overpowered by a green tea flavor.

Melanie (I think that's her name) was our server and she was awesome. She was always smiling and happy, always checking in making sure everything was okay, if we needed anything else, and overall gave really good customer service. 

The second time I came, I ordered the exact same thing (I don't have other options as a vegetarian) but with Japanese iced coffee instead of cherry blossom green tea. The Japanese iced coffee tasted like plain iced coffee but with what tasted like brown sugar? It's a subtly sweet flavor, not what I expected, but I didn't hate it either and I'd order it again. 

This time, Azi was our server. She wasn't friendly and had a bit of an attitude. She didn't care to ask us about our meal or check in on us. She would walk by without saying anything but would check in with other guests. Very different from Melanie's customer service. However, this one server, a guy named Shannon, started to check in on us and he was extremely kind and more than willing to help us if we needed anything. He checked in on us a number of times, always asked if we needed more broth or wanted more water, he was superb. He even offered to take our pots to the back and put them in to-go containers and wrap them up for us! I was shocked at his willingness to do such a thing for us, and I was so happy to see that level of customer service. He even marked one of the containers so I'd know which one was mine. 

For my food, I was skeptical to try a miso broth because I grew up eating miso soup a lot (I come from an Asian family) and couldn't imagine eating it as a spicy hot pot broth. I was, however, pleasantly surprised at the flavor and enjoyed every bite of it. I was also very happy with the portions given for the vegetable medley because, as a vegetarian, that was all I could eat there and it filled me up nicely.

We were only allowed to pick two of the three different sauces which saddens me because in Hawaii, we're used to having 10 - 20 different sauce options that we can pick from freely and even mix and match sauces to create our own unique sauces. 

For dessert, we ordered the milk chocolate fondue with "berries and bananas" (strawberries and bananas). I had some expectations of the fondue since it's in the name of the restaurant but there wasn't anything special or unique about it. Yojie might benefit from doing something unique or special to their fondue because, in reality, it is plain fondue (it is, after all, called Yojie Japanese Fondue, so do something unique with it). 

I hope management acknowledges the customer service skills of Shannon and Melanie because they were so attentive to us. Melanie even remembered us the second time we came back! I will continue to come back here again but I'd hope to not get Azi as our server again.

Everything, AWESOME. I'll start with the service. Every single person was beyond welcoming and made me feel like I was already a regular (which I will be now!) Jo was there and made it a point to really interact with everyone in the restaurant even through the rush of people. Anton was so great too! He recommended the fondue dessert with the ube ice cream and that was just out of this world. That guy is a genius of tastebuds. 
The food. Oh my god the food. I'm a huge pork belly fan and actually reviewed Flemings steakhouse for their pork belly appetizer just last night. That was okay but the pork belly here was off the charts. So tender and tasty. Definite redemption from my mediocre steakhouse experience. 
The combo is absolutely the way to go. For the reviewers who opted for the single meat and complained of the price, you're doing it wrong. I grew up eating shabu on Maui and the $20 range is a beautiful deal. 
Atmosphere is nice and I'm guessing this place will blow up pretty quick. I'll be back soon!

It was my first time experiencing shabu shabu and it definitely will not be my last. Great service and friendly staff! The food was fresh and their demonstration was super helpful since I had not a clue what to do. The server prepped our sauces which turned out delicious! The atmosphere is very chill and the decorations are very modern chic. I enjoyed my whole experience there throughly and will be back soon!
I would have given it 5 stars but little Tokyo shabu shabu house is still my favorite. Thanks for a lovely lunch. Well worth the drive.

Took the kids here for dinner. It opened 2 weeks prior for the decor was modern and trendy as well as clean. We had the prime rib in both sukiyaki and shabu shabu the meat and vegetables were fresh. All the sauces were standard nothing extraordinary. The rice was hard so it was probably left out before being served but it wasn't cheap rice. I was happy that they didn't try to put their own spin on the dish and try to make it some type of" fusion" restaurant. Service was good. We order Extra udon noodles and edamame which never came but it worked out since I ordered too much food anyway. I recommend it anytime you are looking for a healthy meal.

Great place , good service . I love there traditional Shabu Shabu restaurant with all the seating being in a U shape . We order the pork belly ,yojie cut . And Kobe beef with spicy miso soup add $2 more . The miso soup is so delicious . I love it .
Will come back !!!

Really great food and experience.  I would definitely skip the salmon next time and just order more and more of that kobe.  It was my first time restaurant this style and it was a really great time.  It's pretty limited on the seating so try and get there before the dinner rush.

Awesome spot, when we herd it was opened up by a comedian we thought it was just going to be hype... We were absolutely wrong. Everything from apps to dessert was fantastic! We actually had Jo Koy bussing our table and cracking jokes and selfies!! This place is packed so make sure to get there ASAP! Will absolutely go back!!

Okay, a little perspective here. I have had shabu shabu in several different cities around the world and each experience had its own distinction. Yojie falls into my trendy category. It's new, it's modern and from the other reviews I have read, it mildly rubs the traditionalists the wrong way. Good. I don't want to have the same thing I have everywhere else.

I like the bar setup. I like the individual pots. I don't have to worry that my DH can't have seafood because I have an allergy. Furthermore, I don't have to squabble with him over the last piece of tofu in the pot. "Was that yours?" "No, it's mine." I take food grudges very seriously.

I do have to admit that I was not familiar with all of the vegetables provided. I did wish there was more tofu and carrots. The meat (I had beef) was sliced perfectly, however it could have been in slightly shorter pieces. The Sumo portion is 10 oz. and id regarded as XL, it was what I considered a regular portion. The goma (sesame) sauce was delicious. The only real complaint I had were technical difficulties. I didn't have a plate to put my cooked meat on and there was no skimmer to clear the water. In spite of that, the restaurant is clean tending toward spartan.

Now, I will forever love my regular shabu shabu restaurant in Green Valley, but I see myself coming to Yojie quite often. One of the main reasons being that is much closer to my area of town (only a few miles closer but far more convenient).  The service was prompt and pleasant, the servers as far as I could see were delightfully polite and attentive.

Coming from Los Angeles, with places like little Tokyo, Koreatown and Chinatown, shabu shabu is nothing new to me.

I've tried a few of the shabu shabu places here in Las Vegas over the last few months and by far this is one of my favorites.

First off, there's plenty of parking due to the large shopping area. The Kojies lies right in the southwest corner of the lot next to a comic book store.

The decor is very plain and simple with a clean and artistic feel to the restaurant. With about 20 seats in the whole restaurant, you definitely have to make sure you come at the right time.

Your shabu shabu pot comes in 2 steps. First up being your choice of protein. They also have a salmon choice and an all vegetable choice as well. Once you pick your protein from ribeye, to pork to the Koji house special, you then move on to your choice of broth.

You have a choice of a spicy broth, a clear broth, and the tonkatsu broth.

You also get your choice of two dipping sauces. One of them being the ponzu which is my favorite.

Along with the pot and comes a vegetable medley with carrots noodles broccoli and lettuce for dipping. You also get your choice of white or brown rice and chopped green onions and garlic. If you want to kick it up a notch go ahead and ask for the house chili sauce which is made from ghost peppers.

The pot is placed on electric burner right in front of you and the fun then begins. The staff was amazingly attentive. From everything from checking to make sure our dips and broth were always full to make me sure our drinks for always refilled.  

Prices were pretty decent. Around $36 for the two of us, one with the meat protein and the other one with an all vegetable and one drink.

I definitely recommend this as one of the better shabu shabu places here in Vegas.

Wow what an experience! The food is delicious and the service is second to none. Upon entering has a cool vibe. Very clean built restaurant with art work on the right side of the walls. There's USB ports under your table to charge your phones or other devices. The menu is simple to order from. I got the kobe beef samurai size. A plate of veggies, sauce, udon, and rice come with it. The sukiyaki was the flavor of the broth I went with. Sweet and savory at the same time. For dessert I had the green tea white chocolate fondue. It's being dipped with other fruits as well. I had an amazing time. Will come again during my next visit to Vegas.

Recommendation: Sukiyaki beef and Green tea white chocolate fondue

Had absolutley nothing bad to say about this hip shabu shabu joint off the strip. The venue itself is a super chic and unique setup with individual cooktops for each person. The little details in the decor were very cute and modern. Got to try all the soups since I was with a group but get the sukiyaki and egg dip .. to die for! Good job Jo Koy.

Unfortunately, my experience with the actual food was nonexistent as signing in had no positive influence on the hostess' communication efforts. Myself plus three came in and signed in at 7:11 p.m. I briefly spoke with the individual and asked if we will be called. He said, "Yes, we will call you." We went to the coffee shop next door and around 8:00 p.m., we went back in to notice every other party that came in after us have been seated.

We asked the hostess to be seated ASAP as we saw seats were open. I'm pretty sure she should be spoken to by management as her behavior was unacceptable. She said, "I am going to seat these people first who came in after you first." I said, "Do you see any logic or sense in doing that as we were skipped twice already without being contacted? The gentleman said he would call us when we are up." She responded with, "No it doesn't and I understand, but I told these people I am seating them first even though you came in an hour ago." I was so dumbfounded... What a disaster!

There's not many places to choose from when it comes to shabu/suziyaki in Vegas. I was surprised to learn that this place existed and my first initial thought was that this was a dessert type of restaurant. That's just part of the menu. It's located in a huge plaza full of other restaurants and stores.

The time it took to be seated took a while because there's not that many seats available. It wasn't crowded but my group had to wait for enough seats to open up. The customer service wasn't terrible but it could be faster. They weren't as attentive in the beginning and I waited for a while before the food came out. One of the serves definitely caught me eye as she was very cheerful and interactive with the customers. She attended to my group towards the end and unexpectedly offered free mochi ice cream.

The food itself tastes delicious!! I've had shabu several times before in California and this place was definitely up to their standards! It is on the pricer side, but I believe that it's reasonable for the quality that they provide. I ordered a suziyaki large Yojie cut which had me full and content.

Currently my favourite hot spot place to go to. Yojie is extremely consistent with its food quality and service. I wish they had a location closer to the strip, but making the drive over is pretty worth it.

I usually go for the yojie cut with spicy miso broth. The meat has nice marble to it and tastes reaaaaally good with the spicy miso broth. I've tried sukiyaki before, and it was actually a little too sweet for my taste. It also comes with udon noodles, a bunch of veggies, and rice, which are all unlimited.
I do also recommend the desserts. It's been a while before I got the green tea fondue, but that was good. On my latest trip, I ordered the ube ice cream which came with three scoops and a tiny mint leaf on top. Yummy.

The service here is usually pretty friendly and quick. The space is small, and it isn't hard getting the servers' attention. I asked if they could change the channel to an NBA playoff game, and they changed the channel right after I asked. Great service!

The interior is very modern and stylish. There are a few pieces on the wall that look cool. They're always playing great music, usually 90s-2000s R&B/hip hop. 

Consistently delivers high quality food, service, and a great vibe!

I didn't know that Jo Koy owned this restaurant. Now that's out of the way let's take about this establishment. 

It's a nice place inside but the only grumble I had was how small it was. I guess the set up is for one person per one hot plate but what if you had a big group? 

On to the food..

I ordered the ribeye meat size samurai (large) with spicy miso base. I asked if they had a paste or sauce that was spicer. OMG! They warned me about it but did I listen? NOPE! The base of my hot pot was soooooo spicy. Lol!
The prime rib comes out raw of course and you take a piece and dip it into the boiling broth. Give it less then 10 seconds and it's finished. Choose your sauce.. I got ponzu (soy sauce with lemon) and dipped my meat and ate my rice. I like my meat Rare so that's how I did all my meat. You're in charge of your food and you cook everything yourself. So you're the caption of your ship :-)

Will I be back again?? Probably not, unless they fix the sitting situation to handle parties of 4 or more. Also if you're short like my friend the hot pot itself it's kinda far. I don't have a problem but she did.

I'm so glad that I finally tried this out after reviewing on Yelp for a while. I came in for dinner and got the Yojie cut with a side of pasteurized egg. The server explained everything to me in detail and mixed mg sauces for me as well. I splurged for the tonkatsu flavored broth and dipping sauce since that's what I order with ramen. He explained to me how to cook my food and dip it in my sauce. Everything was really flavorful. Can't wait to bring my bf here to try it with me.

This had to be one of the coolest dining experiences I've had in a while. My husband, children, and I arrived for my nieces art viewing on January 7th. Her paintings are hanging on the wall at the restaurant and are absolutely beautiful. The owner of the restaurants name in is Anton. He was very nice and made sure everyone was comfortable while waiting for a table. 2 for 1 Sapporo. My husband and I shared the Samurai sizes Prime Rib Plate with Sukiyaki dip and vegetables, noodles, and white rice. The boys shared a Combo Plate with Chicken and Angus Beef and Tonkotsu dip. The girls shared a Combo Plate with Chicken and Angus Beef and Spicy Miso dip. I tried all of them with the different dips and my mouth was watering. The food was absolutely delicious. With barely any room left for dessert we still had to order one. We shared Milk Chocolate Fondue with strawberries and bananas. We will definitely be dining here again. Thanks for the great customer service Anton and staff!

Finally, a reliable shabu place on the Westside! This place already has the reputation of having a wait, so my husband and I decided to check it out on July 4, hoping there weren't too many folks leaving their backyards. We went around 5pm and had zero wait. There was actually a large party of 12 getting ready to set-up on the low-tops. As Philip T. mentioned, it is a bit awkward to have a large group here, but the staff does do their best to accommodate. Service here as super attentive and my delicious iced green tea was always replenished. I thought they did have high quality meats - I opted for the Yojie's cut (geisha size) since it seemed like the best bang for your buck. I got the Spicy Miso dip for $2 extra. Paying extra for a broth/dip is not something I'm used to so that does add to the $$$ you are shelling out. They also do have unlimited rice, but not unlimited veggies like other places. The extra money you end up paying I don't mind so much since this place is convenient. I did think it was interesting that as the owner greeted us, he kept on referring to having a nice "lunch". We ate early evening, around 5pm, so I was curious if that meant we'd get charge lunch pricing. We ended up getting charge dinner, which I was fine with, but would probably try to go for weekend lunches from now on. Although my husband and I were pretty stuffed, the server suggested the green tea and white chocolate fondue for dessert, which I'm really glad we got. Not too sweet and a perfect sharing portion for two (maybe 3) people.

The place is really nice and cozy. Good food 
The server, Michael is really accommodating. 
Will def come back.

This place is a1, especially on a cold day. 

The best thing about it is their quality and quantity of meat. You're able to get a long tray of good quality beef (Yojie Cut) that melts in your mouth. The salmon and pork belly were also very tasty. You also get a large bowl of veggies that are very fresh. My favorite broths are the tonkotsu and the sukiyaki (especially because of the egg). 

I was hesitant to dip it in the raw egg after cooking it in the sukiyaki, but I was so wrong. Go try it. It'll be the best thing that ever happens to you tbh. So don't be scared of it, it's perfectly safe and delicious!

The interior is very nice and clean; everyone is seated bar style. Service is also very nice and helpful! 

Overall, probably the best shabu shabu in town!!
Awesome food and excellent service! Very inviting and friendly atmosphere. Everything is fresh and the meat is of the highest quality. Highly recommend this place to everyone!

From the moment we walked in the the last bite everything was ON POINT!!! The food was amazing and service is phenomenal. We came for Mother's Day dinner and enjoyed every second. I highly recommend it to anyone. The servers explain everything very well. Can't say enough good things about the whole experience!!
Had the Kobe Beef with Sukiyaki broth.  It was amazing.  Also, the service was top notch.  Highly recommend.

So I finally got a chance to hit this place up and see what all the fuss was about. It was an easy choice for a late birthday celebration as it is right down the street from me and I heard alot of really good things about it. I have to say the service was great and vibe of the place is inviting, modern and fun. The wait staff was really friendly and informative on the choices and on how to get the most out of the experience there. They have plenty of choices although I felt a bit confused on how they compartmentalized the different combinations. I just went with the one that appealed to me the most which was the strait forward shabu shabu option. After going ahead and diving into to the hot pot style dinner, I thought the food was good and the process was pretty fun. At the end we tried the condensed broth after it reduced down with all of the flavors of the vegetables and it tasted a bit flat. Gladly our waitress saw us desperately dousing our dirty water broth with soy sauce and offered a bit of udon soup base that we gladly accepeted. After lacing the boiling water with some of the base it was a compellingly improved product. Overall, I enjoyed it for what it is and recommend it to anyone looking to try shabu shabu for a date night or celebration dinner. For the same price though, Shabu grill in henderson offers much more variety, and it's all you can eat. That being said, yojie is much more attractive of a setting and might be a better bet if you're trying to make an impression on someone special.

Combo pork belly with udon and veggie cost $16.99 good for lunch but do not order Kobe beef $26.99 not worthy because taste no different btw regular beef with this kobe beef- this quality of kobe beef not worth $26.99. Already inform waitress but they do not accept our opinion for improvement. Environment is clean and comfortable.

This place makes my top 5 favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. Location is far from my home but every time I get the chance to drive up to Summerlin I make sure to stop by. Only thing I do not like is that they close in between lunch and dinner. I've came before and we had to wait a whole hour until dinner started in order to dine in (super annoying!). 

Place is pretty cool, lots of local art on the walls (love seeing my friends art up there). Very clean and bright with a choice of sitting on high or low bar. We always choose low bar, for some reason we do not like the high bar. 
My go to is always the "Chicken Breast, in Sukiyaki, no egg instead I ask for swisher and ponzu sauce, and an extra veggie bowl no udon noodles extra thin ones instead". Ask for their hot sauce it is so good in your broth but be careful, it is really really spicy!!!!!! (use 3-4 drops). 

Staff is always super friendly and on their A game. They also have a rewards system that accumulates points but not sure exactly how it works, I just know we have one.

Just amazing.. I've already come here about 3 times I'm not even sure if I checked in on the third time I was just excited to get things going.
So I feel like the 5 stars really have to be earned in every aspect of a restaurant from how clean it is in the eating area as well as bathrooms, customer service and attention to detail, atmosphere, then finally the food presentation and taste... this place has it all.. 
The lighting was perfect.. this is no joke but there was soft music playing in the background and if you listened closely.. it was tupac.. I was blown away... this place made tupac sound like Marvin Gaye just by adjusting the lighting.. blown away.. 90s hip-hop literally played softly in the background lol it was the best.
All of that warm fun stuff aside the broth was great.. look I can't explain everything about a place where you just make your own soup lol you'll have to take my word for it AND get the chocolate dipped strawberries..
Fresh and amazing flavors great ambiance love the Sauces  and the Kobe beef Shabu Shabu I believe is Japanese fondue but 10 times better for you

This was my first time ever trying Japanese fondu and this place is bomb!! I would recommend this place ten times over. I had such a good experience! When I told them it was my first time they made sure to show me how everything worked she helped me pick out which broth I wanted and gave me recommendations! Great customer service all over. I had the combo beef and chicken and it was amazing! It came with veggies and noodles and two pieces of tofu. You get to choose two sauces to go with your meat and veggies. Definitely try this place you won't be disappointed.

Came here because I love Orange Chicken, instead it's a Shabu Shabu place (google it!). For a second I thought it must be the JollyBee place next door! OK, enough of those! Of course everyone is here hoping to meet Jo Koy, no tourist drives half way across Vegas for boiled broccoli! And honestly I would have put up with any food or place for a chance to take another pic with Jooo-sep! But as soon as you get in you switch to a different gear, it's an upscale, take it seriously place and you wonder if you're in the wrong restaurant (again, you think it must be that Jollybee!). Great setup, upscale, great service, no nonsense, "we are not joking about this" kind of place. You get all the info you need to order, I got the Sumo kobe and my wife got the Geisha Yojie cut and the quality of meats and ingredients is top notch. Including the hot Tiramisu tea, absolutely try that. They took care of every detail and everything is put together just to make sure it's done right. Definitely a place to put on your list when in Vegas, you got this one right Jo but don't quit your day job!
Hannah is a great server and the food is amazing. Be warned, you have to bring your own cheese because they don't have any.

SHABU SHABU!!! 

I LOVE shabu.... it would be my go to whenever I can't think of something to eat because it is like a home cooking meal... plus you can keep yourself entertained by cooking your own food if you are eating ALONE! 

Just like MOST shabu places that I have dined at... they have individual pots & burners for each person on a high counter top... although lately I have been seeing more places w/ low counter tops which is nice just in case if you can't get onto the high top! This place is clean cut & simply decorated which I always like when there isn't too much clutter! They have one side bright & other side dark, & the counter tops are all white (makes me cautious of how I eat so I don't look like a SLOB ahahahaaa) 

Our server "O" (that's his name) was freaken AWESOME so calm & professional yet very friendly & approachable... he made me a little jealous as being a server myself made me admire the way he carried himself. He informed us of what they were about & all the steps of the process... we wanted but he whole experience even though we know everything about shabu after trying so many different places in Cali.

SAMURAI YOJIE'S CUT $20.99 - Hubby got this w/tonkatsu base which is $2.99 more but that DAMN soup base is freaken DERICIOUS!!!!! You just can't stop slurping up the soup. Samurai size is 7 oz. of meat.

GEISHA PORK BELLY (side)$5.99 - I guess if you add a side it's cheaper as we are fatties we wanted more variety & got a side of thinly sliced pork belly that complimented the tonkatsu soup base so well! the geisha is 5 oz. of meat.

SUMO YOJIE'S CUT $23.99 - I eat more than the bois & got the SUMO size which is 10 oz. of meat which is nice that they also state how many oz. everything is so you know how much to expect. This cut although I dunno what exactly it is... it's dericious... ahahaha 

SAMURAI PRIME RIB $24.99 - roomie got this & it was good as well... but IMHO I can't really taste the difference when it is shabu... but.. definitely wanna try the wagyu one day which I am SURE you could taste the difference.

GTWC STRAWBERRY & BANANA $6.99 - This was a dessert fondue. umm... I really hated that I had to share... but I at least got to eat/ drink/ slurp down the rest of the Green Tea White Chocolate fondue sauce. =] w/ the help of O I was able to stay classy as he brought me a little spoon to devour the sauce in class. 

ICE COFFEE $3.99 - chilled & served w/ cream & simple syrup on the side.
CALPICO $3.99 - served w/ a cherry which makes it fun 
CHERRY BLOSSOM TEA $3.99 - this was served in the newest technology for tea brewing which I have seen a lot at teavanna where you stick the bottom of the pot to the top of the cup.

I WILL BE BACK TOO MANY TIMES IN THE FUTURE I KNOW IT...

Our family frequents several of the restaurants in this plaza, and Yojie has been on our radar for some time.  It's cool looking, sleek decor... and my favorite comedian (Jo Koy) apparently owns it.  Last night was a cold night, so we decided to try it out. 

A cold Friday night... I figured it would be packed.  Well it was about 1/2 full when we got there for dinner.  Always a suspicious sign.  We sat down on the lower counter. 

Servers were super friendly.  I like that.  She walked us through the menu and knew what we wanted.  

Wife order the prime rib.  My 8-yr old ordered he sashimi salmon.  I ordered the Angus. 

The WORST part of this concept... they upcharge EVERYTHING!!  $2 extra for this, $1 for that, $3 of this.   Just charge $35-$39 per person and include it.  Do you really need to charge for 2-3 leaves of cabbage?

The only soup broth that is free is the original shabu shabu.  I guess water and a little piece of seaweed.  lol.  Wtf?!  

Perhaps this is keeping to the traditions, but who really cares?!  Jo Koy isn't even Japanese!   lol. 

They charge extra if you want a flavored broth.  And don't forget, you only get two dipping sauces.  If you want the third, yep... you guessed it, you'll have to pay.  

A meal for two adults and an 8 yr old was $150 with tip.   

I promise, if they charge $35 per entree, the place would have a line out the door and the bill would be the same.  I doubt we will be back.  There just wasn't anything that we loved.   We liked a lot of it, but nothing that we woke up craving.

We were nearby and this was highly rated by Yelp so we took the plunge.  The place is decorated very modern and sleek.   We ordered the pork and beef shabu shabu and it did not disappoint.  Food was fresh and delicious.   Service was good but it could have been better.  Definitely would go back.

Jo Koy's restaurant!  It is located about 25 minutes from the Strip, about an $18 Uber ride.  Definitely worth it!

If you like Shabu Shabu, this is your place!  

Customer service was off...  Our server was friendly & bubbly but she kept on messing up our orders, forgetting to bring us what we asked for, just a mess!  But the food, man the food, was worth dealing with it.

Yojie's Cut:  A must order!  Phenomenal cut of beef!
Kobe Beef:  Delicious & tender!
Sukiyaki (side of egg for dipping):  A sweet & savory broth!  So darn tasty!  I have been to several Shabu Shabus & this is by far the best dips!  What is unique is the egg.  They crack open an egg, scramble it, & after you cook your meat in the dip, you dip it again in this raw egg scramble.  Amazing!
Raindrop:  Okay... do not order this.  It literally tastes like nothing.  Imagine water as a jello, BINGO!

We arrived around 10:25 but didn't get in until 10:31 and they denied letting us eat. 
Even though they close at 11:30 and they said their last call is at 10:30. 
There was also another couple in there and we would have been the other couple they'd have served.
This isn't the first time coming here, and their service is actually pretty good. We came in late past their last call like 10:35 one time and they let us eat. But I guess this time they were just lazy.

Well, can't say enough about how friendly this place is.  Staff, all staff, is awesome.  They open at 1130 - but today it was very cold for Vegas and they opened the door early for us at 1100 so we could get out of the cold.  It's a cook yourself style of eating is case you didn't get it.  The prices are reasonable, the sauces are fantastic (they have ghost pepper !!!) and the green tea fondue is awesome.  If it's your first time try lunch - a bit cheaper and slower so you can learn what it's about.

Service was great, food is ok not very impressive.
Size. We ordered Samurai. Go for Samurai/ Sumo if you don't want to feel hungry afterwards. 
We ordered Yojie's cut and prime rib, thought prime rib would be better (more expensive), but it's not. They cut the prime rib super thin can barely pick it up (break into pieces when u pickup the beef slices from the plate to the the hotpot). It's too thin to cook it shrink within 2 seconds in the hot broth. Maybe I was just unlucky they sliced the prime rib paper thin (or they trying to save some money by slicing it super thin?)
The Yojie's cut was perfect tho. So save a few dollars and order Yojie's cut friends 
For the soup (we tried all 4 kinds). 
Don't order shabu shabu  unless you like super blend hot water, the kombu(seaweed) was too small to add any flavour to the water. 
Sukiyaki is a bit sweet which I don't like. +$2 (you will get a pasteurised egg as dipping sauce)
Spicy miso is ok. +$2
Tonkotsu (pork broth) is my favourite!  + $3 

I don't think I'll come back too soon as the food is not very impressive, maybe 2-3 times a year

Hands down the best place to eat in Vegas! Worth the price and the service they offer here is honestly the best I've ever had. Their workers are diligent and friendly! From the amazing artwork to the delicious cuisine the offer, it keeps you wanting to come everyday! Cute workers as well and charismatic people here! Definitely would recommend this place to anyone who is a foodie or enjoys anything aesthetically pleasing! Yojie Japanese Fondue deserves higher than 5 stars
Amazing food and amazing service. I always get spicy miso with pork belly. My favorite place to eat. I think I've eaten there a million times already. Lol

I came here with a friend for lunch. I got the tonkatsu broth and my friend got the miso broth. We both enjoyed our broths. The meat quality was great. I personally love pork with my hotpot and their pork was tasty and juicy. The only thing that had me rate 4/5 was the dipping sauces and the broth. Dipping sauces were limited and I have definitely had better broth. I am a big broth person.

From the atmosphere to the food, this place was amazing!

The atmosphere of this place was so nice and quaint. The modern est style of the store is to die for. Also the fact that they had "Takeshi Castle" on while I was eating was a HUGE plus! I love that show so much.

Food is such a different style I have never had. The fondue style of eating was new to me and a pleasant surprise. Not only that but the Chocolate fondue at the end was to die for!! I was thinking of coming to this place again for the chocolate fondue ALONE!

If you have some time and want to try out an amazing, casual upscale elegant restaurant, With staff so nice and helpful, YOU SHOULD. DO IT because this place is worth a try, it will get your hooks into you.

Ordered Yojie's cut, spicy miso, ponzu and swisher sauce. Green iced tea. 
Food quality 4/5. I'm not meat expert but sure taste yummy with the sauce.
Drink 3/5. Green ice tea, nothing spectacular. Taste like any other tea in my opinion. 
Service 4/5. Knowledgable and very helpful but lacking attention to details ie drink refills. Not a big deal... Had to flag them down several times for a refill and additional napkins. 
Ambiance 4/5 loved the artwork. Music was a bit excessively loud on some songs. Not sure what happen there. 
Restroom cleanliness 4/5. Nice modern sink. 
Experience 5/5 fun and entertaining. Good place to dine with friends or date night out. 
Would return again =]

I had heard great things about Yojie so I came for lunch on a saturday. I did not know what to expect as I had never heard of shabu shabu, the restaurant's specialty.  The waitress sat me down at a counter and explained the menu, the sauces, and the cooking process.  After she teaches you it is pretty self explanatory - you simply dip the meat and vegetables into the cooking broth and cook it as long as you want.  You can then even make a soup out of the used broth if you desire.  You also get a few sauces for dipping.  With each shabu shabu meal you are given noodles and vegetables, as well as the chosen meat.  I only had the geisha and was full after eating the entire ensemble.  

The meal was delicious, unique, and a must visit if looking for something unique in Las Vegas.  It costs around $15-$20 depending on the meal chosen, so not too expensive.  The seating is at the counter though so it could be a problem if you have a large group, but other than that I recommend this place.  Shabu shabu is one of my new favorite meals.

#2 review for Yelp 100 Challenge 

Dip, swirl, and swallow.  Double dip if you dare. It's all good. It's shabu shabu! Don't forget to masticate and savor each flavor your palate tastes.

I made sure we were going to dine here during our Vegas trip for Thanksgiving 2015.  I had to see JoKoys new spot.  Gotta support the Kuyas out there!

Dana greeted us with a smile and what started out as a miscommunication regarding reservations worked out at the end.  So. It's a solid 4 1/2  stars.  

The place was designed as a typical shabu spot I've been to. Rectangular layout of seatings, counter style.  This way the servers can efficiently maneuver themselves around all the customers.   It's modern and sleek design gives it a great ambiance to dine for small and large groups.  One side is the low bar section  and opposite side is the high bar.  I like the low bar.  Makes me feel safer since I'm short.  Hahaha

I started with their Organic green tea with diffuser.  Cute little gadget which I am not accustomed to.  But I figured it out.  Loved the warmth of the hot tea for the 40 degree temp in sin city.

Dana was great at explaining how their menu works even though it wasn't our first time having shabu shabu.  I like to see that at new establishments.  So, thank you Dana.  You did great sweetie!

We ordered-
Kurobuta pork in sukiyaki.  Fresh. Tasty. Loved it.

Pork belly in tonkatsu. Duuuuude... oink heaven!

Prime rib in sukiyaki was my fav.   Absolutely great quality of meats there Josep!

Loved the service.  Parking was a breeze at a huge shopping plaza.

Definitely a must do when I'm in Vegas again!  Can't wait to return!

I have been waiting to eat here but never had the time. But last week, we finally go the chance to give it a try. So, I say YEYEYEYEY! I love the ambiance and the customer care was on point. They will be your spirit guides into the fun world of Shabu Shabu. As you take into this journey of boiling hot goodness, you will savor flavors from just shabu shabu (which is the plain broth) all the way to Miso Spicy (my fave)--i love that it gives that essential kick you long for in your food. I ordered the Yojie Cut (great angus beef), with the Atlantic Salmon **at sashimi grade** slices, and it was amazing. All the flavors come together when topped with the Goma sauce on RICE! Veggies that come with your meal are fresh and crunchy, so don't over cook! Watch your items like they're your first born child, for with this in mind handling with care AT ALL TIMES. Altogether, finish your journey with some desert. I had the ube ice cream (just coz), but they're well known for their fruits dipped in chocolate fondue so TREAT YoSELF!

I normally prefer chinese hot pot over japanese shabu shabu, but this place is unique.  I would say this place is hipster/ trendy, clean, pristine, and they have anime playing on TV (Samurai Shampoo to be exact).  

Broths: I got the tonkatsu broth, which includes two sauces - Goma and Ponzu.  The server added a few extra seasonings to my sauces (I can't remember everything he put in there, but I do remember chilli oil and sesame seeds).  My brother got the spicy miso broth and that was full of flavor.  I've been to other shabu shabu places, and I've never had broth like this.

I ordered the Yojie's Cut dinner Sumo size (10oz of beef).  This comes with rice, veggies, and noodles.  The 10oz was super filling, but it was so good that I wanted more!  I like the presentation of the beef and veggies.  

For dessert, we ordered the strawberry and bananas fondue with green tea white chocolate.  I'm not typically a fan of green tea chocolate, but I was mind blown with the flavor.  It was shared with 6 people, so it didn't go to waste.  Typically, this dessert can be shared with 2-3 people.  

Also, I had the cherry blossom hot tea.  It was interesting to see it served in a tea infuser.

Overall I had a really good experience (and more so hooked) to this place.
Really enjoyed their signature selection! Flavorful yet simple. The green tea fondue was amazing!

Yojie's is amazing.  My friends and I come here as often as we can.  We live in Henderson, but definitely worth the trip!  Service has always been amazing but tonight, Kesley really made our dining experience even more AMAZING!  Save room for dessert!

This is my new favorite restaurant! My girlfriend and I went for her birthday and we had an amazing experience! The food was amazing and filling for the price! All the employees are super friendly and willing to help you with anything you're not sure about. We got to meet the owner and he seemed to be a really nice guy. I highly recommend this place if you're looking for something different.
I guess I had high expectations.  The soup was bland for my taste.  For the price of each bowl, I found it to be expensive.  Would I return, likely not.

First of all, let me say, "YAY! I'm a fan!,". Even though I hit all 5 stars, I feel like this spot is going to be even MORE amazing in a short time, so you should get yourself over there asap! My husband and I had a great time, as well as enjoy the wonderful food. 

As soon as we walked in, we knew we were in a place that exemplified the example of "shabu shabu subject matter experts" haha. Anton the owner knows his restaurant, his food, and his team. From the beautiful art and mirrors on the artfully tiled walls, to the ambiance of immersive, enjoyable music and entertaining television, we knew were came to the right place. We had many places like this to visit back home in Orange County, but when we saw this in Las Vegas (where we live now), our eyes opened and mouths dropped LOL! Yay! Shabu Shabu!!

Denise was the first to say hello to us and accommodated us immediately as soon as we walked in. She was very approachable and went over all of the menu details with us. My husband needed a Shabu Shabu protocol refresher since it had been a while since he had said cuisine, and Denise was great at presenting us with the manner in which the food was to be served to us. 

As Denise prepped the broth, Carl came to us and offered drinks. He eagerly shared how excited they are to start serving libations soon, and kindly apologized for not having their upcoming saketinis just yet. No apology needed. We're coming back when you do! :) Cheers!

Anton then came and said hello, and introduced himself as the owner. His enthusiasm and pride in his work definitely showed through as he spoke with each of the patrons eating there. I am so excited for this team and i hope this location succeeds! 

We were also served by Anna and Mica...basically everyone made their rounds to all of the customers to make sure everyone was ok, so I have to say that they did a great job in keeping all of the food fresh, tea and water filled, and guests happy. 

Aside from speaking to the servers and owner, my husband didn't say much of a word to me...not because he was unhappy, but because his mouth was always so full! What a piggie. We both left very happy and satisfied after a final treat to some Mochi. The green tea was our fave! 

We'll be back. Sorry we didn't get to meet the chefs back there. You deserve a big thank you as well. Your rice is on point and perfect! We'll be back! Best of success and luck to Yojie's!

Been a long time since I had Shabu Shabu in Japan, so I read that this place was good so I decided to drive clear across town to check it out. The server was both knowledgeable and helpful. I ordered the medium sized house specialty beef....it was plenty for me and I am a big eater. I also order the medium spicy broth... it was ok... next time I think I will go with the sukiyaki for a change. I want by myself, it would have been more fun with a group I think. The meal comes with assorted raw veggies and noodles to make soup at the end. Also comes with rice. The cost was around $22 for lunch. I will come back for another round!!

Awesome Shabu! Best in Vegas by far. 
Figured I'd have to go back to Orange County to eat decent Shabu, but this place hit the spot. 

Heard about it on the Adam Carolla podcast; had to check it out to support the "Joy" pirate ship. 

Had the house beef and finished off the meal with the green tea/white chocolate fondue.

We really love this restaurant. They have great bowls with prime rib and other kinds of meats and food. You can choose a different kind of flavor for your meat period they do a great job period it's a healthy way of cooking.

I've eaten at a lot of shabu places across the west coast and this is one of my less favorite chains.  The sukiyaki is decent.  The prices are inflated for what they are in terms of portions.  Only a small amount of vegetables are given.  2 thin scraps of carrots and 6 enoki mushrooms?!  At least pack the bowl with napa (which is extremely cheap) to make it look like I'm getting my money's worth.

I've had Japanese hot pot maybe four times, two of which were at Yojie. So far, I've tried the tonkotsu and sukiyaki broths with Yojie's cut (beef) and chicken. I prefer the tonkotsu over sukiyaki as the sukiyaki broth was a bit too sweet for me. Though, I did enjoy the pasteurized egg to dip the meats in when I had the sukiyaki broth. It was a good combination and added a buttery flavor to the meat after being cooked in the sweet broth. My husband chose the spicy miso broth both times and it is great for all the spice lovers. It's not overly spicy, but if you want an extra kick, ask for the ghost pepper sauce. Seriously, you only need maybe two drops of it and it can be added to any broth. 

The cuts of meat are a good portion because you're also given a bowl of assorted vegetables and udon plus a cup of rice. The first time I had Yojie's cut with chicken and it was a lot for me that I had leftovers. The second time, I chose Yojie's cut, geisha size (5 oz) and it was the perfect amount of meat for me. You also have a choice of two dipping sauces. I chose the goma and ponzu sauce. The ponzu sauce had a better flavor in my opinion. 

On the second trip, hubs ordered the green tea white chocolate fondue with strawberries and bananas. I tried a bite and the blend of green tea with white chocolate was surprisingly amazing. Even if you aren't a green tea fan, it's definitely worth a try. 

This place is also good for those on a low carb diet as I currently am. I skipped the rice and had just a bit of udon, but mostly the veggies with the meat and was full enough.

I can't wait to return and try other meats with the broths, maybe the pork belly, also their teas and other desserts when I'm not limiting my caffeine and carbs.

My first time eating here was great. The restaurant is clean; the atmosphere, classy; and the food, delicious. 

The layout of the restaurant makes for easy and quick service, as customers are basically seated around the servers. There are TVs placed around the tables in case your date is boring, and your phone is running out of battery. (Just kidding, but when I was there, they were playing this hilarious Japanese show about obstacle courses. My friend and I were thoroughly entertained.)

The prices for the menu items are justified, considering the market prices of the different types of meat. I ordered the yojie's cut with sukiyaki broth and brown rice for dinner. My server was attentive enough to make sure I was ok with the egg being uncooked, which I appreciate a great deal. 

The stoves are controlled by the servers, and the water takes some time to heat up, but once it's hot, the meat cooks extremely quickly. Each table top has a bottle of water that is used both for drink refills and cooking water refills. Water and rice refills are free. I honestly love how self-paced this restaurant is, while also keeping servers close to the customers at all times. The restaurant also has cute "first-timer" signs to put in front of customers, so servers will come to explain various aspects of the shabu-shabu eating experience to them.

This place has an eye for the small details. I will definitely come back.

I like this place bc it has so many options. It isn't AYCE so the quality is much better and the prices aren't bad. You choose the cut of meat and size that you want. 

The first time I came here I got the salmon, which I've never seen as an option at any other shabu shabu places and it was really good. The second time I got yojie's cut, which isn't the best quality option available but still hit the spot. 

Best parts are the sauces and dessert fondue. There was also a random 2 for 1 beer special when we went.

Wowwww I've been to loads of Japanese fondue places but this one was by far the best I've ever had. All the broths they had are AMAZING and definitely added flavor to their high quality meats! They give you a bunch of vegetable as well. Rice and veggies are unlimited and comes with the whole thing! The vibe here is great and they played some good music that my friends and I jammed out to while eating! It's such a chill spot and the staff were so friendly and attentive! Definitely coming back to this place soon! Definitely a favorite

This place is small but full of flavors!  The broth are so good and flavorful. Meats are great. I hope they have more choice on the seatings instead of bars set up. For us with little kid in tow, it would be more comfortable to have a family meal on a table or booth. Definitely coming back especially colder days are around the corners.

Service was terrible. No system for seating people. We were told to sign in and they'd call us when there were seats available. Then people just walked in and sat down and got served before us. Dining areas not clean. Food is good though.

First time ever at Yojie the service was so amazing that I contemplated bringing my resume and working there. Friendly, attentive, staff fully understands the menu, and always presented neatly. The service is just a feature of its polished product. The neatly placed vegetables or equal positioned layers of meat on the plate will bring smiles to any OCD freaks. 

From some perspectives the single digit quantity of meat may not seem like much, but Japanese hot pot (or any hot pot for that matter) is a long meal, providing satisfaction over a period of working time, allowing you to enjoy each bite you prepared for yourself. Your patience might be tested though as there is usually a line, and unconventional seating along an counter (sort of hinders group conversations, so avoid for double dates/meeting the folks)

Favorites include the Yojie's cut, prime rib, pork belly, Arnold Palmer-San (refills included), and the green tea fondue.

This place. The bomb.com!

Everyone here is so nice, respectful, neat, just wonderful. I will be back Herr and will bring people here with me. Hopefully jokoy will be there on my next visit. Thank guys, you are the best.

Food was okay, but my wife and I came to try a saketini. We were told they didn't have a liquor license, but the people next to us had two bottles of sake brought to them while we were there. No one explained the situation to us, so I'm left to assume that some customers are treated differently here. 

Disappointed in the customer service.

Awesome food and fantastic service! This place is really really cool! Each seat has its own induction stove where the broth is placed and cooked along vegetables, noodles, and your choice of meat. It was my first time there and I really enjoyed it. Also, our server, Ozi (not sure if I spelled her name right) was super sweet, friendly, and helpful. And for those who are fans of the comedian, Jo Koy, he is actually one of the owners there! 

Be sure to add this on your list of restaurants to eat the next time you're in Vegas.

Yojie Japanese Fondue is a small Shabu Shabu / Fondue spot located in the Village Square. The restaurant has a clean and cozy look. Though the name of the restaurant says that is a Japanese fondue place, I have never seen anyone who ordered fondue. Everyone who goes to Yojie orders Shabu Shabu. 

In my opinion, their food is 5/10. The ingredients are very fresh and well-prepped. However, their broth / soup is way too sweet. In fact, the sweetness of their broth / soup kills the actual taste of the ingredients. Their serving size is relatively small, but I could not finish my food because of this reason.

The service was great. Thanks to the restaurant's small size, the servers can reach you quickly and pay close attention to all of the customers. They always ask you to see if you need anything else. Their cozy atmosphere and friendly service add up to a good overall experience.

Maybe I will go back in the future to try their fondue, but I would not eat their Shabu Shabu...
I friggen love this place! Definitely coming back! I really enjoy experimenting with food and this allows you to mix sauces and combine different meats together! This place is bomb diggity
Everything I've had here is excellent.  My favorite is the kurobuta pork shabu shabu...I always get the goma and ponzu sauces.  I drive across town to eat here...well worth it!

I have been to at least 15 shabu restaurants and this is one of the best.  The quality of the meat is very high and the soup made at the end was one of the best I have ever had.  The amount of vegetables provided was less than average but they were fresh.  Great choice for LV

I honestly can't say enough positive things about the experience my girlfriend and I had tonight. I arrived in Vegas at 9 PM after a long five hour drive from Phoenix, and after checking into my hotel I hit up Yelp for a recommendation for late night dining. I'd never had Japanese fondue before, but after looking at the menu and reading the stellar reviews, my girlfriend and I headed out. 

We arrived at a beautiful little restaurant in a quiet shopping center (though it's probably busier before 10 PM) and upon walking in were greeted by a cheerful hostess, fun, modern decor, and a sparkling clean dining area. Unexpectedly, the owners, phenomenal stand-up comedian Jo Koy and his business partner Anton Guerrero, were there, and after a mildly embarrassing star-struck handshake, Jo graciously offered to order for my girlfriend and I. 

I wound up with the samurai portion of kobe beef with  shabu shabu and sukiyaki. Everything was delicious, but the kobe beef cooked in the sukiyaki and then dipped in the pasteurized egg is particularly incredible. My girlfriend had the steak and salmon combo with sukiyaki and miso (both of which were tasty as well) and Jo bought us dessert, the green tea and white chocolate fondue. Even with a couple of premium items on the tab (and a delicious coconut sake), we walked out for less than $100 including tax and a 20% tip. It should be noted, however, that you could easily walk away satisfied for half that price with more basic options (though the kobe beef was worth every penny).

The food alone was worthy of five stars, but the service and attention to detail were stellar as well. The wait staff were attentive and helpful as they taught us newcomers how to prepare our food and offered much appreciated tips along the way. Jo and Anton also went out of their way to make us feel welcome and provided a lively, engaging atmosphere fueled by Jo's inherent wit along with some surprisingly earnest and introspective conversation. They showed a genuine interest in our story and made us feel immediately welcomed and at ease. 

We talked, we laughed, we ate, and ultimately my girlfriend and I walked away with a five star dining experience that we will never forget. Thank you so much to Jo, Anton, and the rest of the staff at Yojie for a wonderful evening. I couldn't recommend it more.

Yojie is easily one of my favorite local eats! I highly suggest getting the combo plate as it is very filling and you get to pick two different options. I got mine with chicken and beef with the sukiyaki sauce and boy oh boy was I blown away!!! The sauce was sweet but savory and paired well with both meats. They give you an array of vegetables, noodles and choice of rice with every pot! I surprisingly saved room for desert and got the dark chocolate fondue with strawberries and bananas! You won't go wrong with choosing Yojie!

This place is awesome! Let's start with the service, they were all so friendly, patient and quick to serve us. Our waitress Ozzy cared for us very well. The food is great quality. We all ordered different items including desert and none of us were disappointed. It was a new experience to all of us but Our waitress guided us through it. You can't go wrong with anything you order here. My kids are super picky and yet they loved it!
Honestly one of my favorite restaurants in all of Vegas, just in a terrible location hence why they're always seem to be so slow... just hope it doesn't go away one of these days
The restaurant is cute and super clean.  Very popular with Asians.  The food is fresh and delicious.  Good dining experience.
Flavorful broths make this place much more than the shabu shabu. Very clean and friendly service!
Best Shabu place in Vegas hands down! Good quality of meat. Good customer service. Everybody is super friendly. And let me tell you about their desserts omg ORGASM in my mouth . Must try!!!

I've never had shabu shabu before, but our meal at Yojie was such a memorable experience! My husband and I went out to eat with a friend who will be moving out of town soon, and I'm so glad that we went to this restaurant because it was such a fun meal that we will remember.

The decor is very nice, and it's obvious that everything about this restaurant was well thought out. The napkins and chopsticks were set out in such a cute way, the bar looked so nice, it was very appealing. I'm glad that we came with a small group because it is a very intimate restaurant with two counters. They were playing hilarious Japanese game shows on the television screens and we enjoyed them.

The food itself was great! Having never tried japanese fondue before I feel uncomfortable giving it a five star rating, but it was probably a 4.5! My husband and I split the largest portion of the house beef, and it was a filling meal. He has tried a lot of subiyaki during a time that he lived in Korea, and insisted that the meal was traditional and great. They do charge 5$ to split an order, but you also get an extra portion of rice, your own pot (so you can choose different broths if you would like) and your own sauces. My husband tried subiyaki and I tried the spicy miso. The miso tasted wonderful but was not as spicy as I would have liked (and I am not very tolerant of hot food)! I added chili sauce, though, and it was just fine. My husband loved the subiyaki, so if you would like a sweet broth, that's the one to pick!

We didn't order any dessert because the meal was so filling, but if we return I would try the white chocolate and green tea fondue. 

Overall, I'm really happy that we ate here. This would be a wonderful date night restaurant, we will be back!

I'm not sure why anyone could give this place less than 5 stars. The service is top notch and the food is delicious. We have been twice now and the first time we got wagyu beef and salmon and this time we did the Kobe beef and salmon. Both experiences were exceptional and have us wanting to come back for more. They do not have their liquor license which is a bummer but it will not stop us from indulging again.

Yojie is on the west side!  I drove all the way from the other side of town to try this Shabu Shabu.  Love it.  The bar stools for seating are low and high for your preference.  It's not a big restaurant.  There was no alcoholic beverages yet at the time we went.  October 29.  The broth for the sukiyaki I picked and friend picked spicy miso broth were both Delish!!
Excellent customer service and food to match. THe owner is very involved and enthusiastic and very welcoming

This place is amazing and such a great place to eat and have fun!  It is very interactive as you cook your own food in a broth of your choosing and you get a pick selection of meats you can choose from and you get a bunch of vegetables with whatever meat you choose from.  

Also as an added bonus if you like more than one broth you can get both!  They give you a bowl that a a tray in the middle that separates the broths.  This place is good for groups but you are sitting at a bar so you will be sitting in a straight line no face to face so that is something to consider if you area trying to do a social outing. 

This place is amazing and I go here all the time and I am always telling my friends to go as well.  I would recommend to where long pants because the seats are metal and can get really cold.  It is situated in a very nice area and I cant wait to go here again!

This was such a fun experience
I got the spicy ramen type broth 
Everything we had was delicious
Very nice place 2 eat first time eating here it was great we had a great time me and my hubby and my baby she ate noodles this whole thing was great will go again and again yes

Went back today! Totally different experience. Servers were super lazy. One lady was even braiding her hair has she was serving the food. All the girls were on their cell phones and basically ignored the customers. Don't think I will return. 

We will miss you Shannon, you were awesome. 

Today our server Haniza Arianna was a -1 star.
