I like shabu shabu and its concept. You get a plate of thinly sliced beef and "shabu shabu" the meat in hot pot (FYI Shabu shabu is onomatopoeia term, a sound that comes from stirring the meat in water or sauce). Growing up eating shabu shabu at home, I wasn't too fond of the vibe or the price here. In Japan, you can get a pack of thinly sliced beef at less than 1,000 yen ($10) so I was surprised to see them charging $15-20 a pot. Traditionally it's an affordable dish that is to be shared with a group. 

I walked-in and was not greeted or seated for 15 minutes. A worker was busy on the phone which bothered me. She was friendly but not attentive. I would dock a star just for the service here. 

I decided to get Yojie's cut which is angus cut and their recommended plate. They have different sizes (3oz, 5oz, 7oz, 10oz) and all plates comes with a bowl of vegetables, noodles and a choice of white or brown rice. I went with 5oz or Geisha which was $14.99 (lunch). You can also choose your dipping soup/sauce option. I went ahead with shabu shabu style and got goma and ponzu sauce.

5oz Yojie's cut came with about 10 shabu shabu meat. Shabu shabu is cooked fast, you just need to dip in water about 10 seconds and is ready to eat. Goma sauce is a sesame sauce and had rich taste to it. Ponzu was citrusy and refreshing with meat. I also got to try their swisher sauce which is my personal favorite. 

5oz was not filing even after finishing their bowl of vegetables/noodle and rice. I understand they use quality meat but you are looking at about $20 with tip and tax or even more for a fairly small portion. In addition, you don't share the pot in a group. I guess Yojie has Americanized take on shabu shabu and I am not sure if I am a fan.

Music and hot pot is definitely the highlight of my experience here.  The use of old school hip hop and R&B and raw egg as a dipping sauce is fantastic.  But the icing on the cake is when you watch people who don't know how to eat Japanese Fondue with a piece of raw egg in front of them.

My go to here is the prime rib and sukiyaki with a cherry blossom tea.

If you've never ate here, don't be shy to ask staff on how to eat things.  However, it's important to note that you just add veggies to your soup to flavor it up for your meat which should be swished in the broth for about 10 seconds only.  The raw egg is used as a dipping sauce for your veggies and meat!  Magic!

The only negative part that I would say is the side by side seating.  So if you have a party of more than 1 then you would have to lean forward or back to communicate with the person you're not sitting next to.

Based on the reviews, I was really excited to check this place out. But I was disappointed. First, they've been open for a year and still don't have their liquor license?! WTF? The food was kind of bland (to me). The sauces didn't help much. Fondue is interesting and different, but I guess I would have just rather have my food cooked for me. I asked for extra veggies. The veggies I got were 1 floret of broccoli, 2 small strips of carrots, 1 little portebello mushroom, a bit of shiitake mushrooms, and some lettuce. It was pretty bland and not appetizing. They could benefit from having more veggies and some ginger (who doesn't have ginger at a Japanese place?!). The atmosphere and look of the place is cool though!
Good was great and service was even better....the menu is easy to understand especially if it's your first time having shabu shabu... we will definitely be back
Normally a huge fan of this place, but today the sukiyaki broth was about half normal strength which was very disappointing.

This is a hot pot slash fondue type restaurant in Summerlin area. I had a really good dinner tonight with a friend. We were welcomed by the chef and seated immediately. My friend has been here a handful of times and the chef remembered him which I thought was cool.

The restaurant was modern, clean, and had fun music with Japanese TV game shows playing. The entire restaurant was bar seating. They had high seating and lower seating that surrounded the staff. Since I'm Asian I already know the deal. You pick a meat, a broth, and extras. The meats come in different sizes based on ounces. If you let the staff know it is your first time then they'll explain the intended way to eat and show you.

I picked their house special cut of meat in the largest "sumo" size (10 ounces) with the suggest broth of sukiyaki. It was beef. They had four broths to choose from and about 8 - 10 meats. 

Aside from the rice and veggies that came with the order of meat, I ordered a side of udon noodles. It already came with udon noodles so I had a lot of noodles. 

The meat was served with a pasteurized egg which was meant to dip the meat into AFTER cooking it in the meat. The egg did add a creamy taste to the sweet sukiyaki broth. A second egg for $1.50 is recommended if you get a larger portion of meat.

You get a bottle of alkalized water, tongs, and a ladle to help eat. The alkalized water is supposed to re-hydrate the constantly boiling pot of broth in front of you without diluting the flavor.

At first glance it didn't seem like a lot of food, but it was a really good, filling, almost "light" dinner. I ended up taking a container full of food home because of the extra udon I ordered. The sukiyaki broth was flavorful but a bit one-note aka boring. It was mostly sweet and nothing more. With the savory beef and creamy egg it was delicious.

I had one of their fondue for dessert that was delicious. I got the milk chocolate fondue with fruit and pastries. It came with bananas, strawberries, rice crispy treats, cake, and marshmallows. It was the perfect size for two and only $7.99.

They had great hot tea also.

Over all I thought dinner was memorable. I've done hot pot at home, but it was fun in a restaurant. The food quality was good. The meat was fresh as were the vegetables. I thought the staff was great. One of our severs boxed my udon for me. I felt really taken care of. The chef knew exactly how to talk to the diners to make them feel welcome and comfortable. 

We spent just under $80 for the two of us. That was for two full sized meat entrees, two hot teas, an extra pasteurized egg, an extra order of meat, and dessert. I thought it was a a good price for the unique dining experience, food quality, and the service. Keep in mind they do have cheaper cuts of meat if it sounds expensive. I imagine the location adds to the cost.

I'll definitely be back for a treat like a date, a special occasion, or a celebration but not on a regular basis. It was good, but not great. I'll try one of their other broths next time also as the sukiyaki was just okay.

My advice to management is to put the music down. Dinner was so awkward because I kept having to repeat myself and ask my friend to repeat themselves. It made me not want to talk.

My experience here was overall great. I typically go when there isn't a lot of people. They are quick with their service which is great if your are hungry. I went with the large portion of yojie cut meat called samurai. Lots of food barely finished it. However, the next time I went I got the medium portion of yojie cut meat called geisha, still filled me up. So portion sizes are great and you get  the complimentary veggies, udon noodles and rice (brown or white) with your meal. 

I always get the Sukiyaki broth which comes with a pasteurized egg. Haven't tried the others, but maybe I will next time. 

Glad this shabu shabu place is near me on the west side of town. It beats going into the town.
Great food but would be better with beer and sake. No alcohol license!! What's up with that? Pretty disappointing. They should warn people on their site. Other than that food was wonderful!

Im a fat white american and never had Japanese food before and I loved this place!! Great food, great service. In the middle of our meal the owner Jo Koy walked in and is the nicest man alive! They play anime on the tvs which is a great touch, my wife loved it. There are usb outlets under the tables so you can charge your phones while you eat. Super clean great restrooms. Pay this place a visit on your Vegas trip fo sho!
4 stars due to pending liquor license. I was looking forward to my Sake after dinner. BUT, the spicy miso Shabu Shabu hit the spot this fine evening. Note to self Cut the cabbage

Great place, especially if you are a shabu-shabu virgin!  When looking for a meal and you want a "quickie", this is not the place.  Here, you should take your time, really savor and enjoy what you're eating.

The space is very modern.  The seating is at two counters, one high and one low.  Each seat gets their own fondue bowl, which is different from most other places that have one bowl for the table.  The art work on the wall is modern with a Japanese theme and I had fun watching Anime and the original American version of Godzilla on the overhead monitors.

The nice thing is you have never had Japanese fondue "shabu-shabu", the staff explains everything to you.  

When you enter the place, the staff yells at you "irasshaimase!", which is the same "welcome" you usually hear when you enter a sushi restaurant.  The first thing after the staff greats you and seats you is explain the menu pointing out the different meat selections, the different cooking dips, and the different finishing dips.  I was a purist the two times I've been and chose the traditional "shabu-shabu", but they have other dips like sukiyaki and spicy miso.

No need to explain the process here because enough reviewers have explained the process of dipping your meat at this place.

I was surprised at how much I liked the green tea and white chocolate fondue dessert.    I've had chocolate fondue before but I've never had white chocolate/green tea fondue before and it was great!  It is rich and pairs very well with the fruits and crispy rice squares.  

So, if you are a Japanese fondue virgin, come in and let the staff gently lead you to your happy place!

"Yo gee yay" Not "yo jee" like I was previously pronouncing it. 

This is better than the traditional Japanese Shabu Shabu because... Flavor. 
Don't get me wrong, I get that you have to tweak the broth and dips to flavor up the meats and soup, but I like that Yojie offers an upgraded and more intense flavored broth with their Tonkotsu option. Their Tonkotsu broth is richer and has a nice fuller flavor than the other broth options.

Besides the broth, I really enjoyed their signature beef option. It was tender but also added more depth to the broth. The vegetables that come with are plentiful, and service is attentive. If you like spicy, ask for their hot stuff - you only need a dab to turn on the heat. 

I look forward to their expansion and hope they come to the Southwest!

Alright...it kind of pains me to have to write a 3 star review for yojies because I love the Socal locations.  I'm from Orange County and am currently in Vegas for a week so I decided to stop by for lunch.

I didn't want rice or noodles so they gave me a custom veggie bowl with mainly cabbage (or was it lettuce?) and broccoli.  As expected, I didn't receive any rice or noodles but also unfortunately didn't receive any extra broccoli either, just the usual 1-2 in each veggie bowl so I asked for some extra broccoli.

The meal was fine, just that the chicken I ordered was paper thin (what is this...chicken for ants?!). 
-1 star

The server was friendly and chatted with me as I dined all by my lonesome.

The meal was fine and so I asked for the check... Remember that extra broccoli that I asked for? Well, I was charged 3.99 for them!  

It's USUALLY NOT about the money but about the principle. In this case it was BOTH. 

MONEY: $4 for some extra broccoli?  That's just criminal LOL

PRINCIPLE: If the server told me it was $4, I would not have gotten it. 

At the end of the day, it comes down to, "Did I leave with a good feeling after the meal?  Did I enjoy the meal?".  It's either yes, no, or meh.  Honestly, I didn't feel good about the meal I just had.  When that's the case, I really want to give 1/5 stars, but I that's not a fair assessment.

You know that feeling you get when something doesn't feel right and you just have to say something? This was one of them.

I went there with hesitations. What?! Cook my own meat at the table? 

Took my family of 5 there and it was a blast... The staff brought out these pots of broth that were sinfully delicious. High quality thin slices of meat, you dip them in a pot, and boom!!! A flavorful explosion in your mouth. We could not stop eating. I loved it, the kids loved it... Pretty tough to do these days.

Was a little on the pricey side but definitely high quality and well worth it. We ordered the Samurai for my son and I. We had extra ponzu sauce and rice. Ended the meal with the fruit and pastry fondue. Order the green tea white chocolate sauce.

It was good. Very healthy- although a tad on the higher bill side. $27 per person for lunch including tax and we all had water. It's a sushi bar style so it's tough for groups to have a conversation.
The food was pretty straight forward. You pick a meat, broth and your sauce. It comes with veggies, noodles, and rice. I had the Geisha portion of fish -5 oz... I was full since I ate all my veggies and asked to pay the $3 for extra cabbage. It was good. Not something I'd rave about but solid. Not much to complain about. I'd go again but not as often.

I'm a Jo Koy fan, great comedian and part owner of Yojie.  I took my family and friends here for my birthday.  Services was great!  They helped explained ever aspect of Shabu Shabu to us noobs.  The meat was amazing.  I went big and got the Japanese Wagyu which was incredible.  It melted in my mouth like butter.

I highly recommend you try this place no matter what your level of experience is with Japanese food.

BONUS:  They played 'Takeshi's Castle' (or Spike TVs 'most extreme elimination') on the flatscreens as we enjoyed our food.

After getting so disappointed in one of the local hot pot place, I decided to look for alternative, so I decided to give Yojie a try.  I love it, and reasonable priced, great and very attentive service! However, i didn't really appreciate they are telling us we have to sit at certain spot because they anticipate weekend to be busier (there are about 20% empty seat left at that time), after we sat down, all I see is people keeps leaving and had plenty of seat left, if it's a nearly full restaurant, I can understand, but it would be nice if they can think for customer first.  Another star off is the brown rice I have is spoiled, after couple of bite, I start to smell something not right, I smelled it closely and it's in very early stage of spoiling.  Trust me I cooked brown rice all the time and I had several experience of accidentally left it out in my rice cooker overnight during hot summer day and that's exactly the same smell that I'm smelling.  Luckily I didn't get sick, but I can tell because not many people order brown rice, so they just used the old left over rice and didn't realize it had gone bad.  In summary, I will still go back, I love the food and service, but just watch out if you get brown rice, ALWAYS smell it first, if it doesn't smell right, do not eat it and tell them they need to learn how to store the rice properly during summer time
This place is AMAZING. A must-try when you come to Vegas. Soooo yummy, and incredibly friendly staff. 10/5 stars, easy. I loved the Kobé beef. And they have Mochi!

Never had shabu shabu before & this place was the best. I usually go to the Mexican restaurant next door but my aunt & I decided to try something different. Cute little place w/ amazing good. Prices are reasonable, you get a good amount of food. Will come here again !

Got the combo, which is a better deal than the yojies cut cause you get the same thing + a different type of meat. I really recommend the things on the menu that are BOXED. Like it has a box around it, I always the super sweet broth. But last time I tried the tonkotsu & let one of the servers mix some spices & seasonings etc. AMAZING. I just love this place. They play some funny Japanese version of ABC family's "wipeout" although ABC might have copied this Japanese style show. But regardless when it's a full house, the entire restaurant is laughing together & it's contagious. It makes your Friday night a whole lot of fun. The green tea white chocolate is amazing. I always suggest it. It gets a little pricey for the other stuff on the menu so it's good to also share. However they do add a sharing "fee".

Going down a star after going today. Walked in and usually get served right away. Six people walked in after me and my party and everyone after us waited 40 minutes to eat. What happened? We were taking bets that they had to run to the supermarket to get more food or just didn't have any chopping finished. Either way I have never had to wait as long as we did today. I guess it's back to Swish for us. Too bad.

HANDS DOWN one of the COOLEST places here in Las Vegas!  A hidden gem.  My friends and I went here last night for Valentine's Day.  We weren't sure what to expect at all.  They put out the "first timers" block so that the staff could explain everything.  The service was OUTSTANDING!  While we were waiting for some spots to clear up, Anton greeted us personally and asked if he could get us anything to drink while we waited.  He came out with some really nice sparkling sake.  The food was amazing as well!  Once explained, then menu really easy to understand.  We also indulged in the dark chocolate and green tea chocolate fondue for dessert.  Save room for that!  Did I mention they also had a crazy good Pandora playlist going on?!  My group and I were eating it up.  Thanks to Azi (spelling?) and Vhalery, our servers who were so patient and laughed at all our jokes.  You guys are the bomb!  Please visit this place the next chance you get.  You won't regret it!

It was our first time here and we loved it.  If you're looking for something different this is the place to go.  Great food and the service was absolutely superb, they  completely explain the menu and we're very engaging in conversation .
My wife and I go here every so often. Delicious and super close to our house. Love the decor and set up. However, the restaurant is freezing. Definitely bring a jacket!

I'd never had shabu for brunch/lunch before but it was a good time to check out the restaurant, since it wasn't too busy. Yojie had a ton of protein options as well as up to 4 different sizes to choose from. Each person had access to their own pot at the counter, which was nice. We ordered the spicy miso broth and sukiyaki and also got to try their raindrop cake for dessert. The dishes were presented nicely and we even had a small wooden block in front of our settings that said "it's my first time." Overall, we had a positive experience, but don't know how often I would get shabu in the Vegas heat! Should be good during the winter months for sure.

Kids picked the spot for Father's day dinner. .and was a perfect spot! Food was delicious and the experience was top notch.  Nice spot with comforting atmosphere.  Jocoy (one of my favorite comedian) is one of the owners .. very nice guy and even gave us copies of his dvd. This eatery is a must go! Original paintings and photos fit the ambiance of the whole setting.. will be returning .. thank you Carl (our server) and Jocoy and Antwan!!  This place is great!! Best of luck!

Went to Vegas a couple weeks ago so I just had to go pay Yojie a visit. I love Jo Koy so obviously I'd check out his restaurant.  Didn't realize it was so far from the strip, but nevertheless still worth the drive.   This place is in a small outdoor shopping complex with plenty of parking which is always a plus!  The restaurant itself is cozy and modern. The staff was very friendly and patient seeing as it was our first time there. Food was pretty good but I wish the veggies were cut into smaller pieces. Prices were reasonable and comparable to other Shabu-shabu restaurants. It was a great change in scenery to the usual Strip buffets and bars.

I love this place!! Been here twice already, and each time still impresses me. I love the variety of options and also the variety of sauces. I am a big sauce girl, so if you give me a lot of options, I will be a happy camper. 

The yojie cut is amazing and perfect for a meal for two. Or even for just yourself. 

We will
Be back soon.

The ambience was modern and I for one enjoy the counter seating concept as I do not like sharing a pot with others. 

The service was stellar! Our waitress I believe her name was Valerie was prompt, helpful and nice to talk to. Our green tea was always full.

The reason for the minus 2 stars was the lack of miso flavor in the spicy miso and the lack of veggies. I love Shabu-Shabu and have tried many different locations. The broth missed the spot. It was supposed to be spicy miso but both the spice and miso was missing. The veggie choice and quantity was also lacking. Come one 1 broccoli. 2 total pieces of mushrooms, that does not cut it. 

The highlight was the meat. We had the prime rib and it was of good quality.

I will try other Shabu places before deciding if I will be back.

5 stars for delicious shabu shabu, friendly service, and reasonable prices (~$23 per person for the sumo portion). We found this place through word of mouth and celebrated my dad's birthday here. Since then, our family has returned 3-4 more times and service has been consistently good. 

Of the hot pot/shabu shabu places I've tried in Las Vegas, Yojie has the highest quality slices of beef. Order the beef (sumo portion), ponzu and peanut dipping sauces (ask for them to mix the garlic in), and the spicy miso broth. Everyone gets their own shabu pot to cook their veggies and meat in. 

Pro tip: dip a slice of beef in the boiling water for only a few seconds until it changes color then dip it in the sauces. Do not dump the entire plate of meat in. The beef should only take a few seconds to cook to maintain its tender and juicy consistency-- any longer and it becomes tough.

I ordered the combo plate with salmon and the angus beef. Cuts were perfect and enough to share. You can eat the salmon raw as well. The sauce I got with was ponzu and swisher sauce. First time trying the swisher sauce and it was tasty. I got the spicy miso broth and tonkotsu. Both were delicious. Can't forget the fruit and pastries dessert with the green tea white chocolate. Green tea white chocolate was awesome! Servers were great too. Definitely my favorite so far! The music that was playing in the restaurant was great! Designs in the restaurant were clean and cute.
This place is one of the best shabu shabu in summerlin! Great food and excellent service! Look for Mica! Kobe beef and Ribeye are delicious. Will def be back!
Décor was nice. Food was pretty good, but not amazing. Prices a little high.
My favorite shabu shabu spot!!! Even thought this place is a little far from my house, i go here all the time!! The staff is friendly and the food is always delicious!!
Obsessed w/ this place  beautiful place, awesome employees. They'll tell you step by step on how to eat this amazing ass food!

After seeing Jo Koy on the news promoting his new restaurant, I had to check it out.  And as Jo Koy stated in his interview, Yojie Japanese Fondue isn't where you dip sushi into cheese. That's what I first though when I heard the restaurant name, but behold  Japanese Fondue is another name for shabu shabu. 

When I walked into the restaurant, I was surprised that there is only bar seating. That's fine if you're with one or two people, but it's harder to socialize and be seated   with larger groups.

Ordering is simple, pick your meat & size, then the dip you'd like to cook with, and depending on the dip you can also choose other sauces to dip with afterward. Each meat comes with a bowl of veggies and noodles to accompany the meats. The server mentioned their two most popular meat choices were the prime rib & Yojie's cut and the most popular dips are shabu shabu and sukiyaki. I opted for the geisha (medium sized) prime rib, shabu shabu dip with goma and ponzu sauce. 

The food came out quicker than I expected. I took a lot longer figuring out the menu! The geisha size was a little smaller than I imagined. For a medium, I think I got 6 or 7 pieces of prime rib. I think with different cuts of meat you may get more slices. So next time, I'll definitely go a size up. Thankfully I had a bowl of rice and another bowl full of vegetables (cabbage, carrots, mushroom, onions), tofu, seaweed, and 2 different kinds of noodles to fill me up. Despite my poor choice in size, the meat and vegetables were all fresh and tasty even when it was dipped in the shabu shabu (which is just water). The goma and ponzu sauce were a great companion to the meat. I'll be back to try the swisher sauce!  

Our server told me that they were still in their  soft opening, but have had a great turn out so far and that there will be more restaurants opening up soon! I enjoyed the ambiance and the attentive staff. Can't wait to come back and try their dessert! 

Their bathroom is pretty cool too with an interesting waterfall sink!

This is my third try at a Las Vegas Shabu Shabu/ hot pot place and for some reason shabu shabu in Las Vegas tends to be on the pricey-side for what one would expect.

Came here and got the Prime rib in Samurai portion (7oz for $24.99) with the pork (tonkotsu) broth which costs $3 extra. Had the brown rice and asked to replace udon with clear noodle but that wasn't an option. Personally, I believe the meal had too much carbs and was quite scant with the actual protein and vegetables which was disappointing to me. The ponzu dipping sauce, which I generally liked a lot, was lacking in yuzu flavor and sodium soy-sauce heavy.

The meat was fine but the broth leans on the salty side. The green tea was kind of interesting as it had came in a cool contraption which allows the liquid to stream down to the cup when placed over the rim.

If I had anything positive to say about Yojie, it is that service was excellent. The lady who served our meals was really friendly and prompt.

Have been wanting to try Yojie's for about 8 months.  Had a couple hours to kill while visiting Vegas today.  Nice atmosphere and great service.  My husband got the chicken sukiyaki and I got the salmon spicy miso.  He definitely scored the best meal!  I will be getting the sukiyaki next time.  My salmon was delicious but the spicy miso was only so-so and not very spicy.  It was a new experience, worth an occasional visit.  We also had the green tea white chocolate dessert with fruit and pastries which was amazing...might have to go back for just dessert!

Call me slightly Shabu Shabu obsessed. Went three days in a row of their soft opening but who's keeping track. I could make up random reasons why you shouldn't go here and selfishly keep this spot my little secret but what kind of yelper would I be if I told the yelp community to stay away.

I've had my fair share of LA Shabu Shabu, so I was ecstatic when I found out an LA base franchise Shabu Shabu spot was coming to Vegas. FINALLY I don't have to starve in Vegas and travel great distances when I'm craving shabu shabu.

My go-to order:
Kobe Beef or Japanese Wagyu  
Sukiyaki dip (comes with pasteurized egg sauce)
Add on goma sauce and ponzu sauce. 

Meat quality:
When in LA I always opt for the meat with the most marbling with high fat content due to the softness of the beef after being swished in boiling delicious sukiyaki. In LA its aka is "Fatty belly" which is Washimi Wagyu beef toro. I would say its closes to their Kobe beef American gold grade BMS 9-12. If you're feeling baller get the Japanese Wagyu BMS 5 it's like butter. If you're confused all Kobe beef is Wagyu, but not all Wagyu is kobe beef. Which I love how Yojie explains on their menu exactly what you're getting. If you like a little bit tender meat can't go wrong with their prime rib or yojie's cut which is a hand selected angus beef cut by chef Yojié.

Veggies: 
Shabu Shabu comes with a variety of veggies: Bok choy, carrots, broccoli, onions, cabbage, mushroom and noodles. My only complaint about the vegetables but it's really no big deal. Some veggies come out frozen but it melts anyway. So I suggest don't eat them raw. 

Soup base: 
You have your choices of four soup dips. ShabuShabu which is your more traditional shabu shabu flavor, its clean and very light. Spicy miso, it's full of flavor and a crowd favorite. Tonkotsu which I haven't tried will update and my personal favorite sukiyaki, a more sweet soy sauce dip. 

Sauce:
It ain't easy being SAUCY. Actually in this case it is. Depending on your dipping soup. It comes with an assortment of Sauces that compliment your dipping soup. Don't have a panic attack if your favorite sauce isn't included you can always do an add on. I kind of went crazy here. My sukiyaki came with a pasteurized egg sauce that looks a lot like a raw egg. No worries the eggs been pasteurized to reduce food borne-illnesses so dip with no fear! It adds a silky buttery texture to your meat after sukiyaki dipping. My personal favorites are the goma sesame sauce with fine crushed sesame seeds on top and their tangy ponzu sauce. Add Shallots and garlic to taste with Yojié's in house "drop drop drop it likes its hot drop" Caution! Spicy. 

Drinks: 
First time I came here our server suggested to try their popular green tea with sweetener on the side. I didn't find much of a green tea flavor to this. So I'd personally pass on it next time. 

Service: 
Impeccable. I have no complaints. The servers are attentive, helpful, and very knowledgeable of the menu. So if you're a first timer don't panic. They got you covered on the how-to's. 

Tips:
- Ask for Yojié's in-house drop drop drop it like its hot drop to add a kick to your dipping sauces (beware its concentrated, adjust to your spicy tolerance).
- Save your noodles and some veggies to the end. You can opt for your server to make udon noodle soup with your dip base that you can take to go. 
- Ask for the manager Mika she's the best! 
- Ask for Anna or Denise. Excellent service!

I was impressed.   The meat was cut super thin and the Yojie cut was perfect.   As I dipped my raw meat into the broth and then rubbed it in a raw egg mixture, my instinct was to run away and avoid some illness, but the egg gave the meat a wonderful sweet flavor.   We were so stuffed that we had to return another day to try the dessert fondue.  Which we recently did. It was great too.  Loved the bananas with the green tea white chocolate.  The Japanese ice coffee was wonderful too.  This please is great.  Food, atmosphere and service all a big plus.

LOVE THIS PLACE!! My boyfriend and I come here a few times a month. Such a fun experience and the servers are all very friendly and attentive. Every person we have referred to come here has also loved it. The food is fresh, simple and delicious - not to mention inexpensive! Will be continuing to come, of course!

Excellent food and wait staff.  Miso spicy broth was popular in our group.  
Dessert- dark chocolate fondue with fruit! 
We will definitely be back.

Good service and good food! The servers were very open to explaining everything and the place is really clean too. I like how everything is designed and I am very excited to go back! The only thing is that It is a little pricey in my opinion. They definitely overprice things but it is worth it because the food is great.
Omg of my favorite places! Absolutely love the flavors and service! Valerie is amazing!! Very attentive and knowledgeable of the menu. We will be returning regularly!

This place was tasty!  I have been to a shabu shabu where you cook it in water which I am not a fan of ... at Yojie, you get a few options to cook it in a tasty broth.  I tried the one with the posturized egg ... it got a little getting used to because I don't eat raw egg but after it was explained to me ... it took a little getting used to but then it was delicious!  The dessert - fruit and chocolate fondue was delicious as well.  I will be back and will bring friends/parents here too!

I love to eat at Yojie! The workers always welcome you and are very helpful. If you tell them that it is your first time, they have a wooden block that says "first time" and will be placed in front of you. I find that cool because they pay a lot of attention to you along with their other guests. Service here is really good!

Food: Their food is amazing. You can choose different type of broths, meats, and dipping sauces! You also get vegetables with noodles for your broth. I usually get the Yojie's cut with the tonkatsu broth and swisher sauce. 
ALWAYS get dessert. I love their fondue. For dessert, I either get their assorted dessert or strawberries with milk chocolate fondue. Their green tea fondue is also very good :)

I've been here a few times and will definitely come back. I am determined to try everything that is on the menu because I know that it will be amazing!

This place is great. Wonderful atmosphere, great service and phenomenal food. 

Not a ton of seats and they don't do reservations so if you're going at a busy time get there early! I had the combo plate which comes with Yojié's cut (beef) and pork, and spicy miso broth. The meat was fresh and amazing and the broth was great. 

Our server was Ty and he was extremely helpful and kind! 

Highly recommend this place

Great for lunch or quick dinner. Nice portions. Wish the spicy miso had more oomph but I haven't had hot pot in Vegas the way I have had in Cali. Their Arnold palmers use green tea btw.. weirded me out. The service was great though. I don't think I'd go out of my way to get it again though.

I've always enjoyed the concept of going out to eat just to cook my own food. I love hot pot restaurants. I usually go to another place and have been a regular there but I decided to give this place a try. "Something new"

My mom and I get to the restaurant for a late lunch/early dinner. We were the only ones in there. Our server was attentive, checked on us frequently.

Only thing that bothered us was that we could hear what the workers were talking about. I don't need to know nor do I care about your promiscuous sounding night at the club and how the guy you met there wants you to meet up with him later that night at another club. I thought that was kind of irritating. I was a server before too, and when me and my coworkers would talk, we would go to an area called "the back" or aka the "kitchen" and talk, not in front of customers. Very unprofessional.

The food was good. The sauces were good. They have a good iced green tea. They arrange the vegetables in a bowl and make it look pretty. I don't think there's enough vegetables in there. Even when my mom and I got an additional bowl of vegetables for $4.99, I know they put a little more, but I don't think that bowl of vegetables is worth $5 Only thing is I wish they had shrimp. This is the first hot pot place I've been to that hadn't offered shrimp. 

This was a "nice try" restaurant. But I think I'll stick with my usual spot. Service and food were great though :)
I like the Shabu Shabu here, and the beef is really good. The only thing I don't like it's their rice. I think they should use Japanese rice instead.
This place is better than the other Shabu Shabu restaurants in town. Only trouble is they still don't have alcohol. Kind of a bummer not to have a cold beer while eating spicy Shabu Shabu.

Yojié Japanese Fondue is one of my favorite Shabu Shabu spots in Las Vegas! I try to make a trip to Yojié whenever I'm in town! From the restaurant decor and style to the delicious meats and broth choices, everything is wonderful. I always have an enjoyable experience when I come to Yojié!

This place is really good! They have a hot pot for each person and the service is really good too. The only problem was that I was seated 10 minutes after I arrived even though there were a lot of empty seats. Other than that, their sukiyaki is really good! Will definitely come back

I have had shabu shabu at a few restaurants in Vegas and all of them were okay until I ate at Yojie! They are the ABSOLUTELY BEST shabu shabu restaurant in Las Vegas hands down! Their staff is so welcoming and friendly! I've ate at this restaurant so many times that the whole staff knows me! Their food is that good! I personally know Mendrick Leelin who is the co-founder/CEO of the restaurant and Anton Guerrero who is the franchise owner. Both guys are very sweet and so down to earth! The interior design of the restaurant is phenomenal. It is very contemporary and modern! I love that under the seating that there is a place to hang your purse and an outlet to charge your phone. The food here is VERY clean and healthy! I usually always order the Yojie cut beef in sumo size as picture is shown which is the largest size because I'm always extremely hungry every time I come to the restaurant. Every order comes with a bowl of veggies with noodles in case you want to make udon or ramen if you are really hungry. Plus you get to choose your side of rice if you want white rice or brown rice. Make sure to save room for dessert! My fave as shown is the fresh strawberries with green tea white chocolate fondue! I'm not really a big fan of sweets, BUT this is the best dessert on their menu! This is a MUST have!

This was one of the best dining experiences I have had in a long time! We had the yojie's cut and the chicken with two pots, one sukiyaki and one spicy miso. We also had the pastries and fruit dessert. The meats were sliced to perfection, the vegetables and noodles were super fresh, and the broths were out of this world! Every bite was stellar!  

The service here is INCREDIBLE! It's unreal how good the service is.  Michael, Ty, and Kelsey (the manager) were so friendly and attentive.  We felt like we were the only customers in the room.

We will definitely be back! Maybe this weekend! I need more Yojie in my life!

Yojie is simply amazing every time I come here. It's a Japanese hot pot that you cook your meat and veggies in the broth of your choice. You pick the meat you want and the broth. I always get the yojie's cut of meat with sukiyaki. I've tried the miso, which is good as well but I prefer the sukiyaki broth. The meat is  thinly sliced for quick cooking in the broth. 

The sukiyaki comes with a raw egg that you dip your meat into. Sounds kind of weird and maybe gross.. But it's absolutely delicious and a must try. 

The veggies they give you are cabbage slices (which are huge and kinda wish they had it chopped), carrots, tofu, seaweed, udon noodles, mushroom, and clear noodles. You can toss the veggies in little by little as you eat or toss it all in. 

If you're a spicy food fanatic, ask for their hot chili paste. Beware it's super super spicy. Just add little by little to your broth or put some on your plate to dip a little with your meat and veggies. But the chili paste puts that icing on the cake to the meal. 

If you're a first timer also, they give you a little wood block that says first time. So if you don't know what you're doing, they will help you and explain to you the process. 

For dessert, I had the berries and bananas fondue with dark chocolate. It's probably good for 2 people after the meal. But that was delicious as well. It came with strawberries and bananas! 

You can never go wrong with this place!

Order the Shabu Shabu soup, Prime Beef Samurai & Sake was decent dinner and this time I had Brown Rice good for my health I told my server and her response was White Rice is good for your Soul funny right.... just like the Owner. Nice little spot and friendly staff. Must try if your into Shabu Shabu.

My friend and I came in around 8:45 PM on a Thursday night. It wasn't packed at all but there was a good amount of people there. As you come in, there's a little stand where you sign in. We were seated right away. 

We were handed our menus & our server gave us a few mins to figure out what we wanted. Apparently they're coming out with a new menu & the pork belly won't be included, at least that's what we were told. I ordered the samurai korobuta(sp?) meat and spicy miso base with brown rice & the sweet & savory sauce. So I've never had korobuta meat & I must say... it's delicious! When the meat came out, it honestly didn't look like much. I thought I'd be able to finish it without a problem but I ended up giving away like a fourth of my meat to my friend. The spicy miso went well with the meat but I believe the tonkatsu is a better pairing? I'm not sure. But basically, you're able to cook the meat in the soup for 10-15 seconds then you may devour. 

Our server was very nice & came back frequently to check on us to see if we were doing okay. Also, if you're running out of base, all you gotta do is ask!
Yojie is def a shabu shabu place you want to try!  Clean and the food is bomb! Service is excellent! Def my new shabu spot in Las Vegas!

This place has healthy food. They have 4 different sauces to choose from, and the basic one has no flavor at all. I highly recommend this for those who want to eat plain without sugars added. Server was very energetic and kind.

My boyfriend and I went here on our anniversary and our experience was quite lovely. This one of the more higher end hot pot places but the quality is really good. The staff here really accompanies our needs however they only really help you if you ask. Overall good food and good vibes. Get the dessert fondue!!

I decided to change from the normal routine and try Yoli's for real fun lunch experience. The wait staff is very friendly. A clean restaurant well-lit artwork on the walls.  they're unique the food is really very tasty I got the spicy Shabu with Kobe and chicken and a green iced tea their signature drink very distinct flavor I enjoyed my experience and I will come back again.

This place is seriously amazing! My kids and I absolutely love it. My kids who are 9 years old say that it is their most favorite restaurant. They love it not only for the unique dining experience, but also for one of incredible owners Anton and his wonderful staff. Anton, Shannon and Hannah are so awesome!!!!!!
It's always such a blast to have dinner there. Everyone there goes out of their way to make sure that every customer is happy. The food is scrumptious, fresh, healthy and can please just about anyone's palate. We love the Shabu Shabu cooking style and it's so awesome that once you're done with your meat or seafood entrée you have a delicious flavorful soup to enjoy. My girls say that they want to have every birthday dinner there. Every time they have a playdate or sleepover they beg me to take them there and I am always happy to oblige. We all can't wait for our next meal there!!!!!
First time here and we loved it. Everyone was very professional and friendly.  The shabu was delicious. Definitely recommend this place.

Fresh ingredients, clean environment, delicious recipes.

Love to come here with our kids as well.  They have excellent service here and will make any first timers or experienced shabu-ers feel comfortable.

I love this restaurant and the restaurant is conveniently down the street from my house.  I'm almost embarrassed to say how often I go here. 

Their meats come in different sizes (oz) and their broth come in 4 different types & dipping styles.

I usually get the combo plate which is 5oz of the yojie's cut and 5oz of another meat your choice.  Typically I get pork belly or salmon.  I always get sukiyaki with the pasteurized egg and a side of Gina sauce.   If you get sukiyaki don't get thrown off about dipping cooked meat into what looks like a raw egg.. It's a game changer.  It makes the bite more buttery and it doesn't add strong egg flavor to it.

Their iced green tea is light and you can get simple syrup to sweeten it up or you could get it mixed with lemonade for added sweetness.

Everyone that works here is really friendly and we've seen Jo Koy here a couple times which is pretty cool.  This place won't disappoint you!

To say that dining at Yojie was a delightful experience is an understatement. The server, Carl, who assisted my boyfriend and I was exceptional. He was eloquent and very helpful in presenting the Shabu Shabu experience; you should always want a server who who enjoys the cuisine as much as you do. The food was just as tasty as they were described in the menu. After everything was cooked to perfection, a symphony of flavors was occurring in our taste buds. One thing I really appreciate is that the restaurant does not waste food whatsoever. If you happen to have some leftovers, the servers will offer to turn your left over meats and vegetables into a savory soup dish. That is a respectable and genius idea. 
As far as location goes, my significant other and I are very appreciative that Yojie is not located in the Strip. The last thing we need is an over intoxicated tourist slovenly dunking his or her meat in a boiling broth while laughing like a hyena from the Lion King. Can't wait to enjoy another dinner at Yojie!

Oh man. Been wanting to try this place since listening to Jo Joy's Koy Pond, totally worth the wait to get here. Got here on a Monday night and it wasnt crowded at all. Got seated on the high top bar and was immediately taken care of. Service here was on point, drinks and order taken very promptly and our food came out quicker than we could get situated. We both had the sukiyaki dinner, broth was perfect, slightly sweet, slightly salty. I had the veggie platter and it had so much variety.... broccoli, glass noodles, onions, shiitake mushrooms, carrots, Napa cabbage, udon noodles and tofu. Didn't need any meat with that! Meal also comes with a raw egg (or dipping sauce of your choice, i got the swishing sauce), unlimited sauce and rice. We left there so stuffed i was a little bummed bc i wanted to try their dessert fondue so badly! (matcha green tea, dark or white dipping chocolate with fruits). This restaurant is super clean (walked in and can't eventually tell its a cook your own kinda place, can't smell it at all), nice counter tops, awesome vibe, nice artwork, hooks under the table for ladies purse, and USB CHARGING PLUGS!!!! I mean what other restaurants have a charging plug at your table?!?!  You can tell a lot of thought went into this restaurant and it really shows, everything from the menu to the little things like the check/bill holder. Would definately come back here again!
Friendly staff, awesome food, great service.  It's well worth the drive from the strip.

To start off, it's all bar seating so if you're coming in with a big party I would call ahead to make sure there's enough space. It's a diy cooking concept in a hot pot and self seasoning of sauces and broth so if you're lazy, don't come here. I had the spicy miso, yojie cut geisha size, brown rice, and chose goma and an egg as my dipping sauces. I usually get the egg when I have the sukiyaki broth but I decided to try it with the spicy miso since I love dipping into the raw egg. It is on the pricey side for shabu but this is like the only legit shabu place in Vegas so I'm willing to pay more for good shabu. I'm from Cali so I'm used to dinner shabu regular size being $20 or less. Overall, I would recommend this place and would come again. Meat tasted fresh, goma sauce was perfect consistency, they accommodated to my replacements on veggies I didn't like, servers were knowledgable, their green tea infuser is neat to use, and they had an ice cream flavor that tasted like taro! It's a must get.
Love this place. It's so much fun!   We've been going there on a weekly basis and it keeps getting better and better.... And busier too.  Go check it out while you still can.

I was really hungry and I wanted Sukiyaki soup, which was how I found Yojie Japanese Fondue! 

The place is clean! 

I opted for the queen portion of the chicken. Order came with chicken (raw and to be cooked shabu shabu style), rice and veggies with noodles. I inhaled my food in less than 20 minutes!!! Will definitely be back for my Sukiyaki fix!
Excellent food & presentation. Service was superb and both waitresses and owner are very personable. Venue is sleek, clean, and modern.
Such a nice place to have shabu shabu... Everything was tasty and I enjoyed every bite!!! The employees were very polite and helpful. Will definitely be coming back :)

Holy cow this place is amazing. The service was impeccable and the food just as good. Fun environment for the whole fam damly. My younger brother and I had dinner early on a Saturday night while the parental unit had other plans. Him being a teenager who doesn't excited about everything was pretty stoked on the food and the experience. If you can get to show any type of emotion out side of an ok or fine then by heck it's dang good.

This is a really really great place to go to if you are craving something a little bit different! The food is shabu shabu style, where you are given very thin slices of meat, a bowl of noodles and vegetables, and a mini stove with boiling broth, and you cook your meal in the broth. Super interactive and delicious, and you get a choice of broth and choice of meat. I have tried the Yojie's cut, the wagyu cut, the spicy miso broth, and the tonkatsu; all are really tasty! The staff is extremely helpful especially if you've never been to a shabu shabu place before, and they'll even put a cute sign on your station that says, "first time" where they'll walk you through the process step by step. I have also had the dessert which is a green tea fondue with a very cute fruit and cake presentation set up. The area itself is a bit small and the tables are 2 long and extended benches (one higher and one lower) and the price is dependent on the cut of meat you get and whether it's lunch or dinner time; the Yojie's cut for lunch is around $15. Overall, this is a favorite place of mine to go to and I frequently bring friends and family to have a good meal!

So I'm originally from Costa Mesa, CA and lived right across from California Shabu Shabu. So my husband and I ate shabu pretty regularly just out of convenience. So after moving to Vegas, we started craving it. I have to say Yojie is just as good if not better than Cal Shabu. It's so good, that when we're craving it, we freakin drive all the way from Henderson to eat here. Ugh! So lazy and we hate the drive but when we get that craving, we have to have it. This place totally reminds us of home. Their meat and veggies are good and the udon afterwards is the best. Love the servers because they're always attentive. They'll fill your sauce up if needed like I always do. If you want good shabu, please come here. We tried that other place with good reviews that's in Henderson but it's not as good as Yojie. 
By the way, after eating here, we like to go next door to Jollibee and get their peach mango pie for dessert.

This place is a bit on the expensive side but the meat is great quality! The restaurant itself is like a giant bar and you sit around it and have your pot right in front of you. There's a good selection of meats or veggies. Our server was a nice young girl and she explained to us how it worked. We got their house meat and she told us what it came with and about the soup base you can get. We got the spicy miso and it was delicious! The order came with rice, veggies, udon noodles, and the two dipping sauces. You can ask for the hot sauce too but it's super hot! Like a little drop is enough. Anyway, the meat is sliced super thin so it cooks in just a few seconds. It's really great quality meat and tasted really fresh. We got the green tea white chocolate fondue for dessert and it was delicious and fun to eat.
First timer. Anna was exceptional. Fun experience & great meal w/traditional & spicy Miso pot combo. Liquor license pending. Will be back!

Could you open a Yojie in Austin, TX? I'm going to miss you so much! I wasn't sure what to expect for my first shabu shabu experience but I was impressed, and full by the time I left. 

We walked in just a few minutes after Yojie had opened for the day. There were already two parties waiting when we sat down, and another party came in and sat at the high bar as well. The two waiters had a little bit of trouble keeping up with all of the parties, as we all ordered at once, but the atmosphere was fairly casual so it just felt paced. We watched the Japanese TV shows they had playing that were interesting, and enjoyed the space in general. They were more than happy to explain options and describe choices and let us take a little bit of time choosing. Meanwhile, they took our drink orders - a green tea and an Arnold Palmer-san, both of which were really good. 

We ended up choosing the following: 

One Combo plate, (included Kobe beef) with Kurobuta pork and Tonkatsu, (the pork broth), and one Geisha sized Kurobuta pork and Tonkatsu. We asked a bunch of questions about the Tonkatsu, as it wasn't clear on the menu whether it was made with milk or not. It's not - when they say creamy on the menu, it is because it looks creamy and has a creamy texture because of the pork, but no milk is used. They set out our bowls and got our broths going on the induction stoves in their bowls while we waited. The thin sliced meat came out on square plates, and the veggies came out in a slanted bowl - all gorgeously arranged, and with generous portions. The veggies included: a big mushroom, lots of tiny white mushrooms, a lettuce leaf, rice noodles, other wider noodles, a ginger slice, cubes of tofu, carrots, broccoli, and onions. We also received a bowl of rice. By then our broths were ready. Before we started, our waiter came over with tongs and ladles and asked if we had any questions. We started loading our broths with veggies and meats, watching them simmer and stirring. We both decided to let our veggies stew for a while, and we started on our meats. 

This slow process took quite a while... putting in more veggies, letting them simmer, having a little meat, ladling out a little broth for our veggies...stirring the broth. At some point, somehow we had eaten all of the things and we were just down to the broth. The waiter came by and turned off our stoves so that the broth could cool. This was honestly my favorite part, as the thickened broth at the end was amazing. We sat and slowly sipped our broths for a while and finished them, it was so good. We absolutely loved it.

I'd also like to mention their bathrooms - they don't seem like much when you go in there - lots of grey concrete, and they're pretty cold. The sink, however, is a wide waterfall that you turn on that is SO COOL. Check it out!

For what we ordered, we paid about $65 including tip. While it was a bit expensive, it was still really worth it for the experience and the portion sizes. Like I said in the beginning of my review, I'd really love to see Yojie open a location in Austin. When we got back home, we looked for shabu shabu places and there's only ONE here. Food for thought, Yojie! ;) Thank you for being fantastic.

TL;DR: If you don't like Jo Koy's stand up, that's okay because I don't either and I like this place. Lol jk. 

What can I say, this place makes my 'ting ting' happy. And by that I mean my stomach, you sick people you. Came here cause not only did I hear it was good, but also the fact I heard Jo Koy owns this place. When I'm not busy supporting him at thunder valley casino, I thought I should support him by visiting his restaurant. 

Anyways, came in and this place was nicely kept. It was clean and the ambiance was modern. We came in pretty late, so we were seated quickly. 

Food: We got the sukiyaki and the spicy miso broth. For meats we got the standard one (forgot what it's called) and the Kobe beef. With the sukiyaki you get a raw egg to dip the meat in after it's cooked, and don't look at me sideways my g, y'all know you eat dirtier things raw then an egg. I love sunny side up eggs so the raw egg doesn't bother me and it made the food that much better. The sukiyaki broth was good, it was salty and sweet. The only thing is since it's heated for a while the sugar burns and then when it's refilled it gets more concentrated cause they just add more of the same thing and it gets super sweet. Id ask for some water to put in there each time it's refilled. The spicy miso was pretty good, but nothing too out of the ordinary. The sauces that came with it were pretty standard too to what you'd get at other shabu shabu place, but none the less they were good. The meat was delicious and the servings were large and reasonably priced. 

Service: The service was amazing. They were so personable and easy to talk to. If you're reading this Jo Koy the girl with the tattoos that's originally from SoCal did a good ass job with helping us so you better pay her more lol. 

Anyways, I'm def going to come here more often whenever I'm in Vegas. If you're new to shabu shabu this is definitely the place to start.
I went there with my husband , we both love it, the meats are very fresh, we ordered chicken , beef, pork belly with sweet shabu shabu, yummy !

Second time here and I had the worst experience. 5 stars for the food, 3 stars for the price, and 1 for the service. Their service was so amazing when they first opened that they were so pushy but you felt like they gave you their undivided attention.

The only person who was nice to me was the gentleman in the supreme hat. The girls that were the servers ignored me four different times when I had questions or needed something, and asked for the bill! Soooooo rude they would just look at me and walk away. They didn't check if my boiler was too high or low because they were no where to be found. Keep in mind I came literally an hour before they closed and I stayed for only 30 minutes during the process. I think I'm going to go to swish or just go to the Yojie in LA. Terrrrrible service.

Absolutely loved this place.  At first I thought it was all you can eat, but it turns out that it isn't, but that didn't matter.  The food was excellent.  I am a huge shabu shabu fan and have eaten it many times in Japan.  This place really matches the quality of meat that you would get in Japan.  It was very good.  The service was excellent.  I loved the bar like atmosphere and the friendliness of the service.  I will be going to Yojie's again the next time I visit Vegas.

First timer here!! it was well worth it! I sure did get full with the meal that I ordered. Great place to come for a date night or with a couple of friends..Shabu shabu kind of eating experience.. Cook your meat in the hot broth and then dip your meat in the sauce and eat with rice!! -Yummy!! 
Not sure you would want to bring young kids here! place is kinda small and tight..
But over all experience was GREAT!! hopefully next time I wanna come when Jokoy is in town!! :) Coz I love #Joseph!! :)

I was reading through the reviews and people were complaining about the price. It really isn't expensive compared to other Shabu places I've been to. There are plenty that will cost you $50+ to get the same amount of food as their geisha size. Just saying.
I've been a fan of Yojie since I lived in CA - it was also the less expensive of the choices for shabu. I must say this location out does itself. From decorations to menu to even the restrooms. Yes I am loving the restroom. Concrete walls! So modern. Waterfall sink. ooo fancy
Menu definitely is bigger here than the CA locations. The Salmon tho!!! You have to try it. I MEAN IT. TRY THE SALMON!!! It is sashimi grade so you can eat it raw and I sure did eat that thing raw. With or without the sauce. I drool just thinking about it.
For all you cheapskates out there, get the combo plates, you get more meat that way. And if you didn't know rice and sauce come with refills. That's right FREE REFILLS ON RICE AND SAUCES. Or you can take your cheap butt to melting pot and let see you say yojie is expensive after.

I have never had Shabu Shabu, so this was a totally new experience. I didn't know what to expect, so where do I start? First of all, we were greeted as soon as we walked through the door. Once seated, our server explained how the whole process worked. We ordered our food and all I can say is WOW!!! the meat was sooo good, the  veggies fresh and the presentation was A1.  I must say we enjoyed our dinner and have been back several times. My daughter, her boyfriend and 6 other couples enjoyed prom dinner at Yojie's as well...it is definitely on top of our favorite list!

"WTF is Japanese Fondue?" asks my Asian poker bud.

"No clue.  How do you know about this place?" my dumbfounded reply.

"The hot Asian dealer.  Besides fish, beef, pork, chicken; it all taste better dipped in melted cheese!" proclaims my Midwest poker bud.  

Upon arriving...

"Japanese Fondue" = Shabu shabu.  No sashimi dipped in cheese for this carnivore!

This is shabu shabu for beginners.   All meals come complete with veg, rice, and noodles to finish the broth.  Ordering is simple:

1.  Choose the protein, cut, and quantity ranging from 3oz to 10oz.  Beef grades include USDA Choice, USDA Prime, Snake River Farms American Wagyu, A5 Japanese Wagyu.  

2.  Choose broth.  Classic shabu shabu is a simple piece of konbu in water, spicy miso, or tonkotsu broth.  All come with appropriate dipping sauces.  A sukiyaki preparation is also offered.

Note:  every diner must order at least one set or split charges apply.

Cooking simple.  Proteins one slice at a time. Beef follows the two second rule, pork and chicken as daring as you want to be.  Dip and eat ripping hot.  Veg whenever you want.  Noodles to finish.

In the end, the A5 is outstanding.  Flash cooked.  Extremely sweet with a clean finish.  The American wagyu has good marbling and a more pronounced beef flavor.  Both showcase the best in basic shabu shabu konbu broth.  The USDA Prime rib eye is hands down the most flavorful by American standards and works in any broth.

Service is good but then again, there's nothing much required after the raw food has been delivered.  

IMPORTANT:  BYOB!

Straightforward and no complaints of this small Cali chain.

This place is my favorite hotpot in town. *Friendly staff. 
*Clean establishment.
*Good Food and Healthy food. 
*Deserts are amazing.
*Grate for groups and friends. 

This place has a good vibe when you walk in and if you have never tried hotpot before this is a grate place to try for your 1st time. The girls really help you understand there menu and make grate suggestions. 

Hands down best place for hot pot.

Excellent food and excellent service.


If you're looking for a quick stop for super good food, here's your place.

We ordered the combo beef and kurabuto pork. If you haven't had kurabuto pork, you're missing out. I'm a super duper pork fan. And anytime I see kurabuto, I have to get it.

We also had the spicy miso broth and the tonkatso broth. I liked the tonkatso more, but my fiance liked the miso better.

It's also very clean and organized here. I loved that all of the waiters were very knowledgeable, helpful and quick. 

I just wish they had alcohol. A cold asahi would have been perfect. We saw others with alcohol. So I'm assuming you can bring your own with a fee.

Overall, it was awesome. I can't wait to go back and try different meats and broths.

This place is definitely my new addiction. The food is absolutely delicious. Staff is super friendly and helpful. I came here for the first time 2 weeks ago and have already been back again since. I got the Yojie cut with the Spicy Miso which came with your choice of 2 sauces. I picked the Ponzu and Goma. Both sauces went very well with my meat and veggies. For dessert, I highly recommend the white chocolate green tea fondue that comes with fruit and mini pastries. Loved everything about this place! You might just catch me here every week.
We are visiting from out of town and came here on a recommendation. Everything is amazing. The food is very fresh. The staff is very friendly and welcoming.

So good that I had to "try" this place two nights in a row.

The quality of the meats is where it's at. Both times I had the Geisha sized Yojie cut which was the perfect amount of food, although I could probably eat more if famished.

It was an especially hot/humid Vegas night, which made the fully packed restaurant pretty hot. Would be cool to try this place during winter.

I have been to this location several times, and I have hesitated to write a review because the service was so lacking and mediocre. I was impressed with the 3 servers working during my last visit, I think our primary server was Shannon. Each were complimentary and collaborating to make the dining experience for all of the customers fantastic. The overall experience was greater than 5 stars.

The food has always been fresh and the dessert platter - although needing more chocolate sauce - was fantastic. 

I hope that they continue on this path of collaborative service!

Came in with a group of 4 all first timers.  Signed in and saw many empty seats so the ladies proceeded to sit down.  A rude employee came over and started telling us that it's not appropriate to seat ourselves.  This place has no host,  is quite small,  and no waiting area.  I saw the sign-in book and signed us in but the others may naturally walked to all the open seats.  The place only had a few people. 

It was all very odd and made everyone quite uncomfortable to be lectured life that after just walking in to a new restaurant. . We just turned and left.  

Just because you have good reviews doesn't give you the right to belittle your potential customers.
I recommend their sukiyaki and comes along with a variety of veggies, noodles and meats.

Excellent food and attentive service the entire time. Unfortunately they don't have their liquor license but I believe you may be able to bring in your own drinks, you should call and find out first. Everything was wonderful but I felt like it could've been a little cleaner. Don't get me wrong it was NOT dirty in anyway, and the food was beautiful, clean, and EXCELLENTLY, but I just felt like the air was a little off. There were no smells and I will go back every time I'm in town. In fact I was in Vegas for only one night, and took a Lyft from the strip just to eat here. It was absolutely worth it and I will be back.
Thanks Joy

We been already in similar restaurant like that in Boston, which was great!!! This one is just a food , if you never eat nothing more sweet then carrots, you may think you eat the sweetest things ever. We choose deferent broth, spicy is ok, but second it too sweet and terrible, all sauces is very plain, they taste just like poor of bottle and best brand , not like something made in house and great. Chose of vegetables that coming with main dish just ok , mostly chimes cabbage...over all very disappointment experience it all. Overprice !!! Specially for quality food.

Great food and flavor!!! The service is the worst,  can't get a water glass refilled or tongs to cook with because nobody did the dishes. Tables and menus are dirty,  It's a shame I liked this place (atmosphere and food). 



We gave it another chance last night and I am happy to say the service is 100x better.  Thank you for your improvement!!!   The owner even stop by and introduce himself then ask if everything was good.   Nicely done

If you like shabu shabu, this place is a must try. Yojie offers fresh high quality meat that you don't normally find. The place has a low amount of seating so if it's busy, it can take a while. My experience was great. Servers were friendly and didn't hesitate to teach you what to do. If you haven't experienced eating shabu shabu you should definitely try it here for your first time.

Been a fan ever since I first discovered them in LA.

For me, it's a very clean shabu shabu and is the closet one that I've been able to find to my absolute favorite in So Cal, California Shabu Shabu.  

My only critique is that they have not started their Swisher Society program and they always #-ing their Instagram posts with #SwisherSociety when they don't have it up and running yet.  Every time I inquire about it, I'm told they are aiming to get the system up by the end of the month.  I've been going about twice a month since their soft opening in late May.  Also, they do not have their liquor license yet.  I am not a huge drinker but I would think a business that has been open for that long would have been able to finalize their liquor license closer to it's opening date.

I gave them 4 of 5 starts for these two issue and would gladly give them 5 once those issues are resolved.

Update 10/28: Still waiting for Swisher Society to be accepted here and still waiting for the liquor license... not sure if they're even going to bother with either anymore....

I've heard about this place and finally decided to head over here for a date night with my boyfriend. Its a very modern style and I love the wrap around counter. The servers are very accommodating to First timers! I was a little apprehensive as this was my first time experiencing shabu shabu dining. My boyfriend and I had the beef wagyu and the pork with the sweet broth... It was amazing!!! For dessert we had the chocolate and strawberries. Also when you are finished with the meat and rice you can pour the broth into a bowl with the noodles and left over veggies! My overall experience was great! I would definitely come back again!

Anton and his crew always go above and beyond...customer service is excellent. Food  always hits the spot! I've had the yojie cut and pork belly...can't wait to try the others. The green tea fondue is heaven. I've been there three times and looking forward to the next one real soon.

Epic #AfterSEMA Day 2 Dinner at @jokoy's @yojielv Japanese Fondue. It was a cold and rainy evening and we decided to get shabu shabu for dinner. I've always want to try Yojie out as it recently opened. Just our luck, we were greeted by the man himself Jokoy!!! It was a rare occasion for him to be in town mid week but he was waiting for his good friend to come in to dinner. 10 mins later a black Escalade rolls up and dude with a baseball cap walks in. He looks up and it none other than @adamcarolla! He came into town for an appearance at the @semashow. His BRE Datsun 510 was also on display at the Tokico booth inside Central Hall.

Back to the food...Yojié is easily one of the top shabu shabu spots i've ever been to. Not because it's owned by A celeb, it's really good. The ambiance, the quality of the food and the overall experience is fantastic. If you're ever in Vegas and have time to venture away from the strip, you must come here! Pictured: Yojié's Cut: Samurai Shabu Shabu with Goma & Ponzu sauces.Thank you @jokoy and staff for the exceptional hospitality. I was bummed no orange chicken on the menu...haha j/k!

First time at Yojie & we were very impressed. Service was quick & food was delicious! We've only been to 2 other hot pot places & this was definitely our favorite! The servers were kind, informative & assisted us with preparing our meals. (Other places we've gone to expected us to know what we were doing which lead our sauce to completely burn). They were refilling our drinks & checking up on us to make sure everything was ok. We had the pork belly, chicken, & Yojie special. Everything had so much flavor. We also ordered the cherry blossom tea & Arnold Palmer made with green tea. For dessert we had the platter with fruits & an assortment of cakes with green tea chocolate. Amazeballs. We'll definitely be back! It was worth the 30 minute drive across town.

My brother had told me about this place and I would see pictures of friends eating at Yojie in Socal. When my brother and I were finally in Vegas at the same time, he insisted I just HAD to go try it out.

Fan of Jokoy? EVEN BETTER! I believe he is one of the owners or partners of Yojie for this location, so if you support him, YOU BETTER DINE HERE!

On the menu, they have a box around the common/popular items, which are the yojie's cut for the plate and sukiyaki for the broth. As a first timer, that is exactly what I ordered in their large size.

All plates come with a bowl of vegetables (lettuce, carrots, shiitake mushrooms, etc.), noodles (which I believe were udon), and your choice of brown or white rice.

If you have a big appetite, I would recommend getting the samurai (large) or the sumo (x-large) because the meat slices are thin, which also makes it easier and faster to cook in your bowl/pot. 

The sukiyaki broth is sweet and oh so wonderful. It comes with a fresh PASTEURIZED egg, which you use as a dip for your meat. So before you judge people dipping their meats into what looks like a raw egg, just remember it is pasteurized and tastes amazing!!! I almost don't even want to describe the whole thing and give it away because I feel like people should just come here and try it for themselves lol.

Service is excellent!! I wish I could remember the name of the manager or owner/the super cool zen dude who runs the place, but he's full of good vibes and is extra generous. He interacts with all customers and helps out his employees.

I can't wait to come back here again!

I am a big fan of Jokoy and when my cousin told me about his spot in Vegas we were all over it!  Unfortunately, we went the night before Memorial Day, 30 min to close and it was a 45 min wait.  They had a DJ out front but we decided to go somewhere else.

...bummer.

Lucky for me, I went the next day for lunch and it was great!  No wait, a little cheaper for lunch and the waitress, Ozzy, was tons helpful!  

Needless to say the food was great!  Love the local artist work on the walls too!  The only thing missing was a visit from Mr. Ting Ting himslef

Good shabu shabu restaurant as far as this side of of the valley is concerned. You get different choices of meats/fish as well as broths with sauce selections that you can cook with. Another plus for being open during lunch with lower prices. Green tea chocolate fondue desert was great too.

Service and decor are nice. Although, I went during lunch when it was slow and they didn't get their liquor license yet, but hopefully it picks up.
My favorite shabu shabu in town. Veggie plate with spicy miso is the ultimate meal every time. Great environment casual setting and very affordable. Great dinner idea for vegetarians or vegans alike.

Man have I been waiting for this. I moved from California over a year ago and have yet to find a good place to eat Shabu. Me and my girlfriend ended up buying a shabu pot to eat it at home because the restaurants just couldn't cut it. You can imagine how excited we were when we found out that Yojie ( which has a few locations in California ) had come to town. 
I'm so happy they brought their quality and service to Vegas. They have very high quality meats, in different grades all the way up to wagyu. Some people complain about the price and portions because they are used to all you can eat shabus in the area or shabus that give you a lot of low quality meat. Yojie has prices comparable to any other good shabu places in California and I would happily pay more for the quality and experience they offer. They even offer sushi grade salmon that you can just dip in sauce and eat raw if you chose to. 
And their service. The definition of top notch. Everyone is attentive and friendly and make sure everything is provided before you ask, or promptly when you do. The service alone is worth 5 stars. 
While they have a large selection of meats and sauce options, NO MATTER what you do get the green tea fondue for dessert. It is heaven on a tiny fork. We got the fruit and pastries so I highly recommend that. We were so that full we couldn't walk but we still stuffed our faces with delicious green tea chocolate dipped sweets. It was AMAZING. 
Needless to say, we are fans and will be back many, many times.

This place was absolutely amazing , I took a group of friends here late May and the experience was superb , the service was top notch and the food was mouth wateringly amazing. If you are firmiliar with Shabu Shabu or Hot Pot type establishments you owe it to yourself to try Yojié out it is everything you love about Shabu Shabu but with its own signature flavor. They have an assortment of meats as broths you can choose from depending on your preference. The broths are made in house , the meats are high quality and the veggies are as fresh as they come this is definitely the top of my Off the Strip Vegas food spots !

Definitely not your ordinary shabu-shabu, but completely worth what you pay for!

Immediately walking in through their front doors, I feel so welcomed with their greetings and the sweet smell of sukiyaki soup. Mmmmmm. Ana seems to often be our server, and it's awesome to be remembered! The service is great, never fail to refill our bowls and alkaline water glasses!  

But the food......it is simply to die for (well, maybe to come back for seconds)!! The beef is so tender and even with just the "geisha" size I'm full to my toes! The quality is terrific, as well as the cleanliness (despite even the inevitable spills on the counter). Definitely will be back again and again.

Been wanting to try this place for a while and finally made some time to come here for dinner with a friend. We were greeted as soon as we entered and immediately got seated. 

You have a choice between sitting at the low bar and the high bar and we decided to go with the low bar. Beware, the chairs make a loud screeching sound if dragged on the floor. There's also a few televisions to watch while eating. 

The decor is simple yet very unique. There are various pieces of art on the north wall done on usps boxes. 

I decided to get the yojie cut, shabu shabu pot with ponzu and swisher dipping sauces, and brown rice. This also comes with a little bowl of vegetables and noodles, which was pretty much 2 slices of carrot, some onion, udon noodles, thin glass noodles, one piece of broccoli, one large mushroom cap, two cubes of tofu, and some lettuce. I would've preferred some more veggies and meat. 

For drinks, I got the tiramisu blend hot tea. It has a very unique savory taste to it, which I enjoyed. The refill came in this contraption where you place on top of your cup and it'll pour out of the bottom. 

Service was great, the server explained everything clearly, mixed garlic and green onion into our dipping sauces, and we were often checked on to see if everything was ok.
This place is cute and the food always satisfies.  I like the interactive experience.  Kind of like Korean bbq without all the oil.  A much healthier alternative.
Had a fab time! Great service and light meal yet really satisfying! I look forward to going again.

Quality cuts of meat with old school jams playing in the background!  I always get the combo that comes with the Yojie cut (angus beef) and one other choice of meat (usually pork) and I always leave stuffed.  Every combo comes with a bowl of noodles/veggies for the hot pot as well.  The one thing, I don't really like is the extra up charge for the broths.  The one that doesn't come with a charge seems like just hot water...so I've never even tried it.  Our favorites are the sukiyaki with the pasteurized egg.
