Pull the meat out of the pot, dip in the egg, and pair it with a little rice...perfect bite!  Rice refills are free here for the rice lovers out there!  The spicy miso broth is a second favorite.  FYI, you can do split pots and have spicy miso and sukiyaki, best of both worlds!  Our favorite drink here is the bottomless green tea arnold palmer.   One of the only cons, not the best place for a large group, since it's counter seating in a circle.
Finally got a chance to stop for some shabu shabu! Thanks husband!  super excited that the kids enjoyed it too! We will be back for sure

If you're ever in the mood to take your time and cook your own food at a restaurant, this place is definitely a great option. I don't have Japanese fondue often, but when I want some shabu shabu I always come here. I love the interior of this place, very modern, simple and clean. While you're enjoying your meal sitting at either the high top bar or the standard tables across, the TVs overhead are usually showing either Japanese game shows or anime, which has always made my dinner experience better. Their service is great. The staff always makes sure any new-timers know the how-to's of shabu shabu. The price is a bit high for a meal but the experience is worth it. Would definitely come back anytime.

While the food and service were pretty good, my biggest issue was with the bar/counter setup.  All the great shabu shabu meals I've ever had consist of a group of 4+ sitting around one big pot while chatting, swishing, and drinking away.  Here?  If I want to kanpai it up (they say liquor is coming soon) with the fourth person in the party, I have to get up out of my seat, walk 3 chairs down to clink glasses and shoot.  Then stand awkwardly making small talk for 20 seconds before walking back.  That's pretty lame.  

It may just be a cultural thing.  Three American dudes probably don't want to share a pot, thus this singular experience.  It's easy to see the powers that be put a lot of time and effort into making Yojie look and run as well as it does, but I'd rather order matzo ball soup and a pastrami sandwich in this setting.

Also:

- The atypical tonkotsu broth goes best with pork or maaaybe chicken.  Beef doesn't work.  
- Cherry blossom tea was terrific.
- Trust me and at least get the samurai size.  My wife crushed this serving and was ready for more.  
- Since shabu shabu is generally a winter meal, they definitely make the room cold enough to feel that way.  Bring a jacket.  

They have plans to open up more locations in Vegas, so count on me as a regular at one of the others that are group friendly.

Great experience and terrific service. Nice spin on traditional shabu shabu. My wife enjoyed the miso broth and I was a huge fan of the sukiyaki. But the later has to be someone that enjoys raw egg wash. The noodles and broths are very fresh. The restaurant didn't serve alcohol when we were there but my understanding was that the alcohol license was imminent. The variety dessert plate was great and we enjoyed every piece.

My first time here and i thought it would be just the normal shabu place. I was so wrong. The food was awesome and the servers was excellent. They explained everything to you. Also had the pleasure of eating besides the owner. He was awesome. Keep a look out for this place. More awesome things about to come.

This place is amazing! I was super impressed and would definitely go again. I've never been to shabu shabu before but it was so much fun to cook the food and eat it and the vibe is just amazing. The people there were super friendly and explained everything to make it easy to understand. I got the combo plate with meat and chicken which was really decently priced and got the spicy miso broth which was amazing. You can finish off with some udon too! The artwork in the place was really nice too! I would definitely recommend to anyone who likes shabu shabu! So yummy!
Pretty good spot to eat hot pot. Totally worth it to come during lunch hours. Meat are sliced freshly by the order. The staff is friendly and does a great job of explaining how to eat shabu shabu

Yojié is a Japanese fondue restaurant owned by the comedian, Jokoy. I have been there a few times, and it's been a good experience every time. It's simple and satisfying. You have 3 options of broth and about 5 meat options. Every order comes with a bowl of vegetables and noodles. Every time I go, I get the combination for $20 and order pork belly and steak as my meat.

The restaurant is a small area with one u-shaped table to seat probably 30 people. I'm not sure if this is possible, but it would be fun to reserve the place and have a Japanese fondue party. The interior is super cute and clean. It's a perfect place to go with family, friends, or on a date!

I'm a huge fan of Jo Koy so I was excited to try this place out. Apparently he tends to pop in and out so maybe you can get lucky and catch him in here. 

The set up in here is great and everything looks clean and well organized. Take some time to admire the awesome pics along the wall. 

The menu is nice and simple which is typically a good sign for any place. You basically pick your type and quantity of meat and then the broth you'll be dipping in. I chose the Yojie Cut beef and the spicy miso broth. The meat is accompanied by a bunch of veggies and noodles as well as a bowl of rice. The spicy miso itself is a great soup and just the right amount of spiciness. As for the beef, its thinly sliced high quality meat that cooks in mere seconds when dropped into the delicious broth. Everything goes great together for a great light yet filling meal. I recommend the ponzu and swisher sauce. 

The specialized tea infusers are pretty neat, and the tea is high quality. For dessert, don't miss out on the Ube (Taro) ice cream! I'll definitely be back to try the rest of the menu. 

P.S. For a bit of a bargain, I'd recommend coming here during lunchtime, its a little cheaper for the same amount of meat.

OMG! You HAVE to try this Japanese fondue and Shabu Shabu spot if you're in Vegas! I know there are plenty of great places to eat who have the best this, or the best that, but seriously, Yojié's ROCKS like no other!

The food is very fresh, healthy, reasonable, DELICIOUS, and "original"! The best part about Yojié's is that the service here is absolutely top notch! The staff all love it here! Ever run into a barber or hairdresser who LOVES what they do? Well, it's the same vibe at Yojié's...

We split the Samuri sized (7 ops) Kobé Beef w/ a pot of their Spicy Miso & Tonkotsu broths, 2 sides of sauces (Goma & Ponzu), w/ brown rice. They didn't have their beer/wine license yet so we ordered their delicious Signature Green Tea... Everything was absolutely amazing!!!

We'll definitely go for it all next time and try their Japanese Wagyu Beef and get the staff to ring the gong! We ended our dinner w/ a scoop of thier Ubé ice cream since we were kind of full. They offer a pretty tasty fruit & pastry chocolate fondue which we'll try and leave more space for the next time we visit!

We were fortunate to try Yojié's while JoKoy happened to be in town so that was extra special that he was there to hangout w/ his dining patrons. Both Anton & JoKoy were really hospitable and genuine guys! I guarantee if you check this place out, you will instantly be a fan of this spot! We can't wait to come back the next time!

My favorite place to go for Shabu Shabu . I started coming here about 2 months ago. After I ate there for the first time , I actually went everyday for 12 consistent days ! I was hooked. I love the simplicity and cleanliness, quality of food and the awesome service every time . All the guys and gals that serve here are very nice and do a great job at anticipating your needs in advance.  I switch between all of the menu items and I have loved every item. The setup makes it easy to go in for a quick lunch or dinner .

What a cool urban modern place to eat. Jo Koy is the co-owner of this place and my favorite comedian. He served us our dessert and started eating it which was pretty hilarious and I let him. But overall rating for this place is 9 out of 10. Just a little pricey but definitely a go to place.

Fabulous experience.  I had the combo plate with Pork in the Tonkotsu broth with Goma and Ponzu sauces on the sides.  The Yojie Angus is good but the pork was my favorite.  the side of veggies and noodles were a perfect portion.  The green tea fondue for dessert was delicious.  There staff is attentive and knowledgeable.  Anytime I'm in Vegas, I will want to come here to eat.

I have always wanted to try Shabu, Shabu (Swish, Swish) from Japan. What is Shabu,Shabu you ask?? According to their website, it is "The Art of Dipping" We arrived around 7:00pm on a Saturday evening. The restaurant is in a "U" shape with a choice of sitting on a high top or a low counter level. We opted for the high top. Glad we arrived when we did because in fifteen minutes, every seat was taken in the restaurant. This was reassuring since we had never been here before. They have comfortable bar stools to sit on and the restaurant is very clean. In front of each seat, there is a burner along with plenty of counter space to hold all of your food. First you have to choose your plate, they offer three types of beef including Kobe, Angus and Japanese Wagyu. There is also prime rib, chicken, pork, pork belly, salmon and a veggie medley. Next you choose your dip or broth. Your choices are shabu shabu (water based and the healthiest), Sukiyaki with a pasteurized egg for additional dipping, spicy miso, and a pork tonkotsu. Each entree comes with a bowl of vegetables, noodles, and your choice of white or brown rice. I chose the chicken with the Sukiyaki and egg and my husband had the Japanese Wagyu beef with the tonkotsu sauce. Right after we placed the order, our server came out with a Japanese gong and asked me to "Bang A Gong" since we had ordered the Wagyu beef. When the check came, I knew why...This was pretty fun and when I did bang the gong, the whole kitchen cheered and again when the check came, I knew why. Wagyu beef is pricey! The servers are really friendly and they thoroughly explained the whole process from cooking the meat and vegetables to how to enjoy the meal. We were definitely in "virgin territory" but we both jumped into this new experience. The food comes out all at once with your big bowl of veggies and noodles, the broth and the meat. We were advised to shabu, shabu our meat anywhere from 15-20 seconds. I went about 25 seconds just to make sure that it was cooked. WOW! The flavors that came from the combo of the sauce and then dipping the meat in the egg was incredible. I could not believe all the flavor the little egg provided! Our server told me for a first time customer, I was brave in my choice of broth in terms of taste. I would choose that same sauce and egg again. I really enjoyed the rich taste of the combo. The vegetables included cabbage, mushrooms, carrots, watercress and then there were some noodles. You can make the decision whether or not you wish to enjoy your veggies crunchy or you can cook them too. My husband shared his Wagyu beef with me which had a sweet and delicate flavor well marbled and delicious rare.  My chicken was really tasty and fresh.  We had plans with some friends so we were unable to try out the dessert which is a great reason to return. When we left, we did not feel bloated or full like you do after a big meal. We both felt really energized and healthy. If you are in the neighborhood, be sure to shuffle, shuffle on over and enjoy some Shabu, Shabu!

Omg I'm impressed. The wagyu was $14 an ounce and definitely worth it. It melts in your mouth and the sukiyaki broth with the raw egg was amazing. Vegetables were nice and crisp before letting them cook in the broth. Also it comes with rice, glass noodles, and udon. Definitely one of my new favorite spots.

The perfect meal on a cold winter night is Yojié Japanese Fondue!  Nestled in the Village Square shopping center, I was excited to try their shabu shabu and it did not disappoint.  The interior is nicely decorated and the tabletop electric stoves complement the decor rather than other similar restaurants that have gas stoves.  I decided to try the shabu shabu with Yojié select beef slices in a large portion.  The meat quality was very good and cooked quickly in the seaweed broth.  I requested the ponzu and sesame sauces for dipping and these were both delicious.  Presentation of the side veggies was excellent and they looked very fresh.  I was also surprised with the choice of white or brown rice which other places don't give.  Overall, Yojié is an excellent restaurant for shabu shabu and I'm excited to try the sukiyaki next time!

This place is pretty great. The food quality and service offered here was pretty good, they also offer a pretty large variety on protein. However, I was a little sad that they didn't offer lamb. Out of all the shabu places I been to, this is the only one where they offer the (raw) pasteurized egg as a dipping sauce. I personally didn't order the sauce but I was able to try it from my friend and it was pretty delicious. I constantly saw the waitresses checking up on customers and even helping them out in terms of cooking their food. I personally didn't get that much attention, but I'm indifferent about that because I shabu a lot and I just do my own thing. Just a minor complaint (and I'm sure it was pure accident) was that they turned off my stove before I was even done cooking/eating. Overall I really enjoyed this place and would definitely come back!
Great Japanese Shabu Shabu place, my family loved going to this place. Ordered Yojies Cut Sumo style, lots of veggies and meat, and has great sauces on the sides

5/5 food
5/5 service

Yojie serves some of the freshest cuts of meat I have ever had. I had the angus and the salmon, and the salmon was so fresh it could be eaten raw! The ponzu sauce was good with EVERYTHING.

Service was good too, it was my first time here and the server was very helpful in every part of the whole visit! Don't be afraid to ask for questions if it's your first time!

Overall, I really like this place, it has a modern and calm ambiance. Will be coming back!

We kept hearing about Yojie Shabu Shabu on the Koy Pond (Jo Koy) podcast as well as the Adam Carolla podcast (both great podcasts), and we decided the next time we were in Las Vegas we would give it a try. The restaurant is not on the strip but it is close enough by car. We went around 1pm to make sure we would miss the lunch crowd but be aware they close at 230pm Monday thru Thursday and reopen for dinner at 5pm. We were seated right away and our server Mareianne took great care of since it was our first time. Each member in our party had their own "cooking" station. The variety of options was perfect. They have beef which includes the Yojie special, Kobe and even wagyu beef. They also have salmon and a veggie option. The salmon is so fresh it can be eaten sashimi style or lightly cooked. Everyone gets a choice of broth for cooking.  And the portion of veggies, noodles and protein is perfect. 

I highly recommend Yojie. The beef was tender and the salmon was fresh. We were totally full but had to have the dark chocolate fondue for dessert. Which was a very good decision. It was the perfect ending to a perfect meal. Mr. Koy, you have a great restaurant in Las Vegas and whenever we are in Las Vegas you can bet we will go back to Yojie!!!

I've been here a couple times.  it is a pretty typical japanese shabu shabu place.  the meats seem to be decent quality and the pricing is ok.  i would say the sukiyaki is the best of the three i've tried, but im really not a fan of the upcharge for the better soups.  come here during lunch- you get the same thing for cheaper.

We are from LA so we have gone to many good shabu shabu places in the past. This place had great reviews so we thought that we would give it a try. You get tired of eating at the hotel restaurants on the strip. The price was good for the amount of food that you get. We each ordered the lunch samurai size (one beef and one chicken) and it was the perfect amount. The sukiyaki broth is sweeter than I expected but still very good with the egg dip. Each set came with a bowl of veggies and noodles but we ordered an extra bowl to share. The nice part is that you don't leave smelling like food!  There is plenty of parking but we were also there around 2:00 pm.

First time here and the vibe is great! Best music selection ever!!! Food was good and options are plenty! The service is the main reason I couldn't give 5 stars. 

We went on a Monday night and were sat immediately. 3 in our party and my daughter and I chose to share the XL portion. The wait time for the food was average. The issue was the waitress kept forgetting things and getting her attention took forever. I asked 3 times for a fork for my daughter because they never brought out ladles or tongs. Getting refills on tea and rice were also difficult and the temperature on the burner needed to be adjusted but again, no waitress to ask to help.  I will say the clean up between dinner and dessert was prompt and so was paying the check when we left.

I give 3 stars for the food and 1 for the super cool teapot and the atmosphere.  The food and ambiance was worth the slow/poor service and I will give them another chance. I hope they step it up in the service area though...

Decided to update my review after my recent visit, and also after reading some of the other reviews. 

First up....they finally got their LIQUOR LICENSE!!! Woohoo...now you can enjoy a frosty beer or a nice sake with your meal. I guess they got it about 8 months ago.

I went with my friend on a Tuesday night around 7:30 pm. We were promptly greeted and told it would be a minute or two until seated, which was accurate. We were seated next to a group of newbies. My friend had never been to shabu shabu, so I placed our orders. The waiter took his time to describe the meal and help the group next to us cook, which helped my friend. Excellent service!

Unfortunately they had just run out of Kurobota pork which I was planning on getting, so I just went with the Yojie cut. I did not notice any reduction in the quality of the meat. Normally I always get the combo, but I wasn't super hungry and just went with the smaller portion which was just the right amount. My friend loved her food, and finished it all and proclaimed she was stuffed!! So no dessert, which the group next to us did order and the fruit with chocolate fondue looked so gooooooooood I wanted some.

I've eaten here at least 8 times since they've opened, and it is one of my favorite places in Las Vegas to eat, and easily the best Shabu-Shabu place. I've never had bad service, and the food has always been great.
This an awesome place. The employees here are all very nice and attentative. They also explain how the whole process works if your a newbie. Will definitely be back!

Shabu shabu was good! I got the spicy miso broth which was the perfect flavor - not too spicy. Unlimited rice and broth but veggies were not unlimited. The combo came with a good amount of meat. We went on a weekday for dinner and there was no wait, parking was easy to find. Great service and the waitress even came out to take our picture with no complaints. Definitely coming here again!

wasn't too excited to try this place but was pleased with my experience. My dad and grandma were first timers shabu shabu and the staff kindly explained the menu along with a demo once the food arrived. 

SHABU SHABU is japanese hot pot where thinly sliced proteins are dipped into a boiling pot of broth. 
Their choices of broth included spicy miso, sukiyaki, tonkatsu or traditional shabu shabu.

The dipping sauces were on point: goma( sesame base), ponzu ( citrus soy), and swisher ( like teriyaki), each mixed with green onions, chili powder, and daikon. 
Their brown rice is good and also refillable, along with the hot pot of broth. 

I would definitely come back and maybe try their sukiyaki broth which is served with a raw egg on the side to dip the meat in.

Completely in love!!! I'm a complete Shabu Shabu fiend. I've been trying to find places that would compare to San Francisco and honestly, it's been a struggle. I've heard so many great things about this place from my peers and this place seriously did not disappoint me one bit. 

The service was impeccable. The chef and the server really pay attention to your broth from being low and they actually do a little Shabu Shabu 101 with you if you've never had something like it before. Never had to ask for water and the servers actually talk to you and are super friendly and helpful. 

Since I've never been to this location, our lady server talked about the menu in detail. You have choices of four different broth types. The Shabu Shabu broth, sukiyaki, spicy miso, and tonkotsu. The meats vary in price and size. She recommended to me the combination choices of meat where you could choose pork belly, pork, chicken, and salmon. It also comes along side with yojies angus meat. 

My order?
I ended up choosing the spicy miso along side my two dipping sauces of ponzu and peanut sauce base. The spicy miso was super flavorful. Went so well with the veggies, meat, and udon noodles that came with it. I went with her recommendation and ordered the combo meat. Need I tell you, it was super filling! At the very end of my meal, we ordered the fruits and pastries fondue. The fondue base was a green tea white chocolate. I seriously never had something like that before. I was so happy inside! What I recommend? Cut the pastry in half and the fruits to dip in the fondue together. It creates a balance. It's so gooooood!

I was completely impressed at the service, the design of the restaurant, and most importantly the food. Will definitely come back here again. I completely love it and will be the best Shabu spot here in Vegas for me :).

Great food and excellent service!!! It was our first time and everything was explained to us with detail. The actual food was TO DIE FOR. First time ever trying it, and now it's all I want! The ramen broth was the best in my opinion. The vanilla ice cream isn't even ice cream. It's a little cloud of amazingness. Can't wait to go again when I'm in Vegas.

I visited this place about 4 months ago and am just now getting to my review. I originally had a lot more to say but I have softened my tone overtime. 

Service: Was great, I enjoyed speaking to the servers and I think the owner. They explained the process and options very well. They kept our drinks filled and were friendly.

Food: The food is good to a point. About 1/2 way through the meal everything just starts to taste bland and one note. The food doesn't sit in the broth's enough to add too much flavor and what little flavors is added all taste the same. 

Décor: It's fine, they tried hard to make this a fresh experience but I feel like I've been in similar places many times. It reminds me of the Goth kids when I was in High School, they all hated to conform and wanted to be different but in the end they all looked the same as each other. Every "hip" restaurant these days are the same to me: Pop art, stone and concrete, and blasting some form of electronic music. 

Experience: We planned on going with another couple but the cancelled at the last minute. This was a blessing because the bar seating and extremely loud music would have made it difficult to have a conversation with all four at the same time.

Go if:
You've never had hot pot
You really enjoy hot pot and live near Summerlin
If you want to try something new and the experience is more important than flavor
 
Avoid if:
You have a large group
You're not a Hipster Foodie and care more about quality of food  than what's supposed to be cool or unique.

VERY clean, service high quality and food amount just right. My girlfriend and I came for lunch and thanks to awesome Ti, we got to try black sesame seed mochi. 
I wish I had chosen the larger size of meat since I'm pregnant and it seems as though I can eat a whole sometimes, but at the end of this I don't want to end up looking like one ;) so, I decided on the geisha size. 

Veggies variety was nice. Being a dark leafy green lover, I wish there were more of it, but I can eat that at home. 

Try the bubble gum flavor Japanese soda. Enjoy they way it opens ;)

Finally a bomb shabu place in Vegas!! I'm in love and so happy!! Me and my boyfriend eat shabu shabu a looott that when we moved here we were so disappointed because vegas didn't really have any good shabu places that after a while we just went and bought our own shabu pot and made it at home. I'm so glad they opened a location here! We had an amazing experience here. The service was amazing, manager and waitress and literally everyone were very attentive and so enthusiastic! 
Okay for food, Let me just say, you need to order their green tea chocolate fondue desert! It is delicioussss!! Also the salmon was sashimi grade so you can even eat it raw. They slice it thin, which I like. They are new so when we went they weren't able to serve alcohol yet but I can't wait to come back and try their drinks next time!! :)
Overrated japanese fondue place in summerlin...we've been to better shabu-shabu places in town like thousand much better...not worth it! Thumbs down...

Nothing beats yojies, nothing!!!!

After trying a many hot pot places, yojies is still number one and top of my list. No place beats their quality, service, and interior design. They pretty much figured it all out. While it may be on the pricier side, most hot pot places do charge a fairly high amount for their meats, but yojies definitely is worth your time for the experience you get.

I always crave this place when I think of meat. Better than kbbq, the meat quality is something that makes you want to keep coming back. Never dry, never hard. I love their sauces which are so delicious, goma and ponzu would be my sauces of choice. 

Unlimited rice, multiple veggies and noodles, this place will definitely fill you up right!

Been here twice and both times, the food no doubt was great but the service was poor. First time I went was during lunch time. Last summer. There was literally no one in the restaurant but yet it took so long for us (2 people) to get our food and even when I asked for a spoon it took a while. The vibe I was getting from the waitress was not attentive.

 Second time coming in was on Valentine's day at 8pm. 2 people left as I came in. While waiting for them to clean up it took them 15 mins before I got irritated and just walked myself over and sat down. Yes they were busy but they knew I was waiting there and didn't even acknowledge me to have a seat. Barely checked up on us and was attending to everybody else. Took so long to just get a check. I was in a hurry to leave for work. Again, asked for a plastic spoon and they took at least 5 minutes. I had told them I'm in a hurry! I made it known about the service by giving a small tip. The same waitress was there also. I honestly feel the girls there were unprofessional by their young sense of immaturity in service. 

This is the only shabu place in Vegas I would ever go to that can compare to the shabus in California. They need to polish up on their service if they want loyal customers.

Came here with my parents. Super cool modern place. The place is very clean and the staff was very helpful. This was my first time doing shabu shabu style and they taught me how to do everything. Very fun. Very delicious food. I ended up getting the Kobe meat. Soo good. I definitely recommend this place.

Yojiè is actually the first shabu shabu place that I have eaten at. I was excited to try it as soon as it opened. I have been here like four times and each and every time was excellent! 

The service is awesome! They really take the time to explain everything to first time swish swisher's lol. 

The food is amazing! My go to order is the combo plate with Yojiè's cut and the pork belly with sukiyaki! I always like to finish up all the meat with the rice first! Then I throw the whole bowl of veggies and noodles in the pot last and make some udon soup! It's so good! 

I like ending it with some chocolate fondue. That's always fun ! 

Just recently I went there and guess who was there!?! Jo Koy, the part owner and comedian! He was absolutely what made the night special. Jo Koy comped our dessert which was so nice of him. Not only is he funny but also a total sweet heart. 

Yojiè will always be my go to Japanese fondue place !

I had to come try this place. I've known Jo for over 10 years and always support him in all he does. The food was incredible. Anna was amazing as a server as well as all the staff there. Will definitely be coming back. The green tea white chocolate dessert was delicious!!!

ATMOSPHERE:  This place has everything that I enjoy about a restaurant.  Clean eating area, great music, not too loud, cool décor and sleek impressions.  It's a relaxed atmosphere without being too dull.  The only real thing that threw me off was that anime was playing on the tv screens (I came in on a Sunday, at least have some football on!)  But this is a really minor point because everything else was exceptional.

FOOD:  I've never tried shabu shabu before this visit.  Yojie was on my radar for a while but I finally was able to try it out.  I was with my girlfriend and we got the combo with Pork Belly and sukiyaki sauce.  The normal accompaniments (white rice, vegetables, noodles) were nice and fresh.  The meats themselves were cut really well and cooked super fast and tasted great with the sauce.  Trust me when I tell you the sauce was BOMB!  SO GOOD in fact that I'm still thinking about it now.  If you go, make sure to try the sukiyaki with the egg.  The egg is a must have with the meal.  We also got some mochi, which was a nice way to end the meal.

SERVICE:  Top notch service all-around.  I wish I would have gotten their names but our server was great.  She gave us a demo before we started, made sure everything was up to our standards and joked around with us a little bit.  Our other server gave us a rundown of the menu and what it all means (we were noobies).  I'd like to see how this restaurant does during a really busy time but I'll gladly take the service we got during the lunch hours.

I wanted to try this restaurant because 4.5 stars, I like vegetable shabu and I'm a Japanese from Japan.  I know what Shabu Shabu is. 
First of all, I order Cherry blossom tea.  It came with plastic infuser.  I immediate thought that was bad sign.. Restaurants that serve hot beverages in plastic containers have no idea how plastic harm our body.  I drank a little bit, it was just warm tea... The tea taste like Cherry Blossom tea from The Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf. 
Vegetable dish came next with a pot with water and a small piece of kombu in it. Water in the pot was much less than usual shabu shabu.  Some Nappa were already cut pieces but 3 giant leaves Nappas were in a middle of the dish on Udon noodles... A waitress asked me if I want scissors. I said no thank you because I was scared that if the scissors were used for meat to cut (I am a vegan) The giant Nappas were difficult to eat. 2 pieces of Shiitake Mushrooms cut halves so 4 pierces of them and 2 very small portions of Enoki Mushrooms (very very small). I expected more different kind of mushrooms. Some Harusame, some pieces of Tofu, 4 thin slice of carrots, some pieces of broccoli, some slices of onion, some wakame... 
And finally the important part, Tare (dipping sauce). I ordered Ponzu and Goma (sesame).  The waitress said Ponzu and Goma are house made so I thought must be good.  I dipped my vegetable into Goma.... It was very weird taste... Not even taste of goma... It was more like... taste of very bad broth and cheap miso... ok... I wanted to try ponzu next... The ponzu taste was weird too... I didn't taste of citrus like sour soy sauce... This is too like some kind of bad broth with something I don't know... I asked the waitress what the broth was.. She said Hondashi!!! OMG!!! This restaurant uses Hondashi!!! It contains bonito fish and lots of lots of MSG!!!! That's why the dipping sauce taste were weird, I didn't use them after I found out the broth.
May be this restaurant is good for non Japanese people. But you are Japanese, you know the shabu shabu, you have eaten real shabu shabu, or you like to eat real
shabu shabu, this is NOT real Japanese shabu shabu place to go. I'm sorry...  But it's true.. I really recommend that this restaurant owner should go to Japan and must eat shabu shabu so he/she knows what the real shabu shabu taste like. 
The waitress was nice so I gave 2 stars. 
I'm stick with Shabu Shabu restaurant I go regularly.
I also recommend that owner take down "Japanese" from name because this is not...
